description: A nice camping site next to the only clean river in Huehuetenango, further Zaculeu archaeological site. Directions: crossing the bridge to the left side there is a small groceries shop which belongs to this beautiful family. They sell tortillas, have meals and two simple toilets in the camping site area. The camping site is full of shadow and barbecues. It was a paradise for us!

name: Mc Donald's Free Wifi
description: Free wifi without password. Beautiful McDonald's nice garden and clean WC. no one annoys you on the way in/out

name: Casa Del Río- independent movie
description:
Excelente lugar para ver una película, el pequeño cine independiente es del simpático Fernando Martínez, tienen un pequeño bar y es un súper lugar para pasar un buen rato 
ndependent film cinema owned by Fernando Martinez super nice guy. A group of Overlanders came and meet here and he played a movie for us it was nice to relax and do something different he has a bar tok

name: Rancho Don Canche
description: Brand new restaurant with view of the river. Very friendly owner, speaks English.

name: shell gas station
description: we slept here with our motorhome. nice place, all paved. 24h security. small playground for the children. It's free but they will ask for a propina. we gave him 30 qtz. good place for one night on our way to Coban

name: In the forest of Oaxactun
description: We slept in the forest close to the village, one local woman showed it to us. Safe but close the door because of the animals.

name: bad road
description: From El Estor to this point very bad unpaved road. Update: the road was then paved only for 4km. Paved is only between Panzos and St. Catalina and last 15km, the rest is in very bad condition. With our 2wd it took us 6 hours from Agua Caliente to the  main road in St. Julian. The road was 5x blocked with a tree, we had to pay 1 or 2 quetzal to the people to let you go through as a contribution that they are trying to repair it.

name: Parking spot in AB group of Uaxactun
description:
We slept here one night, around just monkeys, safe, nice place in the ruins, free.
TIP: when you are driving through the Park entry, buy Ticket to Uaxactun, it cost only 50qz PP, then in Tical stop at the information centre, take for free the map of Tical, go to Administration building and ask for permit for the car to drive there, it is for free. Drive to Uaxactun, enjoy the ruins there alone and the local people, we stayed here 2 Nights and then in the morning Drive to Tical, 2 minutes before the barrier is on the left side a Restaurant. Park there and go to explore Tickal pyramids. And you saved 150qz PP ;-)

name: Caribe Motores S.A.
description:
We had to do some maintenance on our 77 air cooled VW. They repare air cooled cars and import brands. They did good work! The owner speaks German.

http://tallercaribemotores.com/

name: Soccer stadium, San Marcos
description: We were told we could park here overnight and that it was safe.  We did park for part of the day but opted to move on.

name: Parking by police/municipal office
description: A dirt lot to the left of station.  police said it was safe.  okay for night before climbing Tajumulco.  Police found us a sort of guide and ride to trailhead.

name: Lago Petén Itzá Biotopo Cahui Cecon
description: FREE beautiful spot for staying overnight, having a swim in the lake or having a fire (be careful during dry season). No one bothered us during our two nights we stayed here while visiting Tikal. Place is right next to a established campground (35qts per person) where the owner told us it would be safe to park here overnight, "but you never know". For us it was safe, quiet (besides the howler monkeys) and best spot to stay for free. Another group of overlanders joined us and also pitched a tent, no problems.

name: Shell station
description: ADMIN NOTE: User reports"Is not free anymore, it costs 50 quetzals. Gas station is not in operation at night and the gate is closed. "

name: Mt. Almolonga Parking Lot
description: Chilled out mountain village where people come from all over the world to hike and pray. Baños available till 7pm. 10Q to park for the night.

name: Oasis
description: Dorms, cabanas, camping. 30q for 1 person, 1 dog, 1 car to camp. Dogs not allowed in room. Dog must stay leashed. Most of the ground is uneven but there are a few ok spots. Parking is in a seperate area. beautiful view. happy hour 7-9.

name: veternarian for belize entry
description: after receiving the dog import permit from Belize, get the cert de salud/vet inspection here. vet speaks english.

name: side of the road
description: we slept here 1 night, good place to cook and rest with great view of the Lake and village, hot and noisy in the night

name: El paredon surf camp
description: Rafa super nice guy and owner , has rooms camping sith tents and a couple of spots for campervan , campervan is 40q pp , heaps of old surf mags to flick through , right on the beach , best time for surf rafa tells me is opposite most of the central america from nov - april

name: Tecpán Police Station
description: We stopped at the station to ask if it was a safe neighborhood to park our van on the street for the night, and they offered us a space in their parking lot free of charge. Super loud all night (dogs, people, cars) and not the prettiest area (lots of trash on the ground), but it's a safe spot to sleep. Right on the edge of a plaza where there's a market with food stalls.

name: Maya Mall Complex
description: Just over the bridge from Flores is a large mall complex with a supermarket and an official Tigo cellphone store. We got our SIM card from the very helpful staff in Tigo and then loaded up on groceries from downstairs market. You can even take a lancha directly from the supermarket to wherever you need to go on the lake!

name: Cool Beans
description: Great relaxed cafe on the water. Hammocks, wifi, full menu with breakfast served all day. Great selection of beers!  We stayed 4 hours using the Internet! Friendly staff.

name: Hacienda Pueblo Real, Tecpán, Guatemala
description: When it was obvious we wouldn't reach Panajachel at daylight, we tried at this huge restaurant/event center along the Panamerican. There is a watch tower with armed guard in the middle of the parking lot. At reception we asked whether we could stay, if we would eat. The manager speaks English. No problem, we were asked to park to the left, at an angle (space for busses). Diner was wonderful, mixed grill and a bottle of good wine. Price level is same as Europe (65 euro, diner for 2 with wine). But best steak since months! And it was our anniversary; so we had good excuse to spend. Night was quiet, toilets open during opening hours (very modern and clean).

name: Casa Las Canchitas
description:
Started in 2014, this establishment is a lovely best Bed & Breakfast hotel very close to the National Palace. Owned and operated by a Canadian couple who are extremely kind and helpful. They can only fit small vehicles in their courtyard, but there are at least two nearby public garages that can fit larger rigs (not sure about the max height). 

There are numerous nearby automotive part stores and shops so if you need some maintenance done, it's all nearby.

name: Ram marina
description:
First turn after Shell station going towards Honduras you can put a vehicle water electricity toilet shower hot water bbq restaurant small shop washing machine friendly home. 75Q/night.

premier chemin aprés la station Shell on peut mettre un vehicule eau electricite toilettes douche eau chaude bbq restaurant petit magasin machine a laver le linge
accueil sympa

name: Mar Marine Yacht Club
description:
First way after Shell station you can put a vehicle water electricity toilet shower hot water bbq restaurant small shop washing machine 50 qtz the night friendly home 


premier chemin aprés la station Shell on peut mettre un vehicule eau electricite toilettes douche eau chaude bbq restaurant petit magasin machine a laver le linge
50 qtz la nuit
accueil sympa
Very nice and well maintained yacht club on the river. Beautiful Pool, wifi, clean hot showers and toilets, Restaurant and Hotel Rooms. Washing Machine and Dryer. Very big rig friendly. 10 minutes walk to town. 100Q and 200Q for bigger rigs, friendly staff.

	
  First way after Shell station you can put a vehicle water electricity toilet shower hot water bbq restaurant small shop washing machine 50 qtz the night friendly home 

premier chemin aprés la station Shell on peut mettre un vehicule eau electricite toilettes douche eau chaude bbq restaurant petit magasin machine a laver le linge
50 qtz la nuit
accueil sympa

name: Restaurante Sarita del Rancho
description: On the parking of Sarita restaurant WC avalaible from 6 pm to 10 pm on the road side, a guard keep you all the night, you must stay front a camera, he want see you everytime, you canuse toilets and restrooms in opening hours of restaurant, water avalaible out side and small wifi

name: Balneario Las Cataratas
description: Waterfalls with large swimming area, playground, and a restaurant that is open on the weekends. A few small palapas with picnic tables and one large palapa with hammocks. Camping is in the dirt parking area or grassy soccer field for 50Q per person (children above 5 years old pay the same price), watch out for cow dung. Water is refreshing and cool, there are several jumping platforms and it's possible to jump into the pools from the top of the waterfall, small wooded trail we did not walk. Toilets and showers are OK. Stop at the building at turn off and ask permission to camp, cross a small creek then two farm gates to reach the site. The 22KM dirt road from the highway took us over an hour. Great quiet place. Cell service OK.

name: Antojitos Dolores
description: Menu includes tacos, burritos, tostadas, lasagna, ravioli, etc. Prices between 10-50Q.  Also serves cappuccino, cafe americano, smoothies, ice cream, chocobananas, and more.

name: Rough route - crazy curve
description: The road is quite bumpy and steep all the way but here is a really nasty curve. Very steep and lots of stones. We managed without 4x4, but might have been luck. Also it is only one lane going north and we are not really sure what happens if a truck needs to pass in the other direction (and there are trucks). Very scenic, though :-D Average speed on this road: 20 kph

name: refacciones rosme
description:
Parking next to the road in case you can not go down to campey. Ask for Martín. Safe place to leave the motorhome day and night. Just to shop in store. The bus to go costs 5 qz. 

aparcamiento al lado d la carretera por si no pueden bajar a campey.
preguntar por Martín.
lugar seguro para dejar la autocaravana día y noche.
solo hacer consumisión en tienda.
el bus para ir cuesta 5 qz.

name: Área Recreativa - El Ermate
description: Great place to hang in the shade and swim. Grassy flat area to lay out and a tree to hang a hammock. Beautiful public spot to eat lunch and relax. With one or two parking spaces. You could probably camp too. Though we just stayed for the afternoon. 100 meters down the road from restaurant/hostel Mon Ami.

name: tiera madre
description: Couple who runs a school for learning Spanish in the city center with accommodation including a large parking lot and closed . Both speak English. Everything takes place in a special ancient colonial hause frome  1988 ......  gabriela tel: 77616105   57296279

name: Hôtel San Gaspard
description: The cleanest hotel we found in Chajul, we got a room for 2 adults and 2 children for 120 quetzals. It is clean and have a gated parking. Nice views over this very traditional Guatemalan village. Market is on tuesday and Friday. The parking may not fit all vans, but our Gmc Safari did fit and it could be longer but only a bit higher. We visited other hotel but they were very rundown. If you want to camp, the gas station at the entry of the village told us we could spend the night there as they are open 24h.

name: Hotel Angel
description: Very nice and clean hotel with parking lot. We were looking for a campsite or place for overnight parking. Sleeping in the car is possible, but to use the bathroom, you need to pay for a room. The room is only 80 Quetzal so we booked it. Our car is on a safe, locked parking lot in front of our room. Good stop on the rough road to Semuc Champey, the town is beautiful and worth a visit. No wifi at the hotel but free wifi from the town itself.

name: Centro Medico Hospital
description: Good place if you need medical help. Clean private hospital with english speaking doctors.

name: Police Checkpoint
description: We were headed from El Ceibo to Flores - the police just waved us through and did not stop us.

name: Chajil Siwan (Parque Ecologico)
description: The offer  tent-camping in the forest.we ask if we can park  our toyota in the grass, the allowed, we paid 25 q pp, the place is not really level, the restaurant is open till 6pm, the gate is close in the night and the have a guard at the property.we could use the toilets.

name: Toyota Garage
description: A modern toyota garage, we ask for parts and the organized it for us from guatemala city in one day

name: parqueo glengy
description:
Ample parking for 20 qz 12 hours 40/24. Safe and quiet. To go to livinstong you can go to the village by bus for 3 qz. 

many lancha guys around  1st guy started at 800 for a private day to Livingston, etc. he later dropped to 500Q (after 10 am) another guy offered us a 3 hour  trip for Q300.  bargain a bit but seems like 4-500 for a day with a boat may be the going rate as of 11/2017

or bring a picnic and go eat near the castle it's super nice. or buy some fish inside the castle park. it wasn't that cheap but super tasty. (30Q) 

castle entrance in 25Q for adults and 5 for kids  you can go in and out if the park but only into the castle once tho Carlos (the guard) let my daughter and I in several times.

amplio parking por 20 qz 12 horas 40/24.
seguro y tranquilo.
para ir a livinstong se puede ir al pueblo en bus por 3 qz.

name: Very Sketchy Road
description: AVOID. GO THROUGH SAN JUAN DE DIOS INSTEAD. We were driving from El Ceibo to Flores when maps.me told us to take all 17km of this route through San Antonio. It's a dirt road in terrible condition. After driving very slowly for about 2km the road narrowed. Having seen dozens of folks with machetes and a few wanderers (who weren't working on fields and were digging through trash), we decided it was too risky. A local later told us that robberies occur all the time on this road.

name: panajachel
description:
Parqueo de los Colores. family run, grassy, flat parking lot with access to banos and cold shower. we paid 70Q for the night, but I got the feeling we could have got it cheaper if we'd haggled a bit (we later saw other parqueos for 50Q). wifi available in the cafe (on the road-side of the big building in the parking lot). I'm sure you could pitch a tent if you asked. It's set back from the main road into town so there is road noise. Gates locked at 10pm the night we stayed. 
Insanely huge parking lot. Can fit any size-height of vehicle. No amenities. Only toilets and cold showers. 3min walk from Calle Santander (the main semi-pedestrian avenue). We paid 50Q for a night (he was asking 70 initially). I guess you can bargain for less if you stay longer. They close the gate at 22:00 & open at 07:00. Super quiet place.

name: Parqueo
description: Small walled parking lot with banos. 50Q a night in the centre of town. Quiet after about 11pm. A German shepherd dog lives here, friendly with people but we don't have a dog so not sure how it would be with other dogs. Felt very safe. Toilets are clean and have paper (at least when we were there). Gates shut at 10pm.

name: Rincon Tipico
description: Must eat place in Antigua.  Daily plates that vary between roasted chicken and slow cooked meats. All plates served with a drink various sides and hand pressed thick tortillas.  Best during lunch.

name: Coffee Bloom
description: Awesome little cafe with really good coffee and nice staff. You get cookies to your coffee! They also have good wifi.

name: El Ecológico
description: Luis the owner is very kind. 90 q after negotiating. Wifi is fast, rooms are very basic but sufficient.

name: Fifth Dimension
description: Highly rated vegetarian place.  We had the spicy tandoori pizza (it's thin crust) and the chocolate peanut bar...both were great!

name: secluded beach
description:
You can park on the dirt road and head down the rock trail towards the lake. when you hit the water turn right and walk a few minutes until you find the little boat launch / beach. nice and quiet. Had no issues with my parking, but if concerned it's not too much of a walk from town.
photo upload, can't get multiple added. enjoy the lake!

name: Taller Perica
description:
Honest, cheap and very friendly. Only if you have light problems, if it is something very complicated perhaps it is not the best place. if you have a VW aircooled, this is the place! cel phone 41361437
 
Perica es muy honesto, barato y amigable! Si son problemas mecánicos simples te va a poder ayudar, si es algo muy complejo capaz no sea el mejor lugar. Fanático de Volkswagen y de las Kombis, ya vio a varios viajeros y a muchos atendió gratis.  Celular 41361437

name: GTM Dental Team
description: I needed some fillings and crowns done and arranged the appointment online.  GTM wants to become a dental tourist destination and is trying.  Prices are a quarter of prices in US.  Had 2 crowns, 3 fillings and an inlay down for less than $1200.  all done in six days.  parking is an issue if you are tall.  we parked on 25 avenida on the street.  staff friendly, Dr's speak perfect English and equipment on par with North America.  recommend.  Tel: 502 2221 7424 or US 305 938 0727.

name: Chez Daniel
description: a wonderful little B&B in a quiet part of town, breakfast included of course. the owner and staff are super friendly. there is place for two small rigs (we have a land rover defender with rooftop tent and had about 10cm to spare) if no parking is available you could park at the tourist police. this is the perfect spot if you want to visit Antigua and don't have an on board toilet or just want to have a luxurious stay at non luxurious prices. we paid 490q for 2 people per night(including all taxes), it's a bit more expensive than some of the hostels but then again those are hostels and this is a b&b.

name: Tropigas
description: on the main road ca2 out of esquinta is a tropigas.  Open Monday- Friday 7am to 4pm, Saturday 7am - 2pm. closed Sundays. 12Q/gallon. very friendly and helpful :)

name: Parking lot at the Centro Cultural y Deportivo
description:
It's a huge parking lot. No car as we stayed here. There is a police station (and nothing more) so we asked if we could stay. No problem so we parked directly in front of the guard house.
The parking lot of the big shopping mall nearby closes at 1am. So we had no chance there. One walks in less than 10 minutes to Flores and for a Saturday night it's now super quiet. We stayed in Santa Elena because our rig weights 8 tons. We saw a little sign at the traffic lights where you would pull in to cross the bridge saying 3,500 kg max. We are slightly over that ;)

name: Markus Vogel
description:
We met Markus at the gas station. His parents were German, but he was borne in Guatemala. Speaks German, English and obviously Español. His property is in San Felipe right at the Lake Izabal. Nice lush area with 2 houses. One building stands on poles over the lake which has a kitchen, one or two bedrooms  (not sure as we slept in our rig), shower, bathroom and small whirlpool. Beautiful spot to watch the sunrise.

We parked under coconut palms but there is also a grassy pit if you want sun. Dogs should be ok. Several boats that could be taken out on the lake. There is plenty of space to hook up a hammock or pitch a tent. 
Kitchen is fully equipped. Shower is cold but nice and refreshing, the lake in August is warmer. Very nice to swim there.

The Fort of San Felipe is 5 minutes away by foot. Collectivos from there to Rio Dulce or to the Finca El Paraíso. There are also caves close by.

If someone is interested to stay on his property drop him a note at
 markus2002gt@gmail.com or call him 5202-0545.  Clarify what you want and negotiate with him. We loved to chill out on the couches and watch the lake.

Price: 100Q's PP and 50Q's for electricity per day.

name: Hotel A Cabaña Del Viajero
description:
edit:quoted us $100Q to park and use hotel WiFi and shower. we said no thanks

This is the parking lot of a small hotel.  Felt really safe.  The owner is soooo nice!! She charged us 60 qtzles total for two people and a dog.  There is a nice pool and good wifi that we were able to pick up from our car in the lot.  If the small outdoor room isn't rented then you can use the bathroom with the shower - which is really nice and clean with hot water.  If the room is rented you can only use the bathroom in the restaurant which has no shower.  There is an outdoor sink as well.  The restaurant doesn't open until 8 at night so we didn't try it but it seems popular with locals.  Only room for one or two rigs at a time.  There is a dog that lives here - they were fine with our dog, too, but said their dog doesn't always like other boy dogs (ours is female) A boy dog probably wouldn't stop you from camping here but she is cautious about that.  We didn't ask for a power hookup but I believe for a small extra fee she would let you run an extension cord.  The church next door was SUPER loud  for a couple of hours and...energetic...but we were more entertained by it than annoyed.    I think they have had other people camp here but we seemed to be their first rooftop tent people and everyone here was pretty fascinated by it.

name: Shell Gas At Marina
description: Shell gas station at marina. Cross the bridge from Rio Dulce and take the turn for Nana Juana Marina. It's gated but just tell the guy you want to get propane at the Shell station and he'll let you in. Filled our 20 lb tank for $80Q. Not sure they'd fill fixed tanks because it's a short walk from the parking lot to where the propane is.

name: Mayachik Vegetarian Restaurant
description: Incredible and magical space hidden in locals neighborhood. The food is delicious and the owners very nice, just ask people in the street how to get there and they'll tell you.

name: Shell
description: We pay 25 quetzales to park here. We parked here during the day and can stay tomorrow as well when we go for a hike. No big trucks since 10pm. Of course it's louder as one wishes but it's in the city center and we did not find a better spot for our big truck.

name: centro turistico - cañon seacacar
description:
this is a natural preserve project in the middle of the jungle next to a nice river (4.5 km off hwy). there's a camping area for tents and they have two guestrooms in the main building (Q150/p). the rooms are very clean and there is a super nice bathroom (clean and good water pressure). you can use the fully equipped kitchen. very nice people and a cute little mayan village. we parked our car next to the "road" and it was very safe. it's not possible to sleep in the car but we can really recommend the guestrooms.

the only negative thing: there are lots of spiders - but that's the jungle... and if they know you are afraid they will remove them for you, even in the middle of the night ;)

to take a bath in the river you pay Q25/p. to go to the caves (10 minutes walk) you pay Q50/p.

how to get there: approximately 15 km after the finca paraiso you can see a sign "cañon seacacar" on the right side of the road. it's a small dirt road with an open gate. the first part is easy but then it gets pretty steep. 4x4 required. just follow the road and the signs. it's about 4.5 km to the camp.

more information: www.riosguatemala.com

name: Automotiv Servicio
description: Business owners and mechanic spoke perfect english. Got our brakes done, oil change, tire rotation and tire repair. The owners lived in the United States for a long time and have a US-type place. also have a principle mechanic for bigger repairs if needed.

name: Agua Viva
description: Fills garrafones for $10Q have a hose to fill tanks if desired. we filled at the gas station for free - see next post

name: Casa America
description: A clean and cosy large room with secure parking for vehicles up to 2.5 ish metres high. Rooms with private bathroom and tv Wi-Fi and small fridge for 250q/n. Call Julio 53924486.

name: Mirador Volcán Pacaya y Volcán de Água
description: It's over the Lago Amatitlán with a great view. You can also stay for the night. It's a big spot perfektly for larger rigs.

name: Camping under Cabanas
description: We paid 50 quetzal to use the cabin and the guard allowed us to set a tent under the shelter if we don´t make fire. Nice and calm. The lake is very beautiful. There are toilets but closed overnight

name: Direccion General de Migration (Extranjeria)
description: To extend your tourist visa before your temporary import permit for your vehicle

name: Buddy Bear Hostel
description:
Clean and cheap hostel, run by a very friendly family. Private room 45Q per person, bedrooms to 35Q.Parking, kitchen, wifi and hot water.


Limpio y económico hostal, llevado por una familia muy amable. Habitacion privada 45Q por persona, dormitorios a 35Q.Parking, cocina, wifi y agua caliente.

name: Hotel Y Restaurante Monteverde
description:
The manager, Antonio, is very friendly, letting us sleep in the private parking for 20 Q (in low season) with shower and bath. There are private rooms with fan for 150Q and air conditioning for 200Q. They have a restaurant. At the moment they do not have wifi


El encargado, Antonio, es muy amable, nos dejó dormir en el parking privado por 20 Q (en temporada baja) con ducha y baño. Hay habitaciones privadas con ventilador por 150Q y con aire acondicionada por 200Q. Tienen restaurante. De momento no tienen wifi

name: Samsara vegetarian restaurant - wifi
description: Great food! They have lots of veggie and vegan food options. they also have killer smoothies with not your typical ingredients.  Right beside the gym. The quinoa porridge and tumeric eggs were great...see pics.

name: Casa Del Sol
description: Simple rooms with shared bathrooms and kitchen. Paid $19/night plus $5 cleaning fee.  Register through Airbnb owner is quick to respond. Unfortunately no parking on site but there is a secure lot across the street, low entrance.

name: Chocomuseo
description:
Chocolate "museum" including a decent cafe. Not really a museum, just more of a shop with lots of chocolate samples and some details of the chocolate making process from the staff. 

They have chocolate making classes too.

name: Lavanderia Econo
description: Lavanderia. 35Q for a full load, washed, dried and folded. Was ready in 3 hours.

name: Patzun, la cascada
description: water, agua purificada,5q for a big bottle

name: El Manantiel Hotel
description: Asked to park in their parking lot for the night. 80q. 1/2 block from lake.

name: Mister Jon's
description: Restaurant with full breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Also decent beer selection. We had omelettes for breakfast, ranging from 35-60Q, served with hash browns, fruit, and toast or muffin. Coffee is 8Q (serve Crossroads Coffee).

name: Hotel Villa Cuba
description: Nice hotel, out of town with garage for motos. No parking for rigs apart from on the street. Friendly owners. Our room, over the garage, with private bathroom had a lake view and use of basic kitchen. All for 120Q or 100Q for 3 or more nights.

name: Landrover Specialist
description: Landrover specialized mechanic from Canada. Can do work on other brand vehicles too so definitely worth to ask!

name: Posada Santa Rosa
description: This place is very simple but clean and comfy. Spacious rooms where we paid 75Q pp so 150Q for a large two double bedded room with private bathroom and hot water. Actually hot water! Secure parking which they lock from sunset. Wifi a bit ropey but otherwise a nice place. A big water dispenser is available for drinking.

name: Hotel Pelicanos Surf Place
description:
Mod note - Location now correct

50Q for 2 People sleeping in a Van. We could use the restrooms, showers, pool & hammocks

name: Community Spanish School
description:
This school offers 1 on 1 or 1 on 2 instruction, and is well worth the price. This school is owned by teachers who branched off another school and created their own.  All teachers speak some English, which we have found to be very important. They offer homestays. For us they seemed expensive at first but they are a huge help in continuing to learn the language once you have left class.  We started class knowing very little Spanish and after 4 weeks left being able to maintain a conversation. 

We took classes for 4 weeks with Selvin and would both highly recommend him as a teacher.  He has a ton of experience was very organized with his material.  Just being a native speaker does not make you a good teacher.  I was obvious that Selvin put a lot of time and energy into how he teaches certain concepts and the language as a whole.

We stayed at the home of Julio and Vila (the house of the Black Sheep). We recommend asking for them specifically.  They were incredibly welcoming, friendly, fun and went out of their way to help us learn Spanish.  Vila is hilarious and jokes around a lot. Julio is an English teacher in the local schools. He is also very knowledgable about the history of the Mayan people and the area.  They have two very sweet boys who do a good job helping you with your Spanish. We truly felt like we were part of their family. 

If you are looking for a place to stop and learn some Spanish we highly recommend this place.  Very friendly people and well trained teachers.

name: Pappy's BBQ
description: Great BBQ and the best French fries we have had in Central America, 58Q for the pulled pork plate with 2 sides.

name: Organica Health Food
description: Health food store with organic groceries, soaps, personal care products, etc.

name: Automotriz Europea
description: German Guatemalan owned workshop working on European vehicles. We took our Mercedes Hymer here to have work done. Juergen, the owner, speaks great English and Spanish. He said we could stay in the yard for a few nights.You can call or what's app him on +50252035081. 150Q /hour. Delicious, very rustic cafe up the dirt lane just up from the workshop :)

name: Rabin Ajau
description: 240Q for 2 people in a double room. Includes breakfast or dinner (your choice). Strong Wi-Fi in restaurant, weak Wi-Fi in room. Warm-ish showers. Secure gated parking. Overall nice place and centrally located

name: Turn Off To Trail Up Volcano
description: Directly across from the road up the volcano is a store. They have a couple of beds above. Very basic but for 25Q who cares

name: Restaurant Chinese, Parking
description: A very nice owner of the Chinese Restaurant. He let us park for the night  behind the House for free after we had Diner in his Restaurant. Very big plate for about 40 Quetzal. Clean toilets at the Restaurant.

name: Camping at the bridge
description: Nice grass area right after the bridge. we paid 20Q for 2 people and a van and could camp at the river. No facilities

name: Fray Bartolomé Gas Station
description: It's a gas station near the cross of the road to Chempey Semuc. They have security guard at night and toilets. They charged us 10 quetzales per one night. We were 2 people + 1 dog

name: Orquigonia - Ecological Reserve
description:
Really nice place. It's an orquids ecological reserve where they have hundreds of diferent types, most of them miniatures. The entrance is 30 quetzales per person and includes a guided tour, a documentary about their work and a tea from a local cooperative. They Also have a couple of cabañas but We don't know the price. The owner is a Kombi lover very friendly who gave us some help about what was going on with a wierd noise on our westy. Totaly recomended.

Beautiful campground in the middle of an orchids forest. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Definitely one of the nicest campings we've been to in Central America.

name: Bus Stop To Lanquin
description: From here you take the bus to Lanquin. 25 quetzales per person

name: Eco Hospedaje
description: cheap quiet place with clean rooms , Q30 pp.  shared bathroom and toilet . no wi-fi

name: San Cristobal Gas Station
description: Near the border of San Cristobal. Security at night. Very friendly guards. Toilets. Price: free

name: Gas Station/truck stop
description: Large truck stop with mini restaurant. Ask about parking for the night and pay the night guard a tip (10-15qz). Safe place, but noisy and busy. There are nice toilets that are free to use. A soccer field next to the station brings in locals in the evening.

name: Restaurant parking lot
description:
parking lot of Hacienda San Rafael. It's a restaurant or event centre sometimes on weekends. I stayed for two nights midweek. Could use toilet inside restaurant but you need to call the (very friendly) groundskeeper every time. He sleeps on the premises which is the only kind of security, but I was promised it was safe.
It's right by the Panam 2km north of Asunción Mita, can't miss it.
Cesar, the manager/dad has travelled a lot and is very welcoming.
Some traffic noise, pretty level, no shade, breezy, nice view, free.

name: Old Town Outfitter
description: Here you can find primus tank for your mobile stove. They are expensive (10 dollars) but be aware that you won't find anymore anywhere till costa rica!

name: El Mastil - Quincalleria - Gas Canisters
description:
Here you will find amongst different types of tools and brico the cheapest gaz tank-bottles for your mobile stove (13q). Don't go to Old town outfitter as the guy was lying saying we won't find any cheaper than at his shop (73q). 
Be aware that you won't find any gaz for mobile stove anywhere till Costa Rica!

name: Horacio's
description: These guys are horrible. Stole a bunch of my money and didn't deliver the promised work. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

name: Hotel La Ceiba
description: clean room's for 50 Q , no wi-fi

name: Z GAS
description:
Possibility of refueling tanks integrated. Closed at 2 pm and Sundays open from 7 am to 1 am. 11 qtz the braid.


possibilité de faire le plein en gas des tanks intégrés. fermé à 14h et le dimanche ouvert de 7h à 1oh. 11 qtz le galon.

name: El Pacific Surf House
description:
Great owner, his name is Greg Wida. He speaks Spanish, French, and English. He's a surfer, helped a lot with everything, and chilled a lot with us. Great place with freshwater showers, two big pools with fun slides for kids, shady under trees but plenty of space for bigger rigs and sunny spots to charge, bbq places, and he serves local food at his restaurant on site.
He has boards for rent and he gave a couple of surf lessons. It's a nicely paved road all the way, 10m walk into the waves, just across a quiet street is the beach.
.............................
hôtel restaurant avec piscine lieu pour tentes et camping car de 2000m2 lieu privatif totalement ombragé avec 2 piscines dont l'eau est changée tous les 3 jrs!! 2 toboggans et une tyrolienne aquatique,rampe de skate. Barbecue. juste en face de l'océan petite route à traverser. Vida un jeune françaisvous accueille avec plaisir et parlé anglais espagnol. passionné de surf,il donne des cours.
-Chambre à prix accessible avec ou sans climatisation 
-resto avec ts les plats à 60 Qts  (cevitche  caldo pescado. ..)
- entrée pour tte taille de camping car 80qts + 20 pour l'électricité et possibilité de charger en eau.
Route goudronnée jusqu'au bout.
-animaux acceptes

name: Restaurant Donde Maquel
description:
Great restaurant. Cheap. Pretty with swimming pool. Possibility to stay there night free. WiFi correct. Closed gate quite close to the road but surely the best place on this road! Big rigs up to 24 feet without problem


Super restaurant.  Pas cher. Joli avec piscine. possibilité de rester là nuit gratuitement.  WiFi correct. Portail fermé assez proche de la route mais sûrement le meilleur endroit sur cette route! Big rigs jusqu'à 24 pieds sans problème,pour les poilus grands à voir avec le patron

name: Flat land by the highway
description:
Large flat grassy terrain by the highway just out of Chicaman.
Fenced-in, but open at night. Seems to belong to a construction company (at least there was some machinery parked). Friendly lady living in the shacks on the premises said it was okay to camp. Seems perfect to pop a tent. Toilet outhouse is there but didn't ask about it.
Quiet all day, easy access, level, no shade, no infrastructure. I hid behind the wooden building (little hill) so I was out of sight from highway. Felt safe. Free.

name: Parque Nacional El Rosario
description: Camping area of small park, next to a lagoon, right off the highway. Howler monkeys, mosquitoes, friendly rangers. All shade, no sun, very humid. Not many level spots. Heavy rigs might want to stay in the parking lot (not bad either) as ground is very soft (grass/mud) (Update 08/2021: Ground was not soft at all, parked on the grassy lot marked with area de camping). Perfect for tents and vans, no height restriction. Fixed price 25Q ppn.

name: Cactus Taco Shop
description: Stopped in for dinner on a Thursday. Great ambiance, live music, cervezas $2-$3USD (11 options), food $5.5-$6.50, specials $9-$10. We got the shrimp taco & shrimp burrito - both SO good & filling. The beers were ice cold. Coming back for more!

name: Shell
description:
Calm. Guarded and free. Possibility to connect to electricity (ask the guard). Clear water on tap and Wi-Fi very average


Calme. Gardé et gratuit. Possibilité de se brancher à l'électricité  (demandez au garde). Eau claire au robinet et Wi-Fi très moyen

name: Antigüeña Spanish Academy
description: Excellent school to learn Spanish. My husband & myself never took Spanish in school before & this place got us speaking Spanish well! I worked with Emi & my husband with Luis & we both could not recommend them more! Both excellent teachers & flexible schedules. Great price & location. In a garden or in the office.

name: GreenGo's Ho(s)tel
description:
The soon-to-be world famous hostel located inside the most beautiful place you could imagine. It's surrounded by green mountains, and they've managed to build the craziest constructions out here, giving you a down to earth feeling as everything is ecological. This place is hands down the best hostel we've ever been to. Not only do they serve great cheap food, but the showers are hot and the tours you can do in the area is nothing but amazing fun and stunning.

If you want to go here with your vehicle, it needs 4x4 or you won't stand a chance. We drove our motorcycles on the dirt road leading to this place, and then drove them down the staircase to the hostel from the parking spaces for big overland vehicles.

Google this place for pictures. No outside food or drinks on the premises, don't worry the food is really good and cheap.

70q for a dorm bed
200q for private house
30q for house breakfast
50q for dinners.
60-160q for the tours

name: Motorcycle service and mechanics
description:
Repairs and fix the following brands: Suzuki, Yamaha, Harley Davidson, Honda and KTM. Can get most parts and do welding as well as other fixes. Repaired my shattered brake caliper and reinforced the frame.

Telephone: 4494-8598
Adress: 40 Ca. "C" 13-09 Z. 8

name: Hotel Sac-Nicte
description: Economic hotel in pricey area. 100Q/night for one person. Room is no frills: small tv, ceiling fan, table. Single faucet so no hot water.  WiFi only in the lobby. Staff is nice.  Secured parking lot.  Some street notice depending where you room is located.

name: Guate Java
description:
Small little coffee bar with a few bar stools and a couple of couches. They speak English well and the prices are decent. They have a small selection of coffees and teas as well as cookies and Italian sodas. They also sell their coffee by the bag. 

Wifi was measured at 7.49Mbps down and 1.02Mbps up with both my girlfriend and I's laptops and phones connected as well as the two worker's phones and laptop connected as well as music streaming. 

We paid ~Q40 for a cookie, a Cinnamon White Mocha, and an ice tea. 

The only downside is the road noise.

I'd come back again.

name: Salud Para Vida Health Food Store
description: A small store with harder to find health food including vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free foods, body products, a decent bulk section, essential oils, and supplements.

name: Muelle jardin- boat park
description:
Simple boat park. Close at 8 pm. 50 Q a night. With electricity. 
Restrooms. 
Wifi but i arrived to late to ask the password

name: Johanna's Tienda
description: Carries cheeses, meats, wine, dry goods. Cheapest prices we could find in San Pedro for large packages of coconut oil, raw almonds, and raisins.

name: Gasolinera Shell "Los Mangos"
description: Stay here for one night, Donald the owner and the personal is very friendly. Restrooms, Power, non portable water available for free. Little Store also Gas and Diesel, very cheep.

name: Casa Jacaranda
description: Nice clean, friendly hostel. Courtyard in the back. small private room w shared bath was 90Q. Breakfast included. No parking but they let me roll my moto into the lobby.

name: Santa de Fátima Church
description: we were passing through on Christmas day and couldn't find lodging. the gate was open so we drove up, spoke with one of the caretakers and told him our situation. he pointed to a level grassy area that we were able to park our truck on and sleep in the vehicle. they were extremely nice, as were most of the people we met in guatemala. we did offer a donation to the church in thanks for a safe spot to sleep close to the honduras border. there was a bathroom they let us use and a couple small beds that were offered, but we didn't take them up on that.

name: 24 Gas and convenience
description: Gas station with parking. Washrooms inside convenience store. Ask to park for the night. Not the most quiet but the store is open 24 hours and there's security guard.

name: Multiservicios Blanqui
description: Very eager mechanic and welder. Fair prices and good work

name: Meme's workshoo
description: Extra large and well stocked workshop with welding, Diesel and petrol mechanics, electrical, greasing, tire shop, everything! Very nice management (Carlos Chacón) Tel.: +502 79489652

name: Hotel and Restaurant Montebello
description: Clean room, hot water, restaurant opens at 6:30, Biotopo del Quetzal s a few km S of the hotel.

name: Hostal Antigueno
description:
As stated in the description of the hostal, overlanders are more than welcome here. We were referred by a fellow overlander and stayed more than a week and we had a perfect time. We paid 50 QTZ per bus and per night  and we could use the showers, bathrooms, wifi and the relax area. Christian (the owner) helped us with a great volcano tour and his wife bakes the most delicious cookies. The fridge is well equipped with both local and international beers and the chef can prepare a decent meal. Well recommended for small to medium-sized cars. He will even try to fit in bigger cars on his spacious parking space in the future. So call or email when in the neighbourhood: hostalantigueno@gmail.com +(502) 42506511
Update November 2022: 50q per person

name: The Guitar Hotel
description: Nice small family hotel directly on the wonderful beach of Hawaii Montericco. Very nice and clean Pool with Jacuzzi. Freddy, the owner, speaks English and would be happy to welcoming you. On weekends is good to make a reservation: info@hotellaguitarra.com

name: El Barrio
description: It's still 40 Q and the brunch is huuuuuuge ! 4 big courses : a big bowl of fruits, a vegetables soup, a big plate of eggs, potatoes, bread and 2 pancakes with syrups. All you can drink coffee and tea. Super tasty! Super nice staff. We didn't ate for the rest of the day.

name: Tecún Umán Border Post
description: 160Q is the cost of TIP (good for 3 months) for a camper Van, 38Q for fumigation: total cost to enter Guatemala from Mexico. Copies of passport, drivers license and registration plus copies of the Guatemala stamp and some others after you pay at the bank. Copy store just across of Aduana (has a sign for foto store, ask the guys on tricycles to tell you) 1Q per page). All good but very slow. (Plus 17 mexican pesos for auto or 8 pesos for moto for crossing the bridge at the mexican side).

name: Roundhouse
description:
Very nice hostel/cabanas on the river. Only accessible by boat. Beds/rooms very reasonably priced, especially given the gorgeous setting. Food and drinks also well priced (10q for a beer, 50q for communal dinner). No internet, but electricity to charge gadgets.

Livingston was a hole, but finding this place made it worthwhile.

name: Hotel La Guitarra
description: From Sunday till Friday they offer their Parkinglot to Overlanders. Nice place directly on the beach with a huge palapa, clean toilets and an outdoor-shower (water a bit salty). Also nice and clean is the hotel-pool right behind. Don't know about the normal price, because we had a special arrangement. Freddy and Katy, the owners, are friendly and honestly. Keep in mind, that Montericco Hawaii is the holiday-place for the rich people from Guatemala City, so nothing is cheap. Freddy speaks English and Katy is an excellent cook. The place is crowded on weekends, but not as loud as a saturday night in Mexico. If you have to leave the parkinglot for the weekend, you can find a place beside the dirt road. The village is safe and quite. Like everywhere in Guatemala you will find rubbish on the beach.

name: Restaurante Taqueria Siloe El Capulinar
description: Excellent little restaurant on the road between El Remate & Tikal. Great for a feed after you've spent hours exploring Tikal but don't want to eat at the expensive tourist restaurants at the site. We had excellent and filing chicken fajitas for 35q each.. they were amazing! Also you can park your vehicle right in front near where you are sitting.

name: Sundog Cafe Rio Dulce
description:
Swiss-owned Restaurant. Very nice location directly on the waterfront. Good food and drinks at decent prices (the pizzas are to die for). WiFi available. Worth a visit! Open, Wednesday to Monday, 11.30am til 9pm.

Also, the kids working here are very helpful with organizing water taxis to the hotels along the river or to Livingston. You can also safely park your vehicle here for a couple hours.

name: Hotel Rio Dulce
description: We got a room with fan for 120Q for two people (though a notice at the door says max 100Q for one and 170Q for two people). Safe parking and wifi at site. If you're sensible to noise this might not be a place for you, it's right next to the bridge where semi trucks pass by with engine break. And at dusk and dawn the birds in the trees are having a party. Otherwise cheap and decent.

name: Sun Breeze Hotel
description: Nice cheap hotel, clean, comfortable, well presented rooms, great location. Double room was 150Q. Secure parking.

name: El jardin
description:
Wowwwww ! What would I say more ! So perfect place with 3 pools( one for little kid) a restaurent, playground for childs, they do laundry hot showers and more .. so quiet place.. when we was there we we're the only guest so .. very quiet !
We could park the rv in the secure parking with security guard. It cost 100 quetzal per night. I 
The owner and is wife are so sweet. And alllll the staff are helpful .. 
Very a good place . I would recommend very much !!

name: Estancia de la Virgen
description: Probably the best hotel in town (that's not saying much!). good secure parking around the back suitable for big vehicles. clean although dated rooms. option for a/c. warmish water in the shower. has a restaurant we had breakfast for 22q eggs, beans etc and coffee. decent place if you need a stop on the way through. didn't ask about camping or staying in a vehicle. 160q for a double room with no air-conditioning.

name: Giant Mall
description: This place has all name brand stores and more. I'm sure if your looking for something it might be here. Walmart is across the street. Loads of banks/ATM. Bigest Walmart I have been in.

name: Llanresa
description: We got our front wheel bearings inspected, packed and reinstalled. they also helped me find a noise that I was having trouble finding in my front end on bumpy roads. helpful, friendly, and fast. Fair price and I was able to watch as they did all work.

name: Hotel y restaurante costalinda
description: Pool, shower, restaurent, secure with a fence, a little bit expensive 200qtz just for park the rv for a night but we need to stop for the night so ok !!

name: Lavanderia Antigua
description: 5Q per pound. Enough space to park your car outside.

name: Hotel Central
description: Nice hotel right in the middle of town. We paid 230Q for two people. Secure parking (large vehicles would fit), ok wi-fi, amazing super hot shower :-D!

name: Hotel Diamante Ixil
description: Decent, centrally located hotel with nice rooms and large private secure parking (large rigs should fit). Rooms with shared bathroom cost 80Q and those with private bathroom are 100Q for two people. The man running the hotel is very nice and speaks very good English. The rooms at the top have nice views of the surrounding hills. No wi-fi. Hot water.

name: El Descanso Restaurante
description: Great place for breakfast, lunch or dinner! The standard eggs, frijoles, bread and cheese was about 22Q, dinner dishes ranged from 25Q to 40Q (lots to choose from, burritos, fajitas, fried rice, local food, nice cakes etc). Good food, good value, good vibe. Right next door you can book a hiking tour around the Ixil region (highly recommended!).

name: Parque de los Volcanes
description: A nice park by the river with picnic area and hiking trail. Good place to make lunch and hang out for a few hours.

name: Playa Hawaii
description: We enjoyed 4 days 3 night of undisturbed free wild camping on the beach right next to the river mouth which happen to help form some surfable little waves. No facilities. Just a handful of fishing boats, and large pigs. Don't leave anything with food in it out. First night we were woken twice to the pigs trying to open our food box. Once we started to put it back in the truck all was quite at night. To get on/off beach you need 4x4. Zero shade. To get here drive down the main road tell it runs into the river, turn to the beach. We enjoyed this little spot so much we will return! Had 4G Tigo most of the time. It cuts out in the middle of the day for a few hours.

name: Hotel Tikal
description:
Hotel with large parking. 150Q double room. 25Q for 24h parking. WC 2Q but negotiated free. Hot shower 10Q. Perfect place to leave your camp and go by bus to Chichicastenango. The bus that goes there is right in front and costs 5Q.


hotel avec grand parking sécurisé. 25Q pour 24h de stationnement. WC 2Q mais négocié gratuit. douche chaude 10Q. endroit parfait pour laisser son camper et aller en bus à Chichicastenango. Le bus qui y vont sont juste en face et coûte 5Q.

name: Cheapest Gas Don Arturo
description: At this moment gas is 2.5 Q cheaper then we have seen in all of Guatemala.  Average price is 22.50-26.50Q. Here it is 20.59. Bathrooms,  and free coffee! Big open flat area, maybe you could camp to. If your headed to the Lake you will have to take the returno 100 meters past the station.

name: Quetzalroo
description: Great small hostel with secure parking for free. Payed 80 Quetzla GTQ for one night in a dorm room with breakfast (fruits, toast and coffee). Internet was fast, showers are warm and neighborhood is very quiet and safe.

name: Motopolis - Motorcycle Workshop
description:
New location: 10A Ave. 14-73, Zona 10
We've been in the "old" location, they move at the 1th February 2017. The team is very helpful and friendly. We could do a lot of things by ourself and they helped us if we needed some help. We need to change our sprockets and the chain. They spoke also english, which was a plus. Payed only a little fee. 
Highly recommend to go to Motopolis if you have to do something on your bike. Check out there website http://motopolis.com.gt/ or facebook.
We've been at first at the BMW Workshop and we couldn't talk to the mechanic - it was not allowed...

name: Casa Perico
description:
Great hostel/hotel to stay. It's running by some swiss guys. It's in the middle of the jungle and very quiet and special. You can relax there for a few days. We payed 60Q for a dorm. 
You can also do a daytrip to Livinstone for 200Q.
Showers are cold, internet is good and the stuff is very friendly - the speak spanish, english and german. 
It can be reached by boat only, so they will pick you up in the village with our shuttle boat. Arrival and leaving are free of charge for our hotel guests.
Any additional roundtrip to the village to Rio Dulce: Daytime 25 Q - after 8 p.m.: 40 Q
The "SunDog" Cafe or "Bruno's" Hotel/Restaurant will call the shuttle boat for you - you can also storage the motorbike/car there. 
See post at Sundogcafe.

name: Lavanderia Express - Laundry
description:
20Q per load (5kg) for wash and dry
the shop entry is in the small street, there is a sign

name: Auto Mike
description:
Trustworthy mechanic.

Owner explains things which need to be done, before starting, by using an online translater for English.

name: Dos Americas Bungalows
description: 158Q for a double room with kitchen & private bathroom. 90Q for one person. Plenty of space for motos, not enough for big rigs. Can fit only one car probably. Quiet & clean little hotel about 10' away from centro.

name: Hotel San Jorge
description:
Very nice hotel with secure parking and close to everything. Only $ 45 us. Very clean.


Très joli hôtel avec stationnement sécuritaire et près de tout. Seulement 45$ us. Très propre.

name: La Torre Supermercado
description: well sorted supermarked, general parking.

name: Hotel Portal del Occidente
description:
Hotel very clean and very good. For $ 35 us. Resto ok but nothing extravagant. Secure parking and good wifi.


Hotel très propre et très bien. Pour 35$ us. Resto ok mais rien d'extravagant. Stationnement sécuritaire et Bon wifi.

name: Hotel Villa Real
description:
Hotel very close to the starting point of the Tajumulco trail. Don Abigail provides secure parking for campers at 30Q per vehicle (which we used). Water available, did not ask for electricity but there is a plug in the parking lot. Hotel accomodation is 50Q per person. 
Right next to the road, so traffic noise  (was tolerable at night).
Owner can organise a guide for the hike, also with horses (around 350-400Q guide + horse overnight trip).
Phone number on the sign is incorrect, correct is 57608022.

name: Casa De Coco With Adolfo
description:
Adolfo no longer lives here, he left his family, but María Luisa and the children are still here doing coconut oil and avocado workshops and hosting people and doing immersive lifestyle hosting in their humble home
 20quetzals for a night to stay with the family. 15-20quetzals if you want feed.
 You could camp in the yard thou the house is fine if you can handle living like a rural Guatamalan with pit toilets & a shower sort of.
They also offer classes in Coconut & Avocado oil making.
Big family, all extremely friendly. They have people coming & going all the time. Also good place to learn Spanish, the mom & kids know English.
 It's easiest to WhatsApp Adolfo ahead of time. +50232198537. I put the number in photos too.

name: Automecanica Ventura
description: Great mechanic. Ask for Hector, the owner.  They are able to scan new computerized vehicles.

name: Balneario
description:
A local natural Swimmingpool on the river. About 500 m off the mainroad on gravel. 
Very beautiful. 
We travel with bicycles so I'm not sure if they allow Campervans, but I guess so. 
We paid 25 Q per Person.

name: Balneario
description:
A local Swimmingspot 1km off the road. There is a sign on the road. There is a drop toilet, some wooden tables and some roofs where you can pitch a tent under. Enough space for campervans I guess. But we travel with bicycle, so haven't tried that. 
Entry costs 10 Q for adults, 5 for kids under 10.

name: Mirador Juan Dieguez Olaverri
description: super schöne Aussicht auf Huehuetenango, Altiplano und mehrere Vulkane

name: Panajachel Agua Purificada
description: 8Q for 20lt. We were able to fill up our truck camper... they had an extra hose we could use.  NOTE- they did not offer us a hose when ours was too short

name: Suzuki Motos Guatemala
description: Suzuki Motorcycle shop. They had all parts on stock that I needed for my DR650. Also the workshop service team is very friendly. I had concerns about my stator/regulator and they checked my electrics immediately and didn't charge anything (everything was ok on the bike). The service manager Oscar Quintanilla was very welcoming and they also took care of my buddy who had to wait.

name: Kaffee Fernando's
description: Great coffee, relaxing patio, shop for chocolate, coffee and more. Some locals say it's the best coffee in town! Wifi available. Named for the owner's cat! Less expensive than man other similar cafes.

name: Hecho en Casa
description: Small and cosy restaurant with good Sandwiches and Quesadillas for only 15Q and Hamburger for 22Q! A very good deal for expensive Antigua. Wifi available. A Locals place!

name: lavanderia Arcoiris
description: laundry 35qzd/ load for washing and drying. very friendly guy!

name: Hospedaje Caballero
description: Very nice and clean rooms. Paid only 100 Q for a doble with hot shower and WiFi.

name: Parking "Bienvenido" for Santa Maria Volcano
description:
Good parking option for hiking the Santa Maria volcano. There is a gated parking lot where you can leave your vehicle as you hike the volcano. hike is steep and at some points difficult terrain.
took us 3 hours up.
Amazing views. if you are lucky you can see Volcano Santiagos small eruptions.
you can also camp up top or in one of the fields. 40Q per night.

name: Hospital Veterinario Petcetera Poptun
description: Competent vet with good equipment and nice people .. if you have an issue with your pet(s).

name: Hôtel Centenario
description:
Un Hotel simpático 150Q con 2 camas dobles o 100 con una cama doble con ventilador TV y Wifi, parking seguro que cierra a las 9 pm
Y una pequeña piscina en medio de las habitaciones.

name: garage
description: purchase bands reflective and Triangle safety

name: Car ferry from Sipacate to El Paredon
description: 100Q per car. Also plenty of just people ferry boats.

name: Hotel Tolimán
description:
Amazing hotel, with great staff. It has large secure parking, pool, wifi, and breakfast is included. We hiked the volcanos and camped on one for a night. The staff arranged a guide and let us leave are motorcycles parked for the night free of charge. 

Price for one night is 65us for a room with two beds,two people.

The town is very quiet compared to the rest around the lake.

name: Car Ferry El Paredon to Sipacate
description:
Car Ferry El Paredon to Sipacate 
100Q...fun!

name: Balneario el Boqueron
description:
Here you can go with a small boat into the canyon. it's 20 qtz/p. And the 
trip is about half an hour. It's really worth to stop here. the Entrance to the balneario is 10 qtz/pand 10 qtz for the vehicule. for camping It's 50 qtz/ nicht. we didn't sleep here. we just had oud picknick here. There is also a playground for the kids.

name: Hotel Y Turicentro Paola
description:
This place is decent for a night's stopover. We decided to stop here to avoid driving through Guatemala City late at night. Wifi and TVs in room. 

Price. $25 USD for a room for two people, with private bathroom
Parking. Secure parking in a gated lot.

name: Parqueo publico
description:
good secured parking with shadow
50Q per day, 50Q per night
you can go and come 24 hour
3m high and 6m long vehicle no problem
very central
next to a metrobusstop
toiletts and water available
they have wifi but did`t check
opposite the hotel clariss

name: In front of Ramada
description: Not much traffic noise here, nobody bothered us, and a beautiful view of the water !

name: CHAPULTEPEC
description:
Incredible place to drink home-grown coffee and natural yogurts of their own cows. Very good.Possibility d visit and sleep in the hacienda in a wonderful and surprising place.

Increible lugar donde tomar cafe de cosecha propia y yogures naturales de vacas propias. Muy buenos.
Posibilidad d visitar y dormir en la acienda en un lugar maravilloso y sorprendente.

name: Petrol Station
description:
We travel by bicycle and tent. They allowed us to camp here. Quiet place. Clean toilets. All for free.
there are some shops and easy local places to eat.

name: valdez
description: Good Fair Welder can handle just about anything. enough time and he could build something for you. He welded part of a luggage rack and got us a bolt from a moto shop down the road for free. highly recommended

name: Honda Guatemala (bikes)
description: excellent mechanic there taking care of overlander bikes, also allowed me to work with him. we changed the gaskets of my rear cylinder (honda transalp). highly recommend. (only spanish)

name: Bruel gourmet
description:
Excellent French fusion restaurant. 
Came for the daily lunch special. 40 Q for baguette sandwich, drink, and dessert. Has WiFi, parking with height restriction, and accepts credit card.

name: Posada San Carlos
description: By paying cash we could have a large double room for 57USD including breakfast (coffee no included !...) and a place to park our Defender at Tourist Police Parking lot (about 500 meters further).

name: Centro de Formacion de la Coperacion Española
description:
An ancient covent transformed in a museum with temporary expositions. 
Great place. 
Free entrance. 
No bags allowed inside, but they have free lockers. 
Nice bathrooms for free.

name: Hotel Aurora
description:
DON’T GO TO THIS PLACE!! (read below comment with the title “Place to avoid” to understand why)

—-

The other hotels we visited on waterfront charged at least 60 USD; this one gave us a large double room (#5) with AC, bathroom, balcony, TV, view on the lake (the best TV...) for 150 Q (20USD)....
Probably this price is impossible to get on high season (Q300+taxes written inside the room door...). 
Hot shower didn't work but not necessary because the heat. 
For AC they charge a little extra fee; we didn't use it : fan was enough for us. 
Sure, this is not Hyatt but in relation with price...
They have also dorms for Q50/pers and many backpapers stay here. 
Our car was parked in the street at the entrance of hotel and we could monitor it from balcony. 
Flores seems pretty safe and "parqueo" are very very rare in the city.

name: Laguna Magdalena
description: This is the trailhead for the laguna. you can tent camp at the laguna for 20q. There is also some cabanas not sure how much. Also there is a home they will rent you a room for 60q for the whole room. small store downstairs.

name: Hiking to the Mirador
description:
This a point on way to the Mirador. 
Nice hike from San Miguel (about 1 hour one way). 
Trail is not indicated on Mapsme

name: Mirador
description: Wonderful view from the Mirador on Flores and the whole bay of Lake Peten Itsa.

name: Posada Montaña del Quetzal
description: Nice hotel. Friendly staff. We were told Q250 for the simplest double room and Q348 for the cabin, with private bathroom and a living room with a fireplace. Nice hot shower. No internet.

name: Grutas Rey Marcos
description:
Beautiful place with palapas and balneario the cave has not convinced us


schöner Platz mit Palapas und Balneario die Höhle hat uns nicht überzeugen können

name: Repuestos de motos
description: Selling spare parts tyres and accessories for motorcycles

name: Bmw motorcycles
description: Sales services parts and other aftermarket accessories.

name: Ktm Guatemala city
description: Sales spares parts, services and everything else

name: El Jordan, km93.5, zona de recreo
description:
English: Lovely and well maintened place by the river (where its possible to swim). With tables, bbq area, drinks (no alcohol) food options, swimming pool and wc. Open from 8 to 17 but when we came the owners stayed for dinner until around 7. We stopped by and asked if we could camp here, Yuma and her husband were very friendly and helpful and said no problem at all. Very safe, gates are closed at night and there are 3 dogs looking after the place. We could use water, light and electricity. 
They let us camp and didnt ask us for anything, but we gave them what they usually cover for the entrance from local people (15 Q pp).
The most sympatic people we've met so far.
Spanish: Bonito lugar cerca del rio donde uno puede bañarse. Zona de recreo. Mesas, barbacoas, piscina, wc, bar/restaurante (bebidas NO alcoholicas). Abierto d 8 a 17h ahunque nosotros llegamos a las 17,20 y los propietarios estubieron hasta las 19h. Muy amablemente nos dieron algo de comer y nos dejaron acampar.
No nos cobraron nada, pero les dimos lo q cobran para entrar a la gente local, 15Q pp. Pudimos usar agua, electricidad y wc.
Lugar seguro, puerta cerrada durante la noche con tres perritos q vigilan.
Yuma la propietaria es MUY amable.

name: Paradise Inn
description: Simple hotel, Q250 for a double room. No dogs

name: Estacion Linda Vista
description: gas station with small shop/restaurant, playground,  clean bathrooms and car wash.  secure (open 24hrs). free wifi in restaurant.  great stop if you  cant make it all the way to chichicastenango in the day!

name: ICAP - Spanish Classes
description:
Instituto de Capacitacion Adventista del Peten is a closed religious campus where there are 350 students and the families of 50 teachers. They are a self sustained school quite isolated from Poptun ( 12 km of bumpy road but we were able to make it with a 24 ft RV)
We were looking for Spanish classes in a less turistic and crowded environment and we ended up here. The college did not have such a program but they paired my husband with a teacher for 3 hours a day (one on one). They didn't have set prices for the classes (we were the fist to ask for such a service) so they asked us to eat at the cantina and pay 30 Q per person per day for 3 meals (all lacto ovo vegetarian). They said we didn't have to pay the teacher but a propina and a donation for the college would be appreciated.  The Spanish teacher Leonel Lopez was amazing. We camped near his house ...sewage, water, electricity, and weak wifi available. Before coming here you should send an e-mail to ask for further information...because it is a religious school and you will have to abide by certain rules (wearing shorts, no loud music and party, no meat, no alcohol, etc). We spent 16 days here and overall, although we are not adventist, it was an great experience.(icap9t@gmail.com; phone: 31093251) 
Note there are no showers an bathrooms available, so you have to be self contained.

name: Las 24 Horas Hotel
description: A 24 hr Hotel with secure parking, bathrooms and hammocks to hang out in. They seem to be an event venue, but had nothing going on the night we came. They have ample parking secured by a gate and a restaurant on-site. 50Q to park, 120Q for a room with private bathroom& shower. There are outdoor open air showers in the back corner (closest to the entry door).

name: Restaurante Las Orquídeas
description: Amazing Italian restaurant. Homemade pasta, bread and pizza. Tagliatelle with local chaia greens, very tasty. Very welcoming Italian chef, Angelo, and his very friendly Guatemalan wife, Ileana, are wonderful hosts. They have amazing stories to share. It's a little more expensive then others around, but well worth it (a well served plate of pasta was Q60 when we were there). Open for lunch and dinner, no breakfast. Go!

name: Hotel Gloria's
description: Terrible room, not so clean. BUT CHEAP. 70 for two...with wifi. Cold shower. Secure parking.

name: Hotel Paraiso
description: A beautiful hotel by the mountain. We got here after a terrible fogy day. Nice and cozy rooms for Q75 Per room. Hot water, wifi and sauna(+Q10) Very friendly family who runs the hotel.

name: Hotel Valle del Sol
description: Parking lot of the hotel. Guarded 24/7. You can park in the shade. There is a restaurant with wifi next door. 25 quetzales. You can take a bus from here to Lanquin to go to Semuc Champey.

name: Cambio casas
description: If you need to change your mexican pesos to Queztzacoles...this is the easiest place in town.

name: Scenic route to see 3 volcanoes
description:
Volcano Agua,Acatenango and Fuego!
Scenic route on the way to Antigua.

name: Valhalla macadamia farm
description:
Organic macadamia farm, tour and restaurant. The nice owner even ask if we wanted to sleep at the parking lot. 
Not easy access for double rigs (trailers) or tall/wide rigs. Park and check it first.

name: Villa Canaan
description: Super cute and very quiet little haven, just off the main road to/from Guatemala City/Coban. Very secluded, very pretty cabanas with private outdoor patios, hiking trails, hot showers, cable tv with English speaking channels!! Great spot to stop after or before Semuc.

name: Petencito Park
description:
there are toilets on top of the small hill

No facilities. Nice place just aside of the lake. Very quiet & safe!

name: Fresh veggies
description: Local man has a perfect little jard where he grows lots of different vegetables. All organic and veggies are as fresh as it can get. Still growing :) Cant beat that! Geronimo even has his own digged out well to water the plants. Open everyday. Prices are cheap and owner lives on site in a small hut. Added pictures showing some stuff what he grows. A must visit place if you are in San Pedro!

name: Parque ecológico Pino Dulce
description: Nice place to stay and have fun, they have like 3 trails to walk a canopy and bridges to cross (Q100/$13 or Q50/$7 depends on how many cables and bridges do you want). We do de Q100 and was worth it, more than the Q50. Also we stay in a little mountain that is near and enter with a little car don't 4wd needed. They charge us Q60/$8 per person to camp. Very quiet at night and very crowd in the morning. Cold weather so you better bring a coat. There are cabins available Q250/$33 there is room up to 10 people per each cabin.

name: Bank
description: Bank atm, accepts visa, gives US dollars

name: Finca Trece Aguas
description: Beautiful place, beautiful sights, need permission to enter, call + 502 52024008

name: Vet Santarita
description: Decent place with an English speaking vet.

name: hotel y ranchon brendita
description: 24h openend hotel with restaurant at the parking lot and armed security guard who is watching the cars the whole night! we needed a safe place to sleep in our car before we cross the boarder to honduras...so we asked if it is possible to stay here for the night! he wanted 150Q but we traded him down to 100Q for 3 persons and our van! still very expensive but we felt safe here so we stayed. we could use toilets from the restaurant the whole night but no other services like wifi etc. available. didn't ask for water or showers, so not sure about this but the hotel looks very new so i guess they have hot showers if you ask for it

name: Hotel San Antonio
description: Great rooms with private bathrooms and a kitchen on site. Awesome location and views of the lake for 100Q for the room for two (or 70Qpp). Hammocks on the balconies and really helpful staff. They let us park our truck behind the gate (very tight for big rigs) room for plenty of motorbikes and probably 2-3 smaller cars. The road to the hotel is super narrow and hard to turn around for longer vehicles.

name: Quetzaltrekkers
description:
A volunteering organisation running multi day hikes up the volcanoes or around the lakes, and support an local school and orphanage. 
The school has 180 students and at the orphanage 20 young people between 10 and 18 years lives. 
Your hike supports these young people and we can highly recommend it.
You can stay at hostel Argentina where they have an office. 
They have hiking gear and backpacks you can borrow for the hikes.

name: Hotel Mirador del Lago
description:
Secure motorcycle parking for four of us, could also fit an SUV with a roof box in a tight squeeze. Descent wifi in common area.
 Rooms with lake views and terrace. 150 Quetzals (~20 USD) for a two person room with 2 beds, private bath. Had a happy hour in the bar like every other hotel on the island. 420 friendly.

name: Hotel  Cuna del  Nene
description: Nice clean hotel. Very nice family. Clean rooms. Paid Q 125.00 for 2 persons inkl. privat bath. WiFi. Secure big parking  lot. Restaurant, Comedor, bakery etc. in walking distance. Update: 50 pesos for two people in vehicle includes use of wifi and bathroom/shower.

name: El poete
description:
Nice little Hostel with Dorm beds for 65 gtq with included breakfast.
Lots of guarded Parkings around for 30gtq the night.

name: Nice View place
description: A big gravel pit with almost no traffic beetwen 2 villages. Great view and we felt save, quiet at night and also trough the day. Near the big Antenne. Road through the village is a bit narrow.

name: Flores Behind the Salon
description:
grassy Park quiet as night m.

Someone broke into our van during the day. So be careful

name: Chacula Nueva Esperanza
description: Comunity of former refugees.  Has a little lake where you can camp.  Also a small facility to eat and stay. Very safe.

name: Laguna Brava via El Aguacate
description: You can not drive all the way to the lake. Can park small rigs midway down and walk abour 30 minutes to lake on a steep incline. Breathtaking view!!

name: José Gustavo Velasquez
description: Fantastic mechanic.  we had carburator problems,  brakes that started on fire, and then i killed the starter. he spent a night,  the next full day,  and a morning replacing everything and was extremely cheap on his labor.  very honest and i highly recommend.  he's worth going out of your way if you need any repairs.

name: Border. Guatemala - Alvarado El Salvador
description:
Really easy boarder crossing today - less than one hour.  We were riding a motorcycle with Guatemala plates and we travel with Canadian and Czech passports.  Road passed / through all the transports and other traffic -- some ditches and really, really tight squeezing between transports required.  Got stamps and a ticket from the Guatemala side and then breezed through the El Salvador side without questions, fees or anything.  Almost feels too easy.  It would have even been faster if we stopped on the Guatemalan side first to get stamps instead we had to double back after hitting the El Salvador side.  Everyone was nice and easy.

As of Sep 12 2023- $12 fee per person to enter El Salvador (depends on nationality and can only be paid in cash)

name: Tequila Sunrise
description:
Nice and cheap Hostel with big parking. Q90 per night in a dorm. They have private rooms as well. Breakfast included...In case you are a motorbike rider - Honda is just around the corner. BMW, Suzuki and KTM as well.  Countless repair and parts shops nearby. 

Good spot to get some service done. Very helpful people...

name: Toko Baru
description: The Falafel and the Tikka Masala was good, the price too. But we think the food was cooked longer time before and just heaten up again. Nice place and nice People who work there.

name: North West Gas Station Free Camp
description: Big parking behind the gasstation. Traffic noise not completely blocked, but far enough (200 metres) from the mainroad. Tree line gives a bit shade in the back and you have valley view. One of the larger parkings we found aloung this road. Free when you buy gass. Little restaurant with gasstation shop present.

name: Foto Sanchez ( B52 USA )
description: Behind the US ambassy. They make, print and email your picture for your Non-immigrant B52, DS 160 application form. You have to change the picture file a bit. Rotate 90 degrees, shrink to 600 pixel width and cut of a bit on top and bottom to get 600 height. Save to a max file size of 240 kb. US ambassy close by. Advice: When you go north and wanna apply for B52 prepare yourself on the internet. Heldesk and embassy staff are very helpful and welcoming.  No worries.

name: Police Station
description: We asked the police and they let us parking on a small street near the station. Off course was free. Not the quietest place but OK for a night before boarder crossing.

name: Jalpatagua Purificadora
description:
$9 Quetzales for 1 Garrafon 4.8gallons. 
Friendly couple. Helpful. Bring your own hose & bandit if you want to fill your water tanks.

name: Texaco Gasstation Free Camp
description: Buy some fuel and you have a free place to spend the night in your car. Behind the station enough space, approx 200 metres from the mainroad. If there isn't a cooling or cattle truck parked next to you, you will have a quiet night. Little restaurant/shop/wifi:12345678 available. Toilets and shower are poor.

name: Next to church
description:
Flat spot in a gated area next to the church. Several tiendas across the street to buy beer/supplies. Was night  and raining when we arrived so it was nice to have a tin roof awning and covered patio on the church to cook and sit under. Water faucet nearby. Super friendly locals - surrounded our car to say hi but left when we said we needed to start cooking dinner. One of the tienda owners recommended this spot - seemed very safe and we had no issues. Quiet at night.

We took the road very slow to minimize stress on our shocks. Took 4 hours from the end of the pavement  after Bartolome until Lanquin. Would've gone the long way through Coban had I known how bad and slow this road is.

name: Riverside
description: Nice spot next to the river, in a grove of trees. Flat spot to park or tent. Fire pits. River is great for swimming. Breezy and shady. After passing Hotel Las Marias look for a big grassy field and small pull off to the left. Hotel Las Marias had a descent restaurant and cold beer if you don't feel like cooking. This spot is 10 minutes walk to the Kanba caves and 15 to the entrance to Semuc Chempey. 10 minutes after setting up camp a middle aged man and his 3 sons approached and said it was private land - asked for 50 quetzales and we paid. Probably fine to park your rig here or you could drive and park at Semuc Chempey.

name: Casa del Cerro Hotel (GREAT)
description: Stayed here for 3 nights while exploring Antigua. Private parking in courtyard big enough 2 large SUV's with roof boxes (entrance is just over 3 meters tall). Nice courtyard garden seating area to relax. Rooms are spotless and well decorated. Queen bed with Private baths with hot water. Feels more like a boutique hotel - all the fresh flowers made the place smell like my grandma's house - in a good way :) just 5 minutes walk from the historical center but on a back street so no traffic noise.
