Es un spot muy amplio con unos cuantos árboles y palmeras, conocimos a Neri un hombre que vive al fondo de la calle y nos dijo que el terreno es de su amigo y que no hay problema por parquear y pasar la noche aquí. Incluso Neri nos ofreció ducharnos en su casa. 
A unos 50 metros hay una calle con barda blanca que da para la playa pero no nos recomienda quedarnos parqueados entre la calle porque pasan autos. Nos dijo que es muy tranquilo y que en Monterico y Hawái es más caro todo y los parqueos cobran, y también las playas son más privadas con casas frente al mar.

name: Bomberos San Antonio
description: Friendly small Bomberos station. They let me store my bicycle safely and I could stay for the night on a folding bed in the kitchen/gym.

name: Hotel dulce sueña
description:
Friendly hotel near the bus terminal and the center. 70GTQ per person!

Français
hotel chaleureux prêt du terminal d'autobus et du centre. 70GTQ par personne !

name: Adventurous caves of B'omb'il Pek
description:
If you're looking for an adventure and a community project all in one, this is the place to go! These are two caves, B'omb'il Pek and Jul Iq' which you have to hike to for about 40 minutes. We liked it better than the Candelaria caves.

B'omb'il Pek is a cave you can access by an 85m rappel (or very steep, unprotected stairs). Once in the cave you can crawl your way into a part of the cave with small 1500 yo. carbon drawings (which are a little bit damaged by a cave exploration expedition..). 

The other cave Jul Iq' has some amazing structures and the light that enters the cave is just beautiful.

Guides use professional equipment and are trained by ex-military. The income from tourism benefits their community, they explained that over the years it supported the building of a school and common meeting area. They are open to tourists again after 2.5 years of covid closure. 

It's 75q pp to visit the cave and an extra 75q pp if you want to do the rappel. It's well worth it considering there'll be two guides and the tour is about 4 hours. Bring water, a snack and repellent. They need to know a day in advance, you can WhatsApp them (in Spanish) on +502-4998-7410.

name: Shaday Gasolinera
description:
Gas station with small shop.
They let me camp on the covered terrasse above the shop. Guarded parking for trucks too

name: Piedra de Cuache hike
description: Start of the short 2km hiking trail, just walk up through the fields. It was quite difficult to find any info on hikes in this National Park, so that's why we upload this one. The hike is pretty steep and it takes you about 1.5 hours in a leisurely pace, you can't get lost. Great views over Huehue and when skies are clear you can see the volcanoes.

name: De lo Alto Farms
description: Wifi. Restrooms. Showers. Campfires. Coffee tours.

name: Camp AKT
description: Nice campground very close to Acatenango trailhead with tents for rent. Noce bathrooms and showers with hot water and electricity. Beautiful view of the valley with sunset over Atitlan volcano.

name: Restaurante Bahía San Pedro
description: Nice and Sécure spot on el Naranjo. In front of the River San Juan. Also there is a nice Hotel Bahía San Juan if you wnat to rest. The lady of the restaurant let us park free if we eat at her restaunt. The food was amazing and the restaurant also is beatifull over the River. Nice sunset. Good place after entering or going to el Ceibo.

name: Smoothies (Cafeteria and Salon)
description:
Found this excellent place on Airbnb. Two large suites available to rent short or long-term. I stayed 4 days to get some bike work done. Secure parking. Perfect for riders or small trucks/cars.
The place has cafeteria close to everything. Host speaks English and is super helpful. $20/night.

name: Parque Nacional Yaxhá-Nakum-Naranjo, military base
description: Came in too late for the camping place inside the National Park, so they let us stay at the parking lot of the military station opposite the National Park entrance building. Directly at Lake Sac-Nab. No amenities, but free and well guarded

name: Restaurante Toro Master
description: big parking lot next to the CA13 main road. the owners of the restaurant let you overnight for free if you eat in the restaurant. toilets and showers available. menu of the restaurant is small but good. prices are ok - 60 quetzales for pork chop with fries and salad. the night is quiet and save.

name: Hotel El Escorpion
description: Basic accommodations. Limited selection of rooms, but huge secure parking lot. Room to camp in rear, ask reception. Paid rack rate 150qt for room / clean / AC. Walking distance to street food and grocery shopping. Good stop for border prep.

name: Hospedaje Nuevo Amaneser
description:
Simple hotel, 4 rooms.
Small restaurant just under it, really handy
100Q

name: Laguna San Pedro
description:
A very nice camp ground with all the facilities that you need. Have several palapas with tables and fire pits. Really nice people that take care of the place. Very clean bathrooms.
The lagoon is without water in dry season.
Any additional quesiton ask +502-5346-7152 Manaen Lopez is the guy in charge of the place.
This place is a must!!

name: Big market
description: Big market with everything you need (vegetables, fruits, clothing, the occasional living chicken and turkey) for local prices.

name: Texaco Fuel Station
description:
The place to relax for the night
Jose the security guy is something else, we put gas at the station and in exchange he let us stay the night at no charge .
Bathrooms 
Showers 
Food, drinks 
tables to relax and eat.
when you arrive Ask for Jose Security guy he'll take care of you.

name: Restaurante Plato Grande
description: Very nice restaurant to stop by if you're stressed with the road. We had an amazing breakfast.

name: road to Lanquin
description: Man with a rope block the road. He asks for 100Q. We try to negociate 20Q but he treatened us with machete. We gave him 100 and he took also the 20.

name: MarLo Flores
description: MarLo provides storage for motorcycles and is also motorcycle tour guide for all of Guatemala. He is very knowledgeable about all of the routes including off-road. His storage is an enclosed garage in a safe location in Guatemala City.

name: Hoyo de Cimarron
description:
This is the car park and trail head to a deep hole in the ground - 500m across, 210m deep, impressive! The trail is 2.3 km one way, and pretty. 

Car park has a little hut and a sign with prices of Q50 for tourists (Q20 for nationals), plus Q10 to park, and Q10 for kids. It was closed and locked when I was there, as were the nearby toilets. There's also a sign saying to please call a number before entry - 5638 7167; I did and the guy just said to go ahead, so I went without a guide and without paying anything - well marked path with red arrows painted all over to keep you on track.

I almost stayed the night here too but decided it was slightly remote, plus right on the main road and no shade other than one small tree - was a little anxious leaving the van here by itself while I was hiking - instead I parked by the football pitch about 3km towards Gracias a Dios, on the left just after the fuel station - not an ideal spot so I haven't marked it, but it was peaceful once the traffic stopped rolling at about 7pm, and flat.

Photo of the hoyo attached.

name: road
description: Anothet guy asking for money on the worst road ever. Don't go here. Go to Coban and take a collectivo. Travelling for 1 year in all center america we never saw that. We have a 4x4 van and even with it it's awful. We'll never take this road again.

name: Centro de Salud
description: Needed rabies shots (again!) after being bitten by an aggressive dog. Got the first one here - they were pretty thorough, in a laid-back kind of way, and very friendly. in fact I think you can get the shot at most centros de salud, the implication was that most towns should have it - we'll see!

name: agapantos cabanas
description:
good place for camping next to Santiago. nothing special here, just a nice place.
some cabanas and rooms for rent.
camping for a camper 100q.
suitable for kids, with big grass, couple of swings and a jumping thing.
the caretaker, Fernando, lives here with he's family.

name: Dead-end road
description: I'd been planning to stay at the Sendero La Maceta spot nearby, but they've concreted the track (so presumably easier access now!) and it was barricaded off to dry, so I explored down here instead. Turned left at the junction and some 50 metres up the road ends. Nowhere to turn around to I reversed up. There are a couple of narrow paths leading from the end - a farm worker and his young son popped out of one just before dusk; he said it was fine to stay. Nobody lives nearby apparently, had a super peaceful night. Chilly at 300m altitude! No facilities at all, reasonable Claro signal.

name: Hotel Casa Montana
description: New hotel very close to Chichicastenango with a big green area with lagoons and huge parking lot. One of us rented a single room for 25 USD and the other two of us could sleep for free in the van, as long as we had breakfast at the restaurant of the hotel (very good breakfast, buffet on weekends!) The staff is really nice and welcoming! Talk to the administrator, she is a very nice woman from venezuela and would be happy to welcome you here! Would absolutely recommend this place.

name: Posada Rural Finca Chacula
description: A beautiful little finca that has basic rooms and camping. There is one platform with a roof to put a tent. The scenery is beautiful. Definitely space for a van as well. The road up is a bit rocky but I think totally fine for a van (I’m on moto). 30Q to camp. Not sure the price of the cabanas. There’s a restaurant but it’s not open and no one is here, it’s very quiet on a Wednesday. Apparently no electricity at this place but the cabanas can have solar hot water. But there is full cell signal

name: Cataratas de Parramos
description:
Ecological park to explore if you want to escape from Nebaj. The 20-odd km drive took me a good couple of hours, slow and rutted/potholed, and some steepish bits towards the end that my RWD van struggled on with the gravel. 

The park was closed when I got there, and nobody answered the phone numbers on the board at the gate. Looks pretty though! (Gate image attached.) The surroundings are beautiful too, and crystal clear rivers and waterfalls everywhere. I imagine some nice hiking to be done - up to you to decide whether it's worth the fuel and the wear on your tyres!

It says there is accommodation and food available, presumably at the top - I'd say space for one or two vehicles inside at most though, on a slope just off the road.

name: Side of the road
description:
Not the kind of place I'd usually add, but it was hard to find anywhere around here in the dark, and I actually had a nice peaceful night here. It's just the side of a smallish road leading to the main road into Nebaj - brick wall one side, field on the other. Most of it slopes but there's a short area where it's pretty flat. 

There was a little foot traffic and a very little motorised traffic. Can hear and see the main road but not too disruptive. Peaceful, felt safe, ok Claro signal. Good enough! Space for big rigs too.

name: Cafeteria Chilasco
description:
While I was parked up in the main car park the evening before hiking to the falls, somebody came down to warn me it wasn't a safe place to leave a vehicle, with a history of break-ins (this despite the guy at the ticket booth insisting it was totally safe) - said the last victim was a cousin of the footballer Messi, and that he wasn't impressed! I had a peaceful night there but in the morning drove to the first building on the right, several hundred metres back from the parqueo, and they were happy to let me leave the van on their grounds, for a tip.

The hike was pleasant, but stressful in the muddy areas - and there weren't many areas that weren't muddy! Especially down in the valleys, it was better for the section on the ridge. Very grateful to the previous posters who talked about footwear - I was just about ok in hiking boots, but when I was trying to move faster on the way back I ended up in it to the ankle a couple of times. Trainers would have been inadequate, anything else a disaster! As it was a hike that the ticket office guy said should take about two hours return took me four..

I opted not to take a guide and had to ask directions a couple of times. Might have been nice to have one, but for anyone who doesn't want to take one (if you have a tight budget and have had to pay for parking in addition to the Q35 entry fee, for eg), I took some notes of areas where it's not immediately clear which way to go:


15°08′24.96″N 90°07′11.72″W - take the lower path that cuts down and left, over a little bridge across the stream, and then the path that curves round to the left through a separate narrow valley

15°08′24.48″N 90°07′24.37″W turn right up the steeper and what looks like the less muddy path - this section was treacherous though!

15°08′32.12″N 90°07′29.7″W turn right onto the bigger path

15°08′51.7″N 90°07′35.19″W Descent to the falls begins here, bear right and down 

15°09′01.21″N 90°07′34.06″W left to the smaller waterfall, El Saltito (just a few minutes' detour - it's actually the top section of a much bigger waterfall but I don't think there's anywhere with a view of it all), right for the steeper descent to the main event. It's signposted. A few hundred metres down towards the big one is the toilet, with a flat space big enough for a tent nearby.

15°09′01.59″N 90°07′30.54″W cross the stream bed amd follow the path out the other side some 10m below

15°08′59.84″N 90°07′26.45″W end point

name: Rabinal football pitch
description:
Huge flat space on the edge of the football pitch, alongside the stadium. Was recommended by a local, and the police drove past a handful of times in the evening and seemed unconcerned, so I guess it's fine.

Quite exposed and was noisy with traffic and music from a nearby comedor from 7am (though it's Todos Santos so maybe rowdier than usual), plus in the sun from around then, so not ideal unless you're an early riser - but otherwise was peaceful overnight. zdid the job for a night.

name: Taller de Cámaras
description:
Camera repair place - they repaired my faulty camera to fix the botched job done in Mexico City. Wanted 7 days but agreed to do it in 24 hours when I explained I wasn't planning to stick around. Good communication, fair prices, and even agreed to waive the 7% card fee as a favour. Recommend!

It's office number 307 of Torre A, Reforma Montufar building. Call 2361 O068 or WhatsApp/Telegram 35694458

name: Texaco
description:
We parked next to a Texaco gas station in a space in front of a departmental headquarters, we talked with the firefighters of the gas station to inquire if we could stay there, they told us that yes, safe place, lights are open 24 hours. Because it is beside the road, it is a bit noisy because of the vehicles that travel. There are places to buy meals in the surrounding area.
Order of tacos Q12 and churrasco Q15. We didn't pay anything to sleep there. It's a place to spend the night and then continue your route.
.....
Estacionamos a un lado de gasolinera texaco en un espacio frente a una sede departamental, conversamos con los bomberos de la gasolinera para indagar si podíamos quedarnos allí, nos comentaron que si, el lugar seguro, y nos daba la luz de la gasolinera además están abiertos las 24 horas, por estar a orillas de la Carretera es un poco ruidoso por los vehículos que transitan. A los alrededores hay lugares para comprar comidas.
Orden de tacos Q12 y churrasco Q15.
No pagamos nada por dormir allí.
Es un lugar para pasar la noche y luego seguir tu ruta.

name: Cerro Alux
description:
Nice natural place to camp surrounded by nature and with a cold climate.
.....
bonito lugar natural para acampar rodeado de naturaleza y con un clima frío

name: Hotel Real El Trapiche
description:
Stopped here after a days cycle from Coban. Decent guesthouse, lovely town and cheap and delicious street food nearby. agua purificada across the road
220Q for double room

name: Agua Purificada
description: Shop for purified drinking water, not sure opening times

name: La Autoría
description: A great restaurant with very reasonable prices. We had breakfast and it was a real treat. Would visit again!!

name: Estación Byron Alexander
description:
Free. Spending the night here is fine. Lots of space. Friendly personnel. 
.....
Muy amplio, lugares planos. 
personal simpático. 
FREE

name: Café La Parada
description:
On my quest for the best coffees in Antigua I came here upon recommendation of the Aria coffee roasters. They have a fantastic espresso. 
Single for 10 quetzals, (double for 15) and so far in Antigua this is the absolute best value for money. 
The café interior is no frills and down to earth. 
The decor is oriented a bit toward the 50’s Americana with their hangings metal signs and stupid coffee jokes and rustic wooden Antigua heritage look.. 
When I came in Taylor Swift was playing. They even have good taste in music! I love it! 
It is refreshing, considering all the many coffee places in Antigua trying their best to be third wave, and then this coffee shop just presents you with a perfect cup of espresso, with coffee from huehuetenango, roasted locally in Antigua and it is just wow! 
An explosion of flavours and quite a kick. Medium roasted of course, not bitter, round mouthfeel with some nice acidity. I like!
They also sell Antigua cerveza for later in the day.

name: Esperanza Hostel
description:
Right now each bed is 50 Quetzals and I think it is the best value for money in Antigua. Very close to the centre and to the only bigger supermarket, it has a roof terrace with view of the three volcanoes. Relatively quiet. 
It is very clean and the staff is super nice. The kitchen is in working use and even if the guests make a mess like always the housekeeping staff does clean up ( the cleaning lady is a star ).
The design is unfinished building style which looks like work-in-progress. Feels like squatting at a building site! Really I think the cleaning lady is doing a great job because the place does feel welcoming even though many things are broken. Without the cleaning lady this would be a terrible place to be. For instance, it is a 'no smoking' hostel. The guests ignore this and drop ashes everywhere, ugh. Still clean… the people cannot cook without making a mess in the kitchen… still clean after a little bit. Impressive! They should give her a pay raise!

name: lake side camping
description:
we've stayed here for a night with our Volkswagen Combi, right at the lake front, shaded. trees to hang a hammock. Some traffic in the morning, but very quiet the rest of the day. 
It's in front of a house, people saw us but didn't say anything:)

name: Bali Hotel
description:
budget hotel, Q100 per room per night (2 persons) free filtered water. 
okay room the first 2 nights, clean towels, sheets and soap. We got an upgrade the 3th night to a room with private bathroom

name: Turtle center
description:
Turtle Conservation centre, they buy the eggs off the locals, and set the turtles free. you can set one free yourself at 5 pm for Q10. 
We parked behind a small hotel with pool behind the turtle center, after all the turtles were released everybody left, and we decided to stay there for the night. we made a little fire on the beach. in the evening the locals come and search for breeding turtles to steel their eggs. You can see the turtles lay eggs. (September - february) 
In the morning someone came to clean the hotel, but didn't say anything to us. 
a LOT of mosquitos, but apart from that great place to stay

name: Malecón de Puerto Barrios
description:
We arrived at the boardwalk and parked at the edge of the street just behind the Hotel del Norte, initially for one night, but we ended up staying 6 days, during the day we moved to a vacant lot in front of the Cafe Marbella. The place is safe, a bit noisy at night because many people arrive at the pier where you will find food, a park for children, crafts and you can see the boats that arrive. While in Barrios we went to visit Livingston, we left the RV in a parking lot near the boat dock and we went to spend the day but you can also go to the night, it was a good experience that we recommend.

llegamos al malecón y nos estacionamos a la orilla de la calle justo detras del Hotel del Norte, inicialmente por una noche, terminamos quedándonos 6 días, por el día nos moviamos a un terreno baldío frente al café Marbella.
El lugar es seguro, un poco ruidoso por las noches porque llega muchas personas al muelle donde encontrarás comidas, parque para los niños, artesanías y puedes ver los barcos que llegan.
Estando en Barrios fuimos a visitar Livingston, dejamos el Rv en un parqueadero cerca al muelle de lanchas y fuimos a pasar el día pero también puedes ir a pas la noche, fue una buena experiencia que recomendamos.

name: Tz'unun ya rec centre
description:
Nice hostel with private tents. Q35 pppn. they've got 2 or 3 doubles as well. Warm shower, great communal space with pool table, hammocks, tv. it's right at the lake front.
There was a massive spider in my tent xD

name: La Herradura
description:
A small family restaurant with secure walled access to a large flat grassy area near the centre of Panajachel. Also has separate restroom with sink, soap, toilet paper and light.
We stumbled upon this place by chance and asked if we could stay the night with our roof tent and he kindly agreed. Price paid was 80 GTQ which was very reasonable as other sites in the area were quoting double this. A very good experience.

name: Vinas Hotel
description: Hotel on the road to Shemuc Champey, just outside Lanquin. They let us park our van in their secure car park for 100Q per night. Hot showers, pool, bar, Wi-Fi, etc. Stay here and get a collectivo to Shemuc. The road their is a nightmare.

name: Churrasco Los Panchos
description:
I had a great dinner here.  The restaurant popular with locals and with good reviews. 
Churrasco is roasted meat served with some steamed potatoes and beans. 40Q for a quarter chicken. The other option is hamburger with fries which costs about the same. This was the dinner menu.

name: La Posada de don Martin
description: I stayed in a single room with outside bathroom and shower (warm) for 60Q. I got towel and soap too. Wi-Fi is available but did not work in my room. Very clean and very good value for money. Single with private bathroom are just 75q

name: Shower
description: Small hotel. They let use the showers. 10q pp. hot water. Very clean. Rooms are simple but it looked great. Owner said it’s 250q for a double room

name: Casa Linda
description: Doesn’t have parking for rigs but it is a fantastic place. The rooms start at 80Q which is the best value in town. Huge garden in the middle. Shower and toilets outside. Super clean! A bit off the Main Street and quiet. Super friendly older hosts.

name: Aire Acondicionado Automotriz
description:
Workshop for maintenance and repair for air conditioning, they are located half a block from the main road. They solved the problem with the RV air condition very quickly.
Satisfied and grateful because this part of the country is very, very hot
10/10


Taller para mantenimiento y reparación para aire acondicionado, están ubicados a media cuadra de la troncal llegamos los chicos muy amables nos solucionaron el inconveniente con el aire de RV muy rápido. 
Satisfechos y agradecidos porque está zona del país es muy pero muy caliente 
10/10

name: mercadisa
description: Its not good, this mini super market only the bred is very good.

name: Casa Seibel
description:
Top rated hostel in the heart of Xela. Very welcoming. The staff is made mostly of super friendly volunteers. It is also super clean and has a shared communal kitchen with a oven and a big fridge.

The hostel is located in a beautiful 19th-century house with wooden floors and old furnitures, is cozy and comfortable with lots of plants distributed in two inner courtyards. It has dorms and private rooms (sharing two bathrooms)

The dorms start at 50Q per night 
No parking for RVs.

name: Texaco fuel station scam
description: Told them to fill Diesel for 400Q but we did not get nearly as much as we paid. Wanted to get a Fractura, but they tipped it in manually. Manager not here. Avoid this gas station to not get scammed.

name: Gucumatz Lakeside Inn
description:
Absolutely stunning place at the Petén Itzá lake, run by Moya and her son Justin who take hospitality to another level. Private, double and even dorm beds available. 

There is a bar, a restaurant (they make the best and very affordable breakfast and dinner upon request), a small shop, table tennis- and pool table, and literally tens of spots to hang out (ranging from comfy couches and chairs to hammocks and sunbeds) on the property that declines in terraces until reaching the lake where you can have a swim and watch both sunrise and sunset. 

It’s simply the best place we have stayed during months of travelling across Central America. It’s paradise. Would seriously fly back to Guatemala just to stay in this place.

name: Casa Vieja hotel
description:
Small hotel with small cabins. Clean. 
Sign says 175Q for a Single and 275Q for Double. 
We got the price down a little.

name: Camping Rio Dulce, La Colinita
description: Cute, small, super quiet camping ground, 2.5k (25 min walk) from the center of Rio Dulce. With a gravity shower, a dry toilet, a cool big kitchen area. Gravel road access going to  CLINICA MEDICA LA ESPERANZA, RIO DULCE (Km. 277.5 towards Petén), turning in to gravel road and following this road for about 1 more kilometer.  On rainy days, access only with 4x4 vehicles..

name: Hotel mi Recuerdo
description: Nice and simple place, rooms with 1 double bed and 1 single + TV + fan and private bathroom (cold water) 100 qtz per night. 150 qtz with AC

name: Hospedaje Turismo Solidario Cooperativa Nuevo Horizonte
description:
Nice place, 5 rooms, with fan and mosquitoes net. Shared bathroom. 
70 qtz pppn

name: Green spot in tiny village
description: It’s a spot next to someone’s house in a small village. Everything around is green. We were looking around for a nice place to sleep for one night. We asked the owner if we could stay in front of his house but he pointed us to this spot next to his house.

name: Hotel Vista al Valle
description:
Nice, clean, simple hotel in Ciudad Vieja.
Cheapest hotel we stayed in in Guatemala.
100Q for a room for 2, with a true double bed, private bathroom with hot shower, and we were allowed to stay with our service dog.

We came back several times for the price, cleanliness, available staff (though we didn't need much). The hotel is neither new nor fancy but had what we needed, a clean place to stay for a few days at a time while resting and working. 

No AC though Ciudad Vieja didn't feel too hot with the altitude, nights are fresh enough to sleep, we keep the window open. There is a nice pool but we didn't enjoy it as we didn't come during the Guatemalan summer. This is when they clean it to put it to use.

The little town is a great option to visit Antigua without breaking the bank. We find it much more authentic than Antigua as it is not oriented toward tourism. The town is surrounded but beautiful mountains and volcanoes, one of them active, can be seen from the hotel, spouting smoke clouds throughout the day.

We walked through the town daily, bought our veggies and fruits from the tiendas, and the market, or from the front doors of people selling their avocados. We've seen the private parking lot fit some medium size pickups but big rigs won't be able to park in.

Wifi is fast but spotty.

name: Hotel Esperanza
description: simple hotel, private room with fan and bathroom 100 qtz / room with shared bathroom 60 qtz

name: Eben Ezer
description: Pretty recent hotel, big room with 2 double bed, AC, TV with Netflix, private bathroom 185 qtz. Good restaurant not expensive (generous plate around 30 qtz)

name: Techron
description: Gas station with free water and free carwash if you fill your gas tank! Very nice guys

name: Hotel El Paraiso
description: Nice hotel with large car park, quiet and well situated. 200 Q for a king size bed big room with A/C and private shower (cold). None of the hotels in the centre of Morales accept pets. It was our only option closest to town

name: Hospedaje Sol y Luna
description:
Very basic place but worth it for the price in Rio Dulce. Private room with bathroom (cold water) and fan 50 Q pp.pn (we paid 100 Q for 2 ppl). Noisy because close to the bridge but with ear plugs all is good. 
Pet friendly

name: La Canchita
description: Good place un modèle of nowhere. Love IT and cheap: 30Q for chicken, rice ans béer

name: Llantas Express (mechanic)
description: We highly recommend this garage. It is signed as a tire-specialist but they fixed our breaks. The mechanics are reliable,  thorough and everything for a fair price.

name: Poza "El Cubo"
description:
Beautiful campground with a waterfall and a gorgeous natural pool to swim in. Enough space for many tents in different areas (close to the waterfall, more in the jungle, in a little cabin they're building or in the terrace under a roof). Also enough space for campers and cars.
Owned by a humble family, very friendly all of them. The entrance to the waterfall + camping is 25 quetzal per person (around 3€!)

40Q pp in a van or rv. 
Alex speaks English best to send a message or call beforehand +502 4096 9265
Felt very safe and not so hot as other places around because of the many rivers surrounding the place. Definitely a nice place to spend a night or two.

name: Central Hotel
description:
Nice simple hotel, remotely situated from the street and so quiet for the location !
Big room with AC and 2 simple bed + private bathroom (cold water) 180 Q (2 ppl). very clean.
Pet friendly.
Private hidden garage secure

name: Auto Check - Taller Mecánico
description: Taller de mecánica, they are young but super efficient and not expensive. We had a flashing light on emission check, they directly saw it was an injector problem. They fixed it in less than 30min for 100Q. They can work on automatic cars.

name: Hotel Mi Pueblo
description: Not too expensive at 200Q, but has A/C, hot showers, secured parking with maybe 10 spots. A lovely little courtyard and very quiet. Off the main road and away from the bars on a quiet street. Restaurant seems to only be open on request, but plenty of places within walking distance. Bonus: they charged me 35Q for on site laundry (price depends on number of articles, and I had maybe 20 things)

name: Yuam Che
description:
Family owned Bed ando Breakfast. Beautiful place. Lots of nature around, perfect to stay on the way to Semuc and nothern Guatemala. The owner is super nice and a great host. The property has a parking lot in case you are driving an RV. And prívate rooms/WC as well
so peace and quiet.

name: UNO Gasolinera with ULSD (50ppm)
description: They have Ultra low sulfur diesel with 50ppm sulfur. For the newer European vehicles with DPF and so necessary.

name: STG refrigeracion
description:
Sergio fixed our 12 Volt fridge very quickly.  He has a WhatsApp and a Facebook STG refrigeration.  He responds quick and is very friendly!  His 9-year-old daughter showed us around their home and animals.
 They repair refrigerators and air conditioning!

Sergio a réparé notre réfrigérateur 12 Volts très rapidement. Il a un WhatsApp et un Facebook STG refrigeracion. Il répond facilement et est très sympathique! Sa fille de 9 ans nous a fait visiter leur maison et leurs animaux.
Ils font la réparation de réfrigérateur et air climatisé!

name: Casa Qatzij
description: An oasis hidden at San Lucas Main Street, where you can really make yourself at home. Nice sitting area, well equipped kitchen, big dining table, and a garden to relax. The bed was tiny but good, shared bathroom. It has a big parking place, where our 2 motorbikes fit easily (or a car for sure as well!). The owner (Andrés) is kind, eager to assist, and well-lectured.

name: Taller de Jorge
description:
It is one of the few workshops in Coban that know about the VW kombi. Prior to this we went through three workshops that were scary. Jorge knew how to solve everything very well and explain everything. You can tell he knows these bugs. Highly recommended
.....
Es uno de los pocos talleres en Coban que saben de VW kombi. Previo a este pasamos por 3 que daban miedo las cosas q hacían y decían del boxer 1600..Jorge supo resolver todo muy bien y explicándonos todo. Se nota que conoce a estos bichitos. Muy recomendable

name: Árbol del amor
description: Pretty cool looking tree. A bit of a walk up, but perfect next stop after el mirador. Trail is not well marked but there is a little sign at the entrance, follow the trail then turn left.

name: taller Auto VIP
description: Very professional service. The mechanic Marvin Vidal worked at Mercedes for 14 years. We did an oil change at a reasonable price. Recommended by taller Auto.

name: Hotel Buenos Aires
description:
We found this hotel by chance, after considering more expensive and much less comfortable autohotels.

We are so happy we did!
We paid 150Q per night for a room with 2 double beds, cold shower (no need for hot water, it was really hot), stable wifi.

The hotel offers 2 types of room, we chose the more expensive in the main building with the door rooms opening on a long terrace/balcony.

Very clean, green landscape with banana trees and other plants over a nice grass area.

We ended up staying 18 nights after a difficult border experience. Julio and Miriam are amazing, they will happily tell you about the area and recommend food. We encouraged Miriam to offer her cooked dishes to their guests as she is an outstanding cook! 
Julio is always ready to engage in deep conversations, the couple became great friends of ours and we look forward to meeting them again. 

We could relax there and while in the city center of Coatepeque, the hotel feels like a bubble surrounded by greens. 

The cheaper room was 60Q per person. 

Julio said he could host a big rig or 2, as well as a couple of tents, check with him. 

Julio Whatsapp: +502 5010 6261

name: Print shop
description: Here you can ask to print your document if you need to have some copies

name: Friendly Laundry
description:
This lavanderia doesn’t have a sign or anything. It’s a yellow building with a few washing machines inside.
The owners are super friendly and even speak some English. We paid 6Q per pound and the laundry is done the next morning or same day if you’re early.

name: Casa Maya
description: A  marvelous place to stay in the Rio. The owners are extremely nice and attentive. Very nice little bungalow. Isolated. We watch the lanchas go by.

name: Radiadores Alfa Y Omega
description:
Rather than replacing my cracked radiator altogether as another mechanic had suggested, these guys painstakingly hand-crafted a new end-piece for it from a sheet of aluminium, over the course of 7 hours. Was a pleasure watching them work, real craftsmanship! They charged Q650 for it.
Only thing I wasn't convinced by was them filling it with tap water afterwards - probably fine for Antigua but not best practice generally, as I understand it  I went and bought some coolant and they drained it for free and topped up with that instead.

name: Near the river
description: Big flat area just near the river with some trees for shadow. Some locals playing in the river, very quiet at night. A guy came in the morning asking for money, we gave him 15Q. Slow Tigo cell reception.

name: Hotel La Semilla
description:
Cheap accomodations. Paid Q60 for one person.

Room is clean, hot water, decent wifi, small desk and chair with a lamp. Also has a small gated lot for parking 100 meters away.

name: Don Alfonso
description: Huehue is the place where they export coffee worldwide. This is one of the best specialty coffee shops in town and they serve excellent food as well. It was a treat coming here!

name: Malecon Puerto Barrios
description: We parked one night on the boardwalk, behind the "Hotel del Norte" it is safe, the place is in front of the port and it becomes very noisy. In the previous street there is a restaurant, bar and a cafe, at night there is food for sale on the boardwalk and toilets... we only spent 1 night here, the noise does not let us sleep.

name: Posada Vetz K’aol
description: We camped in the parking lot of this basic hostel. It’s very quiet and on the edge of the village. WiFi is good at reception and okay in the parking lot. Host Salvatore is a sweet guy and was surprised that we wanted to camp. He offered us the use of extra wool blankets, the bathrooms, and hot showers.  Our 3 meter tall VW Westfalia hightop fit in just fine. However, the roads to get here are narrow, steep with very tight turns, so bigger rigs might not make it. We think the price is reasonable.

name: near Laguna
description:
We spent the night here, on the edge of the lagoon, front row for a beautiful sunset over the lagoon and the letters "El remate", we asked the police and the restaurants if we could and no problem.  There is a very good ice cream parlor and a pizzeria / burger.  Just off the main street.

Nous avons passé la nuit ici, au bord de la lagune, au premier rang pour un magnifique couché de soleil sur la lagune et les lettres "El remate ", nous avons demandé à la police et aux restaurants si on pouvait et aucun problème. Il y a un glacier à côté très bon et une pizzeria /burger. Juste à côté de la rue principale.

name: Car Wash
description: Best carwash i've ever been to. They litterarly clean every little detail untill it looks perfect. My van has never looked this amazing. They even cleaned inside for me :) 30q for cars 40q for vans.

name: Plaza Medica
description: I went to a doctor for the eyes here. Very friendly and helpful. The doctor speaks English and she recommended a doctor in Guatemala City for possible further treatment.

name: Restaurante mi Pueblito
description:
Good place to eat after a hike at Corazon de Agua. 

You can get away from all the tourists in Antigua. 

We paid Q35 for churrascos.

name: Ingenio Pantaleon
description: This is where you need to come to collect your permission to visit El Baul museum - which needs to be requested three days ahead of time, thanks to a 'new political situation '. See the separate nearby museum entry for details

name: Tecnocom internet service
description: Fast wifi ( only one in Rio Dulce ) 15Qz per hour fast download and upload . Very nice staff . Recommended

name: Santa Marta Hot Springs
description:
Adding a camping site now, because we almost missed the place .. Still 20q/p!

More info on the hotel-pin in iOverlander on the same place!

name: Atitlan Overlook Camping
description:
Space for a motorcycle and a tent with a fantastic view of Atitlan. 

It's mostly out of view of the road, though it does appear to be a popular spot for locals. I wouldn't expect anyone will bother you. 

Tigo signal, don't know about Claro.

name: la casa del pan
description:
Perfect bakery where you can find many type of local sweet and salty pan.
1qtz per pièce of banane break, higly recomand it!

name: Gas station Del Norte
description: New gas station very clean. We could sleep there for 25Q. There is clean toilet and water

name: Quirigua Archeological site
description:
This place is only listed as an informal campground so I'm adding it here so more people can find it as a place to visit, because it really is worthit. 
There are no pyramids or high structures here, only one acropolis but what this place truly is about are the stelae. There are more then 10 impressive, very well preserved and huge stelae, altars and zoomporphs. The highest one is 10.5 meters.
The price is 80q, staff is very friendly and you can camp here. It officialy opens at 8am and closes at 4:30, but they wont kick you out.
Also if you visit this place, pay a visit to the little tienda of Senorita Dominga who has been on this place for 42 years, making and selling her handcrafted clothing and other products.
Overall very interesting and weel worth stop, it took us about 1,5 hour full circuit with the museum and spent the night.

name: North Inn Hotel
description: Found a good place to stay for Q100. Clean room. Slow wifi. Electric hot water in the shower. TV. Small desk and chair. Secure parking for small vehicles. There are a lot of hotels in town. This is probably not the cheapest, but it could be the best value. For the nicest hotel, find Hotel Zolomizah, which costs Q250 for a single.

name: Antigua Gym
description: If you need a shower you can combine a work-out together with hot showers. You pay 35q for a day pass and longer passes are available. Best way to get a shower when you are staying at the police station.

name: Circle Bakery
description: The best place to get sourdough bread and croissants. If you go early you can buy all different breads and the almonds croissant are just the best we have tasted in a very long time. Also the chocolate croissants are perfect!

name: Mirador del Colibrí
description:
This is a really nice viewpoint where you can look across Lago Izabal. The road is a little rough to get there but possible by car/bicycle/bike and probably vans too.

You can ask the owner, Yonathan (Tito) to camp there. It's only suitable for tent camping but there is possibly space for vans too. There are toilets and a shower. His number is +502 4995 8279 for more information.

Really friendly owners and a lovely place to visit!

name: Casa Mary
description:
Very nice and simple hotel. The rooms are simple but nice and clean. Showers were quite warm for Central America. We had a double-room with private bathroom for 150Q. Also rooms with shared bathroom available. 
There is also a nice garden to chill. The owners are the most friendly people imaginable (they even surprised us with cake for my wife’s birthday). They will help you with everything you need. If you want they help you to organize tours or transport or are happy to explain you what’s the best way to do it on your own. 
They have a small restaurant with very good and cheap food. Also they run a small shop just in front of the entrance. It’s a bit hidden but they are happy to pick you up at the bus station and show you the way. If you are brave enough to go down the path there is parking for bikes (not accessible by car). 
Just reserve via WhatsApp with David, the son of the owners: +502 5777 4084

name: Agri camping
description: Very nice place quiet and pleasant big surface area and grass 35 quetzal night for my van wasapp 31440264

name: El Porton Tipico
description: An economic place to eat in Antigua Guatemala. The food is typical of the place, they make delicious tortillas, they have soups for 45Q, meats and fried chicken for 35Q with drinks included, typical breakfasts for 25Q with coffee included... the place is in front of the old corner...

name: Parqueo municipal
description:
Big parking lot outside of Alotenango. You can see on one side volcan El Agua and on the other side volcan El fuego erupt from here ! There is toilet.
Q10 per day, we stayed the night also and paid Q20 in total. 
There is a guard and they close the gate at night so very safe.

name: Mirador Laguna de Ayarza
description:
Spectacular view of Laguna de Ayarza. 

Concrete pad with a roof and a couple benches. Good place for lunch. Not a good place to stay overnight. 

Free. Drive up and park. It's right by the road.

name: Beer Garden
description:
Great place to try local and artesanal beer. Very good vibe, friendly personnel. 
Good place to start your afternoon with a nice craft beer since the place closes around 8pm.

name: Pinchaso - Tire store
description: Very friendly guys, quick service for a very cheap price. They fixed our dented rim in a couple of minutes.

name: La Delicia churrasqueria
description: Typical place for breakfast or lunch, each plate food for 25Q including drinks... the food tastes very good... in front of the supermarket, the pantry. in the central town of panajachel..

name: parking lot in residential district
description:
After a lot of trouble finding parking with our motorhome in this city (city center locations not accessible, streets with no exits, too narrow or prohibited for trucks and vehicles over 2.50m, Walmart inaccessible because of high barriers  ....), we find this secure car park in the middle of a very quiet residential area.  We asked a security guard who validated the security of the premises and the possibility of settling here.  However, be careful, we were on a Saturday evening so no work on Sunday but it seems that this car park is used during the week by employees in the area.  To confirm...

Après de grosses galères pour trouver un stationnement avec notre camping-car dans cette ville (emplacements du centre ville non accessibles, rues sans issues, trop étroites ou interdites aux camions et véhicules de plus de 2.50m, Walmart inaccessible à cause des barrières de hauteur....), nous trouvons ce parking sécurisé en pleine zone résidentielle très calme. Nous avons demandé à un gardien de sécurité qui a validé la sécurité des lieux et la possibilité de s'installer ici. Cependant, attention, nous étions un samedi soir donc pas de travail le dimanche mais il semblerait que ce parking soit utilisé en semaine par les employés de la zone. À confirmer...

name: Comedor Rony
description: Nice family restaurant, full of locals. Good food for an affordable price. The waiter was very friendly he flagged us when we were looking into menu's from other establishments. We asked if he had any vegetarian options and he just created a menu on the spot, which was very appreciated. One of us was not feeling well, and he did not have a problem in letting one of us sit for a moment while the other went to a nearby pharmacy. He was very carrying and always made sure we were alright and did not need anything else. We really enjoyed the food but what stood out was the friendly staff and their approach, and the great vibe.

name: Playa Real
description: It’s a private beach with pool, toilets, showers and grills. We spend 1 night, 60 quetzales for 2 person. It’s a peaceful and clean place. You can swim in the ocean, the water is clear and calm but isn’t sand, it’s mud. To relax it’s a great location.

name: Hotel Casa Del Viajero
description: Better than tzolkin across the street (where both rooms we checked didn’t have hot water.) Also a dentists place, so seems like good responsible owners. Cheaper than Tzolkin too. 150 q for 2 people.

name: Back road to the embarcadero
description: Not the best spot ever, but it was fairly quiet and peaceful, and free. Just tucked in at the side of the road next to a pretty farmed garden. Gently sloping but not enough to need to level up. Police came by the first night I was there and were unconcerned, once they'd established what I was about. A little motorcycle and foot traffic and the occasional tuktuk, but very peaceful overnight. Not recommended for anything wider than an average van.

name: pueblo viejo junction
description: The villagers have the road cordoned here, and are asking for a 'donation' from passersby, as they receive no benefit from people visiting the ruins. They requested 50q. Seemed a little on the high side to me;I negotiated 10, but got no receipt so was warned I may need to pay again if I come back through..

name: Playa Punta de Palma
description:
It’s a good safe place to stay, you can have access to bathrooms, cold showers (expect very basic service ) ,breakfast and lunch (Also dinner was offered even if the restaurant is closed , the family who runs it will do it if you’re staying over night ) , we where told camping is possible (free of charge, we slept on our van at night and didn’t had to pay any fee either, parking lot is large but not so clean , don’t be surprised of people leaving garbage and taking a wee at the area by the trees, move closer to the restaurants so there’s more light and where it’s better kept ) ,the use of the municipality palapas and table areas have no charge either , locals bring coolers with food and drinks , everyone was friendly and respectful, area is inviting, sand is pretty , clear water , nice breeze and wide sandy open areas (at night it’s well illuminated). 
We adventured further to find another beach and there’s no public access, this is your best choice , keep in mind the bumpy/wild road

name: Paragliding over Lake Atitlan
description:
In this town, you have the possibility to make some amazing paragliding flights .. I did it with Sebastian from Switzerland - He has long experience with tandem paragliding and he flies very safe and only in safe conditions! He speaks perfect german, spanish and english.

The experience is absolutely incredible!

You can contact him on this number if you have questions or if you want to book a flight! He also has Whatsapp!

+50258855131

name: Hotel San Francisco
description: its a Hotel with a big parkinglot in front, we ask if we can stay one night with our camper on the parkingarea, it was absolutely no problem, staff was really friendly and helpful, on the end of the building there are three public toilets and the possibility for getting water and power. we paid 50q for 2 people and the car. we would come back!

name: Little restaurant
description: This little restaurant is in the middle of two roads.  The food here is delicious. Large mix plates from $25.  They have lots to choose from and changes through out day.  We had breakfast here and had battered vegetables, chicken with rice and really good beans.  Two weeks later we had lunch. We had chilli relleno with chicken, rice and salad.  Some of the best and most authentic food we had in Guatemala.

name: El rincón sipacatense de Aury
description: if you want a safe place to stay here, you can go to Aury's restaurant "el Rincon sipacatense", next to it there is a piece of land (a bit dirty but safe) in front of the beach and Aury is a really nice woman, always ready to help and cooks amazing, delicious and inexpensive food! and all the support she can get will help her so much! :) she let us use her bathroom and shower also and was really nice to us

name: Hotel Proceres
description: Hotel with very friendly owners, helpful with travelers and so happy to receive an RV motorhome. They asked us 15Q for one night with full access to WiFi, toilets and all the common area with swimming pool ! There is also a mini market where you can find food and drinks. Also a restaurant inside.

name: Camping spot with lake view
description:
I'm renting this flat space for puting your tent and/or parking your camper van. It's in Tzununa, very close to Granja Tzikin. It has water suply, dry toilet, lake views and it's very close to the river and the best waterfalls in town.

The price for camping tent is 40Q/day and for camper van 80Q/day.

name: Casa san Bartolomé Hotel and RV park
description:
Small Hotel and RV Park beside the CA-1, idyllic grassy area with nice old trees, very quiet (the traffic noise far away). Friendly and helpful staff, lot of space, all is well groomed and clean. We came here on a Sunday afternoon and were the only guests. They have all amenities, bathroom very clean with hot shower. Good Wifi connection. They offer breakfast and dinner, but we don’t use it. Highly recommended place. 
The price: they ask for 20 USD / 160 Q per camper (up to 4 Persons)

name: Parking lot at the Cuevas de Andá Mirá
description:
The Cuevas offer some refreshing warm pools alongside the river, with „natural shower“ (looks like a little waterfall) and toilets. Lots of locals spend their time here, friendly atmosphere , however lots of garbage in the woods. 
We could spend the night on the parking lot. Very quit at night. A good spot close the the border, we felt safe.
Entrance fee of the spot is 15 Q pp and 15 Q for our campervan. When leaving later than 6:00 AM unfortunately you need to pay the second day as well.

name: Clinica Veterinaria Santa Lucia
description:
This is a very nice and competent vet. She helped us with the health certificate for our dog to cross border to Mexico. In Guatemala you need a certificate from a vet and from the government! She does all that for you. It takes 2 days and cost 1500 Q. 
She also examined our dog very thoroughly. 
The place is very conveniently located right next to the tourist police where you can stay overnight for free. I can only warmly recommend this vet! Just knock on the glass door and someone will open you. Open 8am till 6 pm

name: La Familia Pizza y Pan
description: Best pizza in Antigua Guatemala! We recommend it and….we are Italians… Fair prices compared to other pizzerias in the town. Enjoy!

name: Casa Hotel Maria
description:
Nice, simple hotel with friendly owners. The beds are comfy, hot showers and everything is clean. We arrived super tired and they helped us order some food to get delivered. 

We are cycling and we were able to put our bikes in their small locked garage. 

125Q for a room.

They seem to have some space to park at the front but the road is quite busy so you would need to ask.

name: Open space in Lanquin
description: It’s an open space, not dirty but with 2-3 abandoned vehicles next to the main road and the Lanquin hospital. You can stay for 1-2 nights. The gravel road on the entry is a little bit steep but no worrying.

name: Centro Frenero Peten (brakes, clutches, alignment)
description: If you're looking for a good place with reasonable prices to change/service/check your brakes in Peten this might be it. We were here after a bad experience with another garage nearby in iOverlander (Conejo) that made us overpay and did a sloppy job. We redid the front wheels alignment here for 125Q and they had all the necessary professional equipment. They quoted us 180Q to replace the frictions of our rear drum brakes (excluding parts), and 90Q to change the drake disk on our front brakes (excluding parts). They were friendly and transparent about what they were doing during the repair. They can also source parts from Guatemala city if needed. They also do clutches

name: RD-ZAC-05 road
description:
Was planning on taking this road to copan coming from Gualán, but was informed by locals that the area is known for robberies and the road is in terrible condition. 

Do not listen to google maps if it recommends taking this route, go around via Chiquimula.

name: Hotel Ecológico
description:
Highly recommend to come to this area oppose to the rat race in rio dulce. 
Very secure, recommend to WhatsApp the owner Sergio to confirm availability +502 3221 2883.
50 Q per person. They also have cabanas, and you can also set up a tent, price list in photos Restaurant, clean bathrooms with toilet seat and paper 😉cold shower. Pool.
Limited parking in a tropical surroundings on the lake. Not for big rigs. I had no problems getting in and wouldn’t recommend anything longer than 21ft. The gate entry is 11ft wide and there are a few soft hanging branches that I had no problem with @, 2.9m high. Howler monkeys above you and many birds. 
Sergio also organised a boat tour for me to the reserve 3 hours $300 Q up to 3 people or $100 Q per person after that. So much cheaper than rio dulce and I saw dozens of howler monkeys, birds and manatees, it’s a beautiful part of the lake. The road from rio dulce is in excellent condition. 
I would certainly stay here again.
I had good digi cell service, I didn’t ask if they had wifi

name: Donde Benny 2
description: Opposite our hotel in this small town, we weren't expecting a lot. However we were blown away by the choices and quality. Great steaks, barbecued to order,  my husband said it was the best meal he'd ever eaten . i had the pasta, again a really good dish. Very generous portions. £20 uk staff lovely and clearly proud of what they do.

name: Bella Vista
description: Hotel on main road. Not listed on Google or anywhere. 150q for a small double, we paid 200q for a large double. Hot showers. Tv with Netflix etc. Friendly owner, stored our cycles for us. Doesn't seem to be too noisy despite being on the main road. Parking but not for big rigs. Fab restaurant opposite Donde Benny 2. Shops nearby.

name: Villa Rosalinda
description: This place has a nice yard pretty big big enough for big rigs to park in a swimming pool and a hotel restaurant. We were looking for a place that was safe where we could pull a little bit off the road. Most of the places we found in Guatemala don’t have any off the road camping or places to park. This place has a very nice natural yard with green grasses and avocado trees but there are not all the colors on them. They charged us 120 kid size to park our car for the night and give us bathroom and shower with it. There is no hot water, though. The people are very friendly and accommodating.

name: Random street parking
description:
Guatemala City is about the only place I've been in 5+ years PanAm-ing where every single person I asked to recommend a safe district to park up in replied that there just weren't any and I'd be better off leaving the city for the night. This district feels ok though - it's a heavily residential neighborhood, with several shops and businesses on the bigger roads. I spent several nights parked up in various spots around the barrio without issue while I had stuff to attend to in the city; the police came by occasionally and seemed unconcerned.

The area further up the hill is noisier but there's more choice of non-residential walls to park up against, further down towards the city is more peaceful but more tightly packed housing. Nowhere 100% ideal really but it was ok for a few nights; plenty of space, lots of flat areas to be found, fairly peaceful overnight etc.

name: texco
description:
Super nice guys. I was stuck on the road for 6 hours so pulled in here.
Open 24 hours. Not for big rigs, I had no problem with my 21ft. Picnic tables and a car detailing business here as well.

name: Car wash „Wash and go“
description:
Our van was really really dirty and we had trouble finding a car wash that was not super restricted with heights. We are 2.5m high and  very long and we fit in the car wash easily. These guys really went out of their way to clean our van and all the solar panels! You can sit upstairs and watch the whole process. 
We payed 99Q which is fair for a big van that has been off road a lot.

name: Hotel Xe Kaqasiiwaan
description: Hotel and restaurant on Sol-4 coming into town. Secure parking for motos. Paid Q175 for a comfy double room. Good hot water. Had to ask for the wifi. No drinking water provided. A bit noisy at night due to a bar next door.

name: Camp at the blue river
description:
It is time to make it official: you can sleep here - at the end of the road- exactly before the „entrance“ of the river
During the day lots of friendly locals but really quiet during the night 
Easy with every kind of vehicle

name: Ixkun
description:
small archeological site with opportunity to camp and overnight in the jungle 
The biggest stella that ever found stands here- they are still paintbrushing the place- the ruins are covered with the forest but interesting to explore it in Indiana Jones style
3G Claro!
Road is a-ok
Donations based- no fee

name: Jesus Taller
description:
Jesus and his brother are 2 great mechanics. You can trust them !
They have changed the front suspension blade of my European RV with some adaptations.
You can contact Jesus via WhatsApp only in Spanish: +502 4428 2248

name: Hotel Dona Eladia
description: Hotel above a row of shops. Rooms very big. 2 double beds. 250q for the night with good aircon and hot shower, right by road. Some noise over night but not too bad. Bar and shops nearby

name: Go beyond Cowerkafe
description:
Really nice place in an alley- next to the busy main road 
Mostly Mexican kitchen with touch of Guatemala - veggie options are Omnomnomnom!
Everything „handmade & homemade“ with enthusiastic owner and chef! The lime caffe with eggless cake is a recommendation! (Not on menü)

name: Agroindustria Finca Villa Alicia
description:
This coffee producer welcomed us with open arms and gave us a great tour and coffee tasting for free. Marco and his wife let us sit in their coffee roasting room and explained the process as they worked. They don't have a traditional cafe, but were happy to make coffee on the spot at no charge. The coffee was roasted and ground not 20 minutes before they served it to us. It was one of the best experiences we've had.

I asked and Marco said there is a possibility to have people tent camp or accommodate one or two vehicles, just reach out to them ahead of time on Whatsapp and coordinate that (+502 4034 9719). You can also find them under "Agroindustria Finca Villa Alicia" on Facebook. I'm unsure what services they would have as I don't think they've had campers before.

Also, be sure to buy the fresh roasted and ground coffee!

name: Soldador / Welder « El Mofle »
description: The only welder in antigua. Very good and friendly

name: Comedor Olgui
description: Do not stop at this comedor. They ripped us off big time. When i heard how much they want to charge i asked back twice and the answer was the same astronomical price and an aggressive look. Food was also sub standard.

name: Posada Vicentas
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager
------------------
Mayan family have place to sleep and makes activities locals.

We also offer different experiences to share our Mayan culture:
 - traditional weaving course (to knit a scarf: 275 QTZ per person)
 -Blouse fabric 475 QTZ per person.
 - Local cooking class with a market tour (175QTZ for one person) for two or three people at 150QTZ per person.
 - Mayan painting lesson (450 per hour - Plan on 3-4 hours).
 - Hike to "Rostro Maya" ("Indian Nose"): 150QTZ per person.  The rate includes entrance.
 - San Juan la Laguna Cultural Tour (100 QTZ per person).

 Any doubt or question, you can contact us by this means.
 Sincerely: Chema +502 58 11 55 44.

name: Narcotics Checkpoint
description: Narcotics checkpoint on the Guatemala City bound direction. Friendly, asked for drivers license and passport.

name: Fernando's Café
description: Very nice café with outlets and the best wifi I've been to find in Antigua. 40mbps download and 16mps up. Perfect place to work

name: Quiet street behind police station
description: Nice quiet street to overnight safely. We arrived to Santa Cruz Quiché after the Sunday Chichicastenango market and stopped at the police station to ask for a safe place to break up the journey north. The police officer recommended us to stay here. It’s the block right behind the police station. Had a quiet night of sleep.

name: Araco 4x4 Garage
description:
THE place in coban to get your 4x4 fixed and/or pimped.
Diego and his team are absolute pros and live 4x4. Super nice guys, helpful and speak english aswell.

name: Aqua Pura de Leon
description:
Refills your tank 11 per 20 L 
Big rig capable

name: Camping Rio Dulce, La Colinita
description: Small, quiet, private, No electricity, cheap, under trees Camping place. Dry toilet, gravity shower and gravel road access available.

name: Hospital veterinario zoo mazcota
description: Lovely English speaking vet. Very kind and professional. Received a health certificate for a land crossing for 525 Q highly recommend. Parking is difficult and easy walk from the town

name: Awesome views
description: Large flat area beside the road with great views. Not very private but the road isn’t too busy. Just somewhere to park up for a night. Great TIGO LTE service.

name: Délirions pan e delicia
description:
Very Good pastries and croissant chocolate
--
Boulangerie pâtisserie très agréable. Les croissant au chocolat sont très bon. Pas comme chez nous mais délicieux.

name: Street food next to hospital
description: Very good plate of the day. We took carne arroz serve with tortilla and salsa de frijoles. And eggs. Very cheap. Very good. We paid 75 Qz for 3 plates of meat and 1 plate with eggs.

name: Hotel Antonio
description: Brand new hotel 1 hour from the border. Everything is new and clean. Prices are low:  Q50 for a room, Q75 for a room with  AC. Mine had double beds. Outdoor parking for cars, but they let me drive my motorcycle inside the lobby and park it there. Smart TV and WiFi tested at 17mbps 69ms ping. Tacoria in the same building. It is in a little town, the locals were extremely friendly, and very curious to see a foreigner. I was charged low prices everywhere I went. There is a house with a monkey in the yard across the street, grocery stores, repair places, and a hardware store close by.

name: Hotel Girasole
description: This hotel allow ovarlander to stay in their parking: the space is big, flat, safe, super quiet (is away from the mainroad) and suitable for any vehicle. We paid 50 quetzales a night. There is wifi (5 mbps in up and dwn), power, water, toilet and showers (which we did not use so don't know if they work or are extra). We had to work so we spent 5 nights here. Recommended.

name: Comedor  Dan Juan
description: Very Good food and simple plate of the day. 20 Qz each plate. Server with tortilla and salsa tomate. Possibility to ask eggs for vegetarian. We paid 95 QZ with 4 plates and 2 soda water

name: Comedor antigueno
description: Very good food with many people inside. We had fried chicken served with rice, salsa tomate, vegetables cooking and Vinci Mbre salad. Well served. Plate is between 30 and 65 Qz. We paid 285 with a drink for 4 persons.

name: Selling tissue
description: Super beautiful tissue (sell by meter)from Guatemala. 40 Qz each meter

name: Panadaria antigua
description: Good bakery. Banana cake and (good chocolate cake at 5pm) good whole wheat sandwiches

name: Casa Emy
description:
Restaurant that lets you park in their big parking lot if you eat. Simple menu but was yummy. Super friendly restaurant manager. They have great wifi if you park close enough. 

It’s less chaotic than the other hotel across the street option where there’s a bar which pumps all sorts of Saturday night tunes . It’ll be quieter here on a weekday. But it’s still good at weekends.

name: Matamoros - suspension bridge !!!
description: The other side of the village there is a suspension bridge with a weight restriction of 2.4 tons and height 2.4m. Take the left turn at the crossing way before you reach the village. Tiny sign Vacías 6. Locals can help redirect you too. Or take route 7 - a much less comical chaos sugar cane plantation comedy sketch.

name: Sandy flat
description: You can’t camp next to the river anymore and the other river is dry some months. This Sandy flat is a Perfect place to camp. Flat land easily accessible. 25Q per night paid to the lovely land owner. Water available that’s even drinkable. River is a free - an icey dip

name: Auto Vidrios Sur
description: Windshields and all kinds of glass repairs.Had our windshield replaced very quickly and cheap!! in comparison to Europe. Very friendly staff, we could stay the night in a secured and gated parking right next to the workshop

name: Water in Front of Taco Bell
description:
Here you can park easily in front of Taco Bell for free wifi (15 mbit) and water taps near the plants. 

Taco Bell has nice vegetarian options!

name: blood moon hostel
description:
very nice hostel with secured bike parking.
it's a bit out of town but a nice short walk to go to town.
it has a small swimmingpool and a nice vibe. 
its cheap I paid 100 per night incl. pancake breakfast and good coffee. 
They offer laundry service. 
very friendly owner!

name: say yes hostel
description:
really nice new hostel with great vieuw!
very clean, extremely nice warm showers, secured parking for motorcycle, great area, close to town, big swimmingpool.
I was able to put up my tent in the garden. 
very nice vibe!

name: Road block
description:
We’ve got 2 road blocks on the RN5 this one is the second one the first one was 2 km ahead. Both times there were two guys and they had put big rocks in the middle and ropes. 
What worked for us is to keep the windows 4/5 closed. Say we won’t pay and we will call the touristic police. We actually did call and while on the call we put the speaker on. The guys got scared and removed the rope and the rocks letting us pass. 

Better take the road through Coban. The RN5 is a very beaten up track and very long to cover.

name: Casa Blanca
description:
possibility of WiFi:
[passwords are not allowed]

name: Salud Pura Vida
description: A three floor restaurant in the main road of San Pedro with nice views over the city. They have a lot of vegan options and smoothies, coffee etc. for really low prices.

name: Galeria 13 Ajpu Fatima
description: Very beautiful art painting. We buy somes. Love it

name: Katoc pupusas
description: Great traditional food like pancake made with corn. Inside you can put some cheese/ beans/ chicken or and carne. Very good and cheap. Andres the cooker is very friendly and can teach you how to make it! Love it

name: Casa Santa Teresita
description: Very nice established campsite with 2 cabanas and some space for camping in your truck. Be patient when ringing the bell, they will hear you but it's a long walk for them. The gate is quite steep. Very nice flat grass, clean toilets, showers, swimming pool (actually nice and clean), laundry machine to be available after asking, quiet, just great. We paid 160 quetzals for 2 adults and a truck, seems reasonable to me, not cheap, not expensive.

name: Drinking water on side of the road
description: Drinking water on the side of the road, enough space to park safely. Can connect a hose. Asked 3 locals if it is potable and if we can take some, and they all say yes.

name: Italien food. Roméo e juliet
description: Very good food. Really Italian pizza and fresh pasta home made. Raisonnable price! We came again. So nice!

name: Comidas Sarita
description: Right at the junction where road branches off to Tikal. Irma named the restaurant after her daughter. The presentation of the food was as amazing as the taste. I thought this place deserves more love. They serve topical Guatemalan food and agua frescas. Give it a try. Cheap food.

name: Texaco
description:
We spent one night here before crossing border, safe and quiet. 
.....
Nous avons passé une nuit ici avant de passer la frontière, calme et safe.

name: Tekoa Cafe
description:
You should try the Biscoff Caramel Coffee! 
Payment in Bitcoins are very ok and there are opportunities to stay overnight- ask Jared!

name: Cenotes Candelaria
description:
This is the entrance and where you pay for the Cenotes. Q100 per vehicle (plus Q25 camping if you want to stay over). This cost is extra to the Ojo de Agua. If you paid Q100 back down the road to get in there, it does NOT include these cenotes.
They are quite beautiful. Trail from here is steep and quite rough in places.

name: Ojo de Agua
description: Entrance and pay point for Ojo de Agua. The Ojo river spring is around 1.7km further. It's a pretty spot where you can bathe in the river and chill out. Q100 per vehicle. NOTE: the sign at this entrance is misleading and implies you are paying for the Ojo and for the Cenotes Candelaria. Although this route goes through to the cenotes (past the Ojo), the Q100 you pay here does NOT include the cenotes and you have to pay Q100 per vehicle again when you reach the cenotes entrance. We guess if you take the route to the cenotes through Chacaj, you might not have to pay twice.

name: BanRural
description:
Here you can pay the taxes going into Guatemala for Aduana (car) and your pets if you are traveling with animals. 
You can walk from the Integrated Border is just 200m 

For the pets is $14us per animal (after you need a copy of the ticket) 
For Aduana we paid $160 qtz

name: Laguna Brava - access from Yalambojoch
description:
Very beautiful spot where the river joins the Laguna but IMPORTANTLY it is an EXTREMELY steep road coming down here, mostly unsurfaced, with very tight/steep turns, quite narrow in places and big drops off the side. 2WD will almost certainly have difficulty getting back up. Highly recommended  4x4 only, especially if it's wet.  Once you've made it down here... breathe, enjoy the lakeside, and try not to think about the drive back out :-)
When you turn-off the road in the village of Yalambojoch, there's an entry charge of Q20 pp but no fee for camping.

name: Café La Granja
description:
Perfect Stopover between Lanquin and Guatemala/Antigua. 
It’s a nice Restaurant/Café with a big Playground for children’s. Also Horse Riding available. The food was good and fair prices. Delicious Cookies and Coffee.

name: El Paradon, next to Villas Tortuga at the entrance to the beach
description:
We were told that parking on the beach was not allowed, so the place next to this is now off limits. The sand is very soft there anyways, would be doable except to leave you would have to drive up hill (No bueno).
so I asked around and found this little jem just on the street over from it. Right on the bank of the beach, we got permission to camp here from the villas next to the spot. small rig only, locals said its super safe and a police car drove by without any issues. so happy days. There's a bar and resturant with a pool down the street a little, looks busy so didn't bother with it (except for using there toilets).
anyways enjoy!

name: Eco Farms GT
description:
Eco Farms is growing organic veggies, organising activities for local kids and communities, promoting eco friendly attitudes. We did some volunteer work with them. There is a parking lot in front, where 1 or 2 rigs can park. The turn to enter is sharp, i would say 7 meters/24 feet is a Max size. You park in a dust ground, have access to the toilets and shower and there is a car wash too in the parking. It’s closed at night and secure. On the other side of the road you can visit Eco Farms, there is a great playground for the kids, baby animals (you might end up adopting a kitten or a Chick), they have 3 restaurants with vegetarian options and Healthy food, they sell vegetables. Wifi at eco farm (not in parking). They also organise workshops, yoga, music gigs… they are super friendly and have tons of idea to support the communities and the environnent! 
Regular Price for the night is 50 quetzal per vehicule. 
You can propose a support price of 100 quetzal for the night, as they always need fundings. 
Emilio and Guillermo are the twins in charge, contact them before coming to arrange your stay +50256857286

name: Ecoturicentro Las Pozas (springs and pools)
description: We went there because the region is super warm in the dry season. And we were looking for a place to refresh. You can swim in the natural pools of fresh water from springs and the mountains or in the pool of the center which is the same water. The center charges 15qz per person. Very relaxing and quiet (except on the weekend). Opens at 8am and closes at 6pm. We did not ask if we could sleep there but could be an option. We slept at the point La Combi and went from there it is just 10 minutes.

name: El Tigre Mirador tower
description:
Out of this world 360' views over jungle as far as you and your binoculars can see. One of main temples of Tikal clearly visible and in march the sun sets exactly behind the temple. Absolutely breathtaking views!

There is a hotel 1km further down the road.
The access here from Nakum is very bad. We are 2.4m high, 2m wide, 5.4m long. There are many sharp turns, and 2 big trees fallen above the trail that were roughly 2.45m above the ground. In mud season no go, in dry it is pasable, 6km took us 1.5 hours of cautious driving. The trail gets better on last 2km. It is being overgrown by vegetation and very narrow. But if you have enough time, I would 100% try.

The hotel seems to have access from Tikal, we will investigate and make comments if it is true...

name: Start/end of Road to El Tigre and Holmul
description:
In mapy.cz, maps.me, etc. the road from El Caoba ends here. It does not.

The road from here continues all the  way to El Tigre camp, Mirador tower, Holmul ruins, La Independencia camp and potentially to Rio Azul.

It is all the time very easy dirt road regularly taken care of by scrapers and other heavy machinery, as it is a logging road for logging concessions that are all over the jungle except national parks.
It is roughly 50km from here to El Tigre camp, about after 20km you need to enter the private concession and also national park, therefore there is a military checkpoint. I doubt they let you in but it is worth trying. We went the opposite way from Nakum and El Tigre and Holmul, so they had no issue letting us out.

We share this with all of you so you can enjoy stunning Holmul, and Mirador tower, but mainly because we believe that well-managed tourism is the best way against poaching and illegal logging and deforestation (in Africa. it works well). A random tourist car from Europe and USA with full-time running dash camps and GoPro is not what poachers love the most... Enjoy

name: Embarcadero
description:
Free public spot next to the pier.  We stayed there for 2 nights.  calme.  We left the van all morning to go to the San Pedro volcano.  We went there by tuk tuk (15Q/p).  no problem, there is always traffic.  to access the spot, we pass narrow streets but we passed without problem.  beautiful view on Lake Atitlan.

***

Spot public gratuit à côté de l'embarcadere. Nous y sommes restés 2 nuits. calme. Nous avons laissé le van toute la matinée pour aller au volcan San Pedro. Nous y sommes allés en tuk tuk (15Q/p). aucun problème, il y a toujours du passage. pour accéder au spot, nous passons des rues étroites mais nous sommes passés sans problème. la vue est magnifique sur le lac Atitlan.

***

Lugar público gratuito junto al muelle.  Nos alojamos allí por 2 noches.  tranquilo  Dejamos la camioneta toda la mañana para ir al volcán San Pedro.  Fuimos allí en tuk tuk (15Q/p).  No hay problema, siempre hay tráfico.  para acceder al spot pasamos por calles estrechas pero pasamos sin problema.  la vista es magnífica sobre el lago de Atitlán.

name: Hostel Lolita
description:
very good hot shower. good pressure 10Q per person
just perfect

name: Entrance to Laguna Brava
description: This is the Yalambojoch entrance to the laguna. Cost 20Q pp. Its 5-6 km drive to the lake, down an extremely steep track with very tight turns and some very narrow sections. 2WD are likely to have difficulty getting back up. It is dirt surface in places, but not a particularly rough track, just very steep and tight with some big drops off the side of the narrow trail. If your vehicle can make it, the drive is definitely worth it- a very beautiful lake. Take the path around the lake to the right, it leads initially to some cabañas, then another 800-900m up the hill to some small ruins.

name: Moon Paradise
description:
Brand new spot right next to the mirador on ioverlander.     Stunning views over the lake!
