There is camping for tents and any size rig that can make it up the road. Also bungalows, one that has 2 beds and a jacuzzi!
Clean bathrooms and they are building hot showers within the next 2 weeks (will be done by second week orApril 2023)
(They are currently clearing and flattening more land for more camping).
Also, there is a restaurant, bar, small pool, fire pit.
Great wifi.
We spoke to the owner Miguel, and he said they will charge 40Q per person with use of everything, or if you spend 75 or 80q in the restaurant/bar (PP) it is free.

name: Laguna Ayarza
description:
I first went to the marked free spot on the other side, but some poor guy had just drowned in the lake (flat calm water and no currents, he'd just gone in though he was unable to swim, according to bystanders) and it felt totally inappropriate to be there as the family were grieving, so I moved around to this side. Residents told me I was free to park wherever I liked; I found this spot just pulled over at the end of the road under some trees, just beyond the fish enclosures. Not as nice or spacious as the other end but very dark and quiet, and far enough from the party areas not to be disturbed even on a Saturday morning. it's narrow enough that big rigs might struggle to turn around at the end.

Restaurants with bathrooms etc available a few hundred metres down the road.

The lake is beautiful.

name: Playa Comunitaria Cerro de Oro
description: A very quiet public beach in front of the lake with a mini market, Wi-fi and public restrooms. Some tables and grills for common use. 5 Quetzales per person and 5 Quetzales per vehicle. Best place for those who want to rest and stay away from the noise of the pueblos (towns).

name: Picasso Cafe
description: This is a gem in Antigua. Oscar; the owner, chef, server is a one man show and does it all. The food is fresh and delightful. The service is fun and relaxed. We went here multiple times during our week in Antigua.

name: Lavanderia
description: Washing fast easy like everywhere find out I think I payed to much :(

name: Back of a fuel station/front of a shop
description:
Nothing particularly to recommend about this place other than it was flat, spacious, lit and guarded - and much calmer than the shopping mall spot mentioned nearby. I asked permission of one of the fuel station attendants and guards, they were fine letting me park up. A little traffic noise and it's very open, no shade etc - but was calm and felt safe. Tonnes of room for big rigs.

I assume there's a toilet at the fuel station, I haven't checked.

name: Finca Sacmoc
description:
This place is beautiful! We camped for 2 nights. Incredibly friendly and helpful staff. We did multiple excursions with them. We paid 100Q/person per day as that included access to the pool and the entire grounds, etc. 

Getting here was a little tricky. It was about 90 minutes of 4x4. Our ford 350 had little trouble, it just took some time. But it was well worth it. Highly recommend!

name: Cajero Bi
description:
cajero automatico in the mall. next to big blue circular logo.

$4 US per withdrawal fee. not sure if there was a percentage fee.

name: Hotel Israel
description:
I really loved this spot, it was a very pleasant surprise in such a tiny town. Rooms were spotless and comfortable, including AC, and the pool was amazing. The restaurant was also great, with a super homestyle vibe. Prices were also good; I think the room came in at around 120GTQ (~16USD) and food was 50GTQ for dinner and 30GTQ for breakfast, including coffee.

- WIFI was decent
- There is plentiful secure parking for motorcycles, and enough room for probably two normal sized cars, but large motorhomes might not fit within their gate.

name: Agua Pura Marlon
description:
Purified water business. Filled up our 5 gallon/20 litres for $5 quetzals

We didn’t ask if they could do bigger tanks, but it didn’t appear that they could.

name: CASA DE PERMACULTURA URBANA
description: This is a Airbnb & hostels where you can get a bed or room or camp on the rooftop. The owners are wonderful & friendly. Near to Antigua in which you can walk or take a public transport. Common kitchen available with hot shower. Big RV are not allowed but van type RV is parked outside securely. laundry available.To me it's just a home. WhatsApp

name: Campo Alegre
description: A riverside picnic and camping area with all the typical amenities, picnic tables, bbq grills, futbol field, small tienda and restaurant (open until 8pm). Of course this is mostly a day use area for locals but also a camping area. Bathrooms and hot showers are in very good condition and clean. Water to fill rv tanks if needed. Didn't ask about wifi but Claro reception was average. 25Q/pp for the night. To drive here, you can follow the river frontage gravel road directly on either side of the bridge. No problem for our truck camper, vans should be fine also but nothing bigger should attempt within looking first. We usually stay at Monte Carmelo but they had a really huge group so gave this a try and it was a great option!

name: Hotel Las Américas
description: This hotel has a very big parking area. The coordinates are at the main entrance. There is another door for the parking in the back. You must ask first in the reception. The price was 50 quetzales for one night, with water, and a bathroom possible. All other places in Quetzaltenango were impossible for us. This was our salvation.

name: Shell Station Water Tap
description: We asked and could easily fill our water tank. Very strong pressure.

name: Katok Restaurante
description: This is a large restaurant with three pools. We messaged via WhatsApp to ask if it was okay to park overnight. We were told we were very welcome and there was no additional charge for overnight parking. there is a large fairly flat parking lot with room for several vehicles. It is next to a major road so I expect some road noise at night. the parking lot is gated, I will update if they are actually closed tonight. it feels very safe. we were allowed to bring our dog to the pools with us (online it says 25q/person for the pools but we were not charged this). there are bathrooms and showers in the pool area (open 8-530). the restaurant is advertised to close at 8pm. We ordered food and drinks at the swim up bar and it was delicious. I would recommend reaching out and asking for permission prior to arriving. WhatsApp +502 3572 9434. bathrooms only available during open hours.

name: Multiservices Aguilar
description: A full-service automotive shop. We came for transmission check and fluid change and oil change. They have jacks and stands and a high roof entrance. They were super helpful and got us in immediately with our 2013 Mercedes Sprinter.

name: Before the Rancho Vista
description:
solitude- nobody around 
Direct beach front, toilet, shower, palapa, hammock, coconut trees and pool for 50Q per night per rig
Look for Daniel in the first house on the left side in the oncoming „settlement“ (100m)

name: Playa Romelio
description:
They let us camp here for 25pp, but it's also a day-use area so I believe there is a day-use charge to go with it. Will confirm with update, we left at 930-10 and Monday charge.
Nice beach with dock for swimming. Very clean bathrooms and cold water shower. Neighbours played loud music into the night but not their fault.
Very friendly hosts. Allowed our three dogs which were slashed due to chickens.
Generator for night electricity currently. I would go again . Light phone signal

name: Shell Gas Station
description: Gas station with parking at the back for sleeping, showers, and toilets.  Possibility of filling with water.  Free.  Was recommended to us by the customs officers.

name: Grassy spot off the road (motos/bikes only)
description: Nice flat-ish bit of ground not far from the summit and easily accessed by those on two wheels. A quiet night. Next to an area where some sheep are kept but no people during our stay.

name: “Poza Del Sol” Club
description: We were looking for a  spot where we could rest before crossing the border to Mexico on the next day and found this great spot FOR FREE. It is in front of this club where we could pay Q20 per person to use the pool and all the facilities if we wanted or just park there without any problems for free. We were super-welcomed by the locals who said it was safe and that we wouldn’t have any issues staying overnight! So we did and had a great evening and night of sleep! In this same parking lot, there is a Tienda where you can buy drinks and food, there aren’t any other facilities! Claro 4G signal works well there!

name: Motorcycle shop/suspension specialist
description: For those looking for a DECENT shop with good tools and fluent English speaking owner, this is the place. We got our Kawasaki KLR650 shocks rebuilt here, also some minor maintenance done. The owner is a certified suspension specialist and he works with several dirt bikes and big trails. Several KTMs and Huskies here. Really recommended and super honest price. He also sells parts, Motul oil and fluids.

name: Hotel Manolo
description: Good place. Secure parking. 130 QTZ without and 180 QTZ with air-con, double bed. Restaurant in house as of 7pm. Friendly staff. Hot water.

name: Balneario Chire Ha Cahabón
description:
The coffefarm ahead was under construction and too less space for us traveling together with friends in another vehicle. 

The Balneario is at the river with actually low but clear water. Enough space for even bigger vehicles, as the fotos show, if you can make it through the narrow streets of Cahabon. 4x4 not necessary to reach this place. Good spot to explore Sta Maria Cahabón and the cofee farm.

Simple picnic areas and flushing baños at a quiet place with only jungle noises. The place gets buildt up nicely.
Bernardo is very nice and offered his telephonnumber immediately. 
 
Give him a call to check out if he is there. We paid 25qz per vehicle.

+502 5550-7315
Bernardo Coc Cho (Facebook)

name: Panajachel very steep road
description:
Watch before going to Panajachel. Many road are very steep. You can have problem with your breaks or not enough power to Go up. 
Steepest road in central america !!

name: A "shortcut" to north of Atitlan Lake
description: We took this road because google maos advise us go through it. Not really convinent for big rigs. Most of it build from bricks, you need to drive mostly 10-20km/h. Also a lot of tiny places, needed to be really careful. Not worth the risk and fuel if you vehicle is 6m long or more.

name: Auto Hotel
description: Small Auto Hotel with rooms and garages. There’s also a tiny garage for cheaper if you’re on a bike or motorcycle. We bargained down to 160Q for 2 people for the night (from 5pm to 9am) but they usually charge 75Q for 4 hours. Really quiet night. Rooms have cold shower, toilet, and air conditioning. The garages would probably have room for a sprinter van and no larger.

name: The road of serious overlanding
description:
Trees, branches, rocks, jungle, creeks and beautiful scenery plus the lagunas! 
4x4 and 4L- be prepared (for battle scars too) and have fun(:

name: Into the wild
description:
Nice and calm area to spend the night before/ after laguna or the climb - lill bit spooky bc of the magic forest (further ahead are lots of flowers binded to the trees like in a ceremonial area)
Big rig friendly ofc- if you can do trail ^^

name: An other gorgeous laguna
description:
Half of the year it is dry- half of the year it is full with water 
Beautiful, quiet and safe area- some horses & cows are roaming around under old trees.
We cleaned it from the trash// hopefully you found it also nice and clean >> some fire pits are available too

name: Dunlop Tire Shop
description: Fixed up our Promaster van with two new tires Saturday afternoon with good quality Dunlops. $270 for two and balanced. Great service. Cash only (2000Quetzal in our case). 5850-4175

name: Camping Rax Balam
description:
Quiet, comfortable place where you can rest among trees, vegetation and sounds of nature.
It is required to confirm availability of space at least 4 hours before yogur arrival bye calling 3673 3070. Payment si at yogur Will.

Lugar tranquilo, cómodo donde podrá descansar entre árboles, vegetación y sonidos de la naturaleza.
Se requiere confirmar disponibilidad de espacio mínimo 4 horas antes de su llegada al teléfono 3673 3070. El pago es una propina a tu voluntad.

name: Taqueria Emanuel
description:
The best "tortillas the harina con res" in Rio Dulce. The ladies running the small restaurant are really kind and friendly and their food is amazing. Made fresh from scratch using fresh coleslaw, onions and salsas. Also not expensive, just 20 Qtz. 
Enjoy!

name: Large meadow by the river
description: access by steep dirt road with an easy ford. Large quiet meadow by the river. Nobody bother us. Decent claro signal.

name: Traveling with campers KEITHLYN￼
description: Ideal and safe area to leave the campers before starting the tour to the Acatenango and Fuego volcano, cost Q 25 per night, it has water, an area to socialize, a solar panel and shops around the HOST KEITHLYN ​​will welcome you, you can hire an overnight tour included (food, camping equipment, guide, tickets) option to join a group or travel alone at your own pace, rent equipment. The tour is paid price Q 450 per person children under 5 years do not pay the tour. For the camping you can sleep in cabins For children you can pay a horse Q1100 go up and down just go up Q 600. The volcano is climbed in 5 hours at a normal pace it is hard but SUPER IMPRESSIVE temperature at 7 degrees celcius in camp and top or chasm 0 degrees. Coordinate your visit at +502 35240251 with Keithlyn.

name: The Hub Centro Sak'be Hostel & Campground
description: Parking spaces for cars, campers and tents on-site at The Hub - Centro Sak'be eco-hostel. Use of shared kitchen, flush and compost toilets, hot showers and communal spaces available. The Hub is also an organic farm & co-working space where innovation & solidarity are cultivated every day.

name: Finca Chapultepec
description:
Wonderful place to rest after a terrible road ! This place is a finca where they grow coffee, cheese and milk, eggs... and many more all directly from their animals. They have 2 big German dogs, but very friendly, we even walked them for a bit. Also, you can eat there and chill out in the beautiful garden with view on the mountains. There is one women in charge of the "comedor" inside the house, and she made us an incredible pizza baked with a bonfire and farm products(best of our whole trip!!) We only pay for the pizza, which was 50qtz (so cheap for the quality and the size) 

Just go for it, it's so peaceful and people are very friendly!!

name: Armed robery - Roadblock
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 
-------------
Warning Roadblock! 
Three men armed with machetes were blocking the road asking for 100Q. It is at the steepest part of the road so very hard to stop. They would not negotiate. Best to avoid.

name: Playa Jucanya
description:
This spot is right on the beach and perfect if you are staying at the fútbol field which is free!
The showers are mostly cold although they said they had hot but it never got hot for me 

Showers- 10Q for cold 15Q for hot

Toilets- 3Q with paper 2Q without paper. 

The nice lady keeps the place very clean. 

Hours: Generally open around 8:30 am and close around 5:30 pm

name: Luz Solar Alta Verapaz (taller solar and electrician)
description:
Dani has a small business here where he sells solar panels, batteries, cables etc.

We had issues with our van's solar panels and Dani helped us figure out what the problem was. He's very knowledgable and very friendly. He helped us a lot! He can organize and install solar panels but also electrical parts connected to them (e.g. fridges, lights, fans etc.). If you have any issues regarding the electrical interior components of your car he's your guy :)

name: Parqueo Open Field
description: Open Field Next to Bahia Atitlan Inn.  Next to the lake with great views.

name: Manantial la Vida
description: Clean water. Dispenser 24 h. 5 quetzales.

name: Nueva Asgard Agua Termales
description:
Very nice and clean Balneario with natural hot water coming out of the ground next door. 

25qz for all pools or 25qz for a private spa and shower for 1.30 h per person including use of all facilities like barbecue, duchas (very cold after the warm bath) and changerooms.

They also have a little tienda for refreshments and little meals. 

There are three basins, very warm, warm and cold for the babies, very well maintained and open frim 8.00 til 20.30. 

We came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was of course quite busy. 

Everybody is very friendly and helpful. 
Ask for Leonidas, he speaks very good English!

Camping is possible in a tent at the big grassy areas arround the piscinas only reachable via a pedestrian bridge. Also two cabanas with a very nice view. Perfect for bikers, but also very acceptable for travellers in cars.

The high gated car park has three even places next to each other, all the others are fairly steep. Everything that fits in a normal carparksize can go here. No 4x4 necessary the road is unpaved but very good.
Next door is another fenced carpark with access to the pools with "height-control"
of ca 2.5m. There is a long stick for lifting up the wires. Security at night.

We stayed for one very quiet night for 50 qz for two people extra could use all facilities during the night and liked it very much.
So altogether we paid 100 for two persons in a truckcamper. A very good price for what you get! They whish you to leave at 10.00 or pay another day.

name: Hotel el Angel
description: Basic hotel with double rooms from 150q. You can also leave your bike here for 20q a day

name: ATM - Cajero 5B
description: ATM to withdraw cash. it's  in Tienda. I am told it opens at 530 am. it's  I side the Tienda Bendicion store

name: Puma Gasolinera
description: Filled up with diesel and asked to fill the water tank.

name: Laguna Lachua
description: Beautiful lagoon where you can hike and swim. The hike thru jungle one way is 1 hour. after the end of the trail you can swim. They recommended  not swim where the trail goes dog left. Parking across tge NP was 25Q.

name: Parque central by bus stop
description:
I came here and stopped for the night after previous entry/users recommended the spot. A sop on the way to Semuc Champey. As was parking I saw 2 police officers and asked them if it was okay to park. Got the green light. They said it's very safe. No proem with parking here. 

I would not recommend parking at this spot as after midnight lot of buses and Collectivo park here to pick up passengers. it goes especially loud in the morning. I would park on the other side of this road across the Park as it's quieter there. 
The toilets are in the mall where McDonald and Taco Bell are. Beautiful  Mall. Wi-Fi  here has 15 min. limit.

name: hotel kasa kamelot 2
description: hotel with secure parking (entry with not high limits). We spent a couple of nights here, we manage to get a room for 2 adults and 2 kids for 200Qz. Rooms are average, private bathroom a bit dirty

name: De La Abiela Restaurant  Parking lot
description: Ate the food at this highly-rated restaurant. They are famous for their soup. The owner was very personal and had lived in San Diego for 28 years. she has this beautiful restaurant in Coban. She asked me if I was staying at hotel. I told her I was overlander with RTT. She let me stay for free. Except steak, majority dish prices less than 70Q. Highly recommend  eating here.

name: 4x4 Track in the Lava Fields
description:
You can drive through the lava fields- serious overlanding + off-road!
(Not far from this point is the laguna - perfect for camping!)

name: Next to Las Conchas parking lot
description: Nice place on the grass just 30m after the parking lot from Las Conchas. More fresh air blowing here compared to the parking lot.

name: Casa del viajero Sactela
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

Hi travelers, we are Abraham from Guatemala and Clara from Switzerland. After travelling 2 years in van in latinamerica, we decided to open our doors to others travelers. We have place to camp in your car or in a rent in a beautiful place with a nice river to swim and a tropical Forest to walk. You will relax in the nature and observe the monkeys, toucans and others animals of the mayan forest. Free price and possibility to ask for typical food. We are located just after the community of Sactela, one hour far from the road AV-9 from Coban to Chisec, entrance in the community of Secocpur. You can join us in WhatsApp +41765153604 for any question. We will answer as soon as possible, as we don’t have always network here. Welcome!

Hola viajeros, somos Abraham de Guatemala y Clara de Suiza. Después de 2 años viajando en van por Latinoamérica, decidimos recibir viajeros en nuestro hogar. Les ofrecemos espacio para vehículo y tienda de acampar en un lugar maravilloso, con un gran río para nadar y un bosque tropical para caminar. Van a relajarse en la naturaleza y admirar los monos, tucanes y otros animales de la selva maya. Precio libre y posibilidad de pedir comida tradicional. Nos encontramos justo después de la comunidad de Sactela, a una hora de la carretera AV-9 de Coban a Chisec, entrada en la communidad de secocpur. Nos pueden contactar al WhatsApp +41765153604 para cualquier duda. Responderemos lo más pronto possible, no siempre tenemos señal.  Bienvenidos!

name: Los Gemelos
description:
Basic but good and clean hotel.  Spacious room to store our bikes as well.
Clean bathroom with good shower with good water pressure.  I only didn’t notice  if there was warm water ……  but hey, with these temperatures i was happy with a fresh cold shower.
Good wifi.
There is a restaurant/steakhouse at the same place. They do breakfast as well.
We paid Q250 for a night. 2p

name: Lavanderia Pattytos
description: Very good and fast service.  We were able to pick up our laundry clean and dry after 5 hours.  We paid 120Q for 25 kg.

name: Casa Perez Banos
description: These is a car wash and oil change shop where you can use the bathroom for 5Q. Nice and clean. They are close to the Tourist police Park too.

name: Hotel Casa Valentina
description:
Nice and new hotel near the centre of Coban. Very clean, good wifi, tv and sweet and helpful staff.  Near restaurants and supermarket, bikestore. 

For reservations +50277367690 ( this is cheaper than booking.com)

Double room 260 quetzal.

name: book exchange at Hector's Bistro
description: A bar/restaurant/cafe where you can exchange 3 books for a beer. A comfy lounge area with big chairs and sofas to relax while you imbibe. Not a book exchange for other books, but has a full wall of reading choices.

name: Monarch Hotel
description: This hotel doesn't show on GoogleMaps but I can recommend. Reasonable price, 65 GTQ for a room without bathroom, 80 GTQ for a room with bathroom. Very clean rooms and sheets/linen. Staff are nice and professional. They had no problem with me bringing my bike into the room. There are a couple of hotels in this town but this hotel has the widest stairs if you are bringing your bike upstairs. Free drinking water and coffee. Water pressure not the best but has hot shower. Wifi too.

name: Los Termales
description:
Hot tub service with really hot water and a fantastic view over the lake. Water is not naturally hot but heated by solar and wood, if solar is not enough.
They offer massages, sauna and hot tub baths as a package or separately. See foto. Hot tub 1Person 120qz. Two people 60qz pp! Good price for good service! 
Entrance across from Pinocchios Restaurant/Hotel (they have two entrances), short path to the lake. Follow the signs.

name: Luis De Lion Museum
description:
A Guatemalan writer whose house has been converted to a museum. He was kidnapped on May 15, 1984 by elements of Guatemalan Army intelligence, and henceforth "disappeared". His posthumous novel, El tiempo principia en Xibalbá (Time Commences in Xibalbá) is considered an important work in modern literature.
The tour is in spanish and costs 25Q. You will learn a lot about Guate history.

name: Lake view
description:
dirt road to get to this beautiful spot right at the lake, very quiet at night, just some pedestrian walking by, you can hear the waves and have a full view of the lake, enjoy the sunset behind the volcanoes.
to get here you have to drive by the market which is ok, and they stay from 8am to 6pm. I ended up staying two nights

name: Cafe Cafe
description: Really great place to eat. Best coffee in town. All locals eat here. Give it a try.

name: Hike to Volcan Santiaguito
description: Volcan Santiaguito formed as a secondary off of Volcan Santa Maria during an explosion in 1902. It is currently the most active volcano in Guatemala. The hike starts in the same place as for Santa Maria, but trends up and right to a shoulder off of Santa Maria. From here you can view Santiaguito, which is constantly active. When we hiked we had huge ash plumes exploding every 30 minutes. We recommend hiking early to arrive by 7:00 for the best views. We hiked with our 6 and 10 year olds, who were fine. It’s not a strenuous hike. I have attached a hand drawn map done by the very knowledgeable Geronimo, who’s parqueadero you can stay at nearby. You will hike up into private land, and through several gates. Please open and then close these gates behind you. The owner of the land is Max, and he allows people to hike on his property. We happened to meet him as he searched for his cows. Very friendly. If he asks for a propina, just pay. It’s his land after all! Take out some trash with you along the way. Max’s land is the land at the Mirador, and you can tell he cares about it there… there was zero trash there and he asked us to help keep it that way! Attached pictures of the hike and the volcano. It’s only about a 5 mile (approx 8km) round trip hike, and took us, with slow kids, about 2 hours to get out there.

name: Banrural ATM Cajero 5B
description:
Only ATM for a long ways around here. Entrance is outside.the bank. The screen that asks if you want to "decline conversion" does not tell you which button is accept or decline it listed 7.5%. I pushed the lower left.  Will edit this description later with information on if that was correct or not.

Bank hours are Monday through Friday 8:30 to 5:00 Saturday 8:00-12:00

name: Hospital Veterinario Antigua
description: Got health certificates for our cats here before crossing the border to Belize. opted for simple certificate without stamp from Guatemala city. Cost was Q550 + Q180 per cat. Used it at the border of Belize with no problems. Make sure the vet lists all of the required vaccines on the document.

name: La Rocalla The Adventure Store
description:
One of the few proper adventure stores you are likely to encounter in Central America. We went there looking for a water filter for camping and they had two options. Neither of them Lifestraw unfortunately, but we're happy to have the one from Platapyus.

They stock MSR tents, sleeping bags, propane stoves for hiking, etc. as well as climbing gear and trail running shoes.

name: Thieves with shooting guns
description:
I didn't have any problem in that way, is a nice gravel path, but locals told me (late) that is a dangerous way. recently thieves shooting at a moto traveler and he didn't stop and the shoots only impacted in the moto(like guy). Even the locals try to avoid this way. Better take the highway.

yo pasé sin problema, es una carretera de terracería pero está en buen estado. El problema que al llegar al otro lado la gente del pueblo me preguntó si estaba loco por cruzar por esa carretera, que hace poco dispararon a un viajero motorista, no paró y le dieron por suerte solo a la moto. Incluso los locales evitan pasar por esa carretera. Mejor toma la vía principal.

name: CHICHARRONERA CARRERA JR
description:
Restaurant with good food and fair prices. Serves chicharron and carnitas by weight. Has parking, flush toilet, covered patio where you can bring your dog while you eat. Paid $100GTQ (including tip) for 4 people. 
IG: MoraVentures

name: Bomberos Sacapulas
description: Bomberos voluntarios in Sacapulas. They let us sleep inside and use the facilities as well. Safe place with very kind Bomberos.

name: Hotel Arcoiris
description:
Nice hotel a few hundred meters before the border crossing with El Salvador.
Rooms are basic but clean and good beds. Airco, tv, toilet and shower (cold water).
The rooms are in some kind of a courtyard so less noise from the road. Secured and closed parking.
We had our bikes in the room.
There are several tiendas, an ATM, panaderia etc.

Staff is very friendly. We got some mangoes. 
Perfect place to stay for a night and cross the border early in the morning.

name: Turtle Tour
description: Turtle tours can be taken from here. The tours are about 1.5-2 hours long. They cost around 350Q

name: Hostal El Marquesote
description:
The only hostel in the city. Dorm bed from 75q. There are private rooms as well.

It is a bit basic and there are no lockers. But it has a nice atmosphere. There is no shared kitchen. 

There was reasonable WiFi. But sometimes there was no internet connection. 

I could park my bicycle in the garage, which is the night entrance as well. It’s ok, but it would have felt safer if I could lock it to something or at another bicycle.

The owner or manager Carlos who lives there is very nice and sociable. He offered me a meal and drinks the first night. 

There is a garage, but I don’t know if you can park a car there. It would be a mission. Since it is on a busy road close to a traffic light.

name: Brooklyn Pizza Company
description: Great Pizza place with an awesome owner! Super welcoming with a great bar and even better Pizza. we had the Blue Moon and Gringo half and half, highly recommended. The Owner, Greg, traveled the panamerican with his motorbike before for years and now lives here with his wife. And there is also a newly started sticker wall of fame, just an added bonus. He's a great guy and we really loved it here. Highly Recommended!

name: Photocopy / Photocopia
description: Multi-service shop with photocopy. Next to the pharmacy. 15 copies for 10Q

name: Free street parking
description:
Free spot for small vans or VW Kombis.
We parked near a Gym at the corner. Local people very very friendly. 
We spent three nights here. No problem. Quiet night.

name: Econo Gas
description:
Nice place to get propane cylinder filled in Antigua. I filled mine twice here. Can drop off and pick the next day.
My 10 lb USA tank was 85Q.

name: BioLavanderia IL Bucato
description:
Nice clean and nice laundry. Perfect service!
Price on picture. Perfectly folded with a tie to hold the clothes!

name: Aqua de Vida
description: we were able to have our bottles filled here, all bottles were cleaned and disinfected, 1 garaffon 12 quezal, super friendly and professional

name: Lavandaria
description: Used this place twice during our stay. A but expensive but quick service. 80q per basket.

name: Riverside
description: We stopped here for a swim and asked if we could camp. They said yes. 25Q per person. The grass is flat ish, not suitable for long rigs but good for the off season. Bathrooms are clean, didn’t use the shower. River was nice and cool, and the owner was super friendly. There’s also an ostrich on the premises which is always an interesting surprise. Would recommend for the price.

name: Papagayo Hotel
description: Hotel on the main highway. Good rooms with air-conditioning, private bathroom and wifi. Quoted 150Q for one night, but negotiated down to 125Q. Includes use of the swimming pool. Secure parking for motos and cars. A bit of highway noise, but not too bad. Restaurant on site wasn't open when I stayed, but there is a comedor 200m up the road with good, cheap food.

name: El Polideportivo de Morales sports ground
description: Local sports ground has big grass area for parking that was very empty when we arrived, we were going to park at other overlander spot in Morales but it was crowded, noisy and small parking spaces, for big rigs make sure you enter from eastern side not western side, to avoid low hanging trees, I felt safe at this spot, there are some basketball courts and an indoor futsal hall, I was here on Tuesday night and there was some games in the evening I went and watched a couple, even with the games on, the carpark was still quite empty, the games kept going till about 10pm then it got quiet, there are some toilets in futsal hall but they are run down and no toilet paper, directly across the street from the big grass area is a small shop adjoining a house where some nice ladies had bucket showers for 5 quetzals and a water tap, fairly nice little city nothing too special about it, this spot is far away enough from the hustle and bustle of the city centre

name: Purificadora Aguas El eden
description:
Purificadora free (maybe not) ! I don't know if the guy was in a very good mood today but he filled up my 20L/5galons tank for free ! 
Open 6am to 7pm.

name: Money exchangers
description:
Once you cross over the Guatemalan border you will be approached by guys exchanging money. It seems that only one money exchanger approaches you at a time so you can't compare or get a better price.

Had to buy 10Q for MX $35. Total rip-off as the official exchange rate is 10Q for MX $22.

name: las Brasas restaurant
description: Great restaurant and great prices. It’s  on second story.  Fried fish was really tasty

name: INGUAT Tourism office
description: Guatemala  tourist office where you can find tourists attractions información and maps. very helpful people.

name: ATM 5B
description:
ATM before entering the bank.

The withdrawal fee seems to be Q31.20 regardless of the amount taken.

I tried Q3000 but it did not work. Tried again with Q2000 and it worked.

name: Currency exchange @ Banca Azteca
description:
Managed to exchange some Mexican pesos after all other banks did not offer this service.

Banca Azteca is located within the Elektra shop. You need a passport.

Very good exchange rate.

name: 5B ATM
description:
ATM inside a pharmacy. The withdrawal fee for international cards is Q31.20 regardless of the amount. 

There are also other 5B ATM nearby, but it did not work.

The city center is a bit crazy, not touristy, and hard to find parking.

name: Ben’s Hamburguesas
description: Amazing burger spot with house made buns and the standard local beers (plus Heineken!). Q45-65. Friendly and welcoming owner that took us in when the power was out and hooked it up with lots of fries once it came back on!

name: Puma - ULSD
description:
One of the few Puma gas stations with ULSD at 15 ppm: it is called Diesel ION. 

Friendly service, payment by card is not an issue.

The traffic around this part of the city is pretty busy.

Read more about ULSD in Guatemala here:
https://medium.com/p/6334fc20b59c

name: Uno - ULSD at 50 ppm
description:
One of the few Uno gas stations with ULSD (at 50 ppm).  Clean and modern gas station.

Read more about ULSD in Guatemala here:
https://medium.com/p/6334fc20b59c

name: El Jocotel Restaurant
description: Great restaurant in Huehuetenango with great views. worth visiting. It was too early to eat but unbelievable views

name: foto tolis
description: to make copies and photos for visa and USA passport renewal. Photo is ready the next day.

name: Portal Espenaza print shop
description: You can email yhem and they can print your documents. They can also make copies.

name: Solaris Guate
description: Great people to look at solar problems. they have panels and equipment  to check malfunction.

name: Fuentes Georginas - Free Camping
description:
You can wild camp and park here for free. If you get thru the gate, you will be charged 60Q and 25Q parking fee. Since I arrived at 6:00 pm, a little too late  and the gatekeeper wanted 145Q (2 days admission fee and parking), I opted to camp out here.  Tomorrow, I am hoping to pay 60Q to use the hot springs and try leaving the car parked here. It's all good to leave the car parked here. No security  issues. Since I am already parked here, it does not make sense to move car 200' within the fenced parking lot. 
Note: The next morning, they said I had to move my car and pay 25Q. I saw some people park out of the site of the gate and walk in to avoid the 25Q parking fee.

name: water purification
description:
Water purification plant. The owner is a vice guy. He speaks English too.
Next door, the bakery has great sweet buns.

name: La Rosona
description: A lovely little cafe with the best coffee in town! It's a small and cosy place, the owner is lovely and they have brownies and craft beer available too. She has good WiFi and we spent hours here and came back the next day too!

name: Welding
description: We needed a welding because our bike rack started to fell apart and a very nice guy here came with a great solutions.

name: Cerro El Baul
description:
Great nature reserve where you can hike and drive to the top. The per person cost is 5Q and if you take the car it's 10Q. I asked Police if I can camp out here. iI was Dvised it's  dangerous  after dark. The park closes at night.

great views of Quetzaltenango at the top of the park. lot of locals come here on the weekends.

name: Puma - ULSD
description:
One of the few Puma gas stations with ULSD (ION Diesel). 

The highway is separated by concrete blocks and this gas station is only easily accessible for westbound traffic.

name: Uno - ULSD 50ppm
description:
One of the few Uno gas stations with ULSD at 50ppm.

Read more about ULSD in Guatemala here:
https://medium.com/p/6334fc20b59c

name: Puma - ULSD
description:
One of the few Puma gas stations with ULSD 15 ppm. 

Read more about ULSD in Guatemala here:
https://medium.com/p/6334fc20b59c

They also have a water tap right near the pumps with good water pressure.

name: Cuevas La Candelaria
description: Amazing place for visit, caves are awesome. You can camp there for 50 q pp , bathroom and shower. People really friendly. 60 q pp the guide for the caves and you can do tubing for the river, but I don’t remember the price.

name: Mirador de La Laguna Chicabal
description:
To clarify the little confusion here, I have attached a sketch that clearly outlines what options are available to the overlanders at sites identied as "Parking at Volcan Chicabal"  and "Lake Chicabal - NO SWIMMING" depending upon the type of vehicle that you are driving. 

If you are driving a 4x4 you can drive and park your vehicle at  the new site that I have added to ioverlander called "Mirador de Laguna de Chicabal" The only limation here is that there is limited parking and you may not have space to park here. I came here during the wet season, so I was all by myself so parking for the night was not an issue. I decided not to park because  there were too many mosquitoes and no bathrooms were available. It was not worth it for me to deal with those in my RTT. So after hiking down to the laguna and seeing it, I decide to campout at the site "Lake Chicabal - No SWIMMING". This is where you buy tickets, there is a soccer field and bathrooms are available to you.  

At Mirador Chicabal you have the option to take ~500 steps down to the Laguna  or hike the new Sanderos (trail) down. So I took the steps down and hiked up to mirador taking ne w Sanderos to save my old knees. Keep in mind it is very step grade down to the lake. Photos attached for your convenience.

I hope the sketch clarifies everything.
Note: can you kindly correct the coordinates, if you are at the site.

name: Difficult water crossing
description:
On road 14, we encountered a particularly challenging water crossing. While the depth of the water is subject to change depending on recent rainfall, the real issue lies in the uneven rocky terrain beneath the water's surface. This crossing features solely rocks without any supporting gravel or sand. A sudden drop in the terrain is present and can easily trap an unprepared vehicle.

Thankfully, a knowledgeable local was present to guide us through the difficult crossing. Unfortunately, the stream emanates a rather unpleasant odor, making it a less-than-desirable path to take. 

Beyond the water crossing, road 14 transitions from a paved road to a severely damaged stretch for approximately 14 kilometers. This section features many areas where the road has been eroded, resulting in deep crevices. A 4x4 or a high-clearance vehicle is required to navigate this part of the road.

Unless off-road adventures are what you seek, a different, less challenging route would be a more desirable option.

name: Cajero 5B ATM
description:
Slightly outside of the city center. Easy access by car with parking. Near a gas station. 

Standard withdrawal fee of Q32.20 for international cards.

name: A La Parrilla
description:
Nice restaurant for breakfast or lunch if driving by. Easy access from the main road with off street parking. 

Well assorted plates with veggies and meat. Good value for money.

name: iglesia salcaja
description:
We slept in front of the hermitage of La Concepcion, it is on the street but it widens right there. we spent a very quiet night
---
dormimos frente a la ermita de la concepcion, es en la calle pero justo ahi se ensancha. pasamos una noche super tranquila

name: US Embassy Parking visitors
description: You can park here yo go for visa or passport renewal. you can also take the cart instead of walking

name: PUMA - ULSD
description:
Puma gas stations on both sides of the highway. One of the few gas stations with ULSD (ION Diesel).

Read more about ULSD in Guatemala here:
https://medium.com/p/6334fc20b59c

name: Puma - ULSD
description:
Puma gas station that has ULSD (ION Diesel). This is probably the last Puma with ULSD before the border to El Salvador.

Read more about ULSD in Guatemala here:
https://medium.com/p/6334fc20b59c

Friendly service, no tricks.

They also have a water tap in case you need water.

name: Kapavi Agua
description: 5Q per gorafon. No hose but they lend gorafon for transfer water.

name: Parque free
description:
We arrived at night, there were few cars, the street is level and wide. We slept very peacefully, when we got up there were many cars and people in the park. Highly recommended.

Llegamos de noche, habian pocos autos, la calle esta nivelada y es ancha. dormimos muy tranquilos, al levantarnos habian muchos autos y personas en el parque. muy recomendable.

name: Street parking near Tequilla Sunrise hostel
description:
I was unable to get parking in Tequila Sunrise hostel for my RTT 4runner (They charge 100Q/night. same as a dorm bed stay). So based on other travelers' comments and the condition of the neighborhood I wildcamped here. You will not be able to find parking here during  working hours, but after 6 pm, the majority  of street spots will open up. Talked to a couple of shop owners, and they said it was all Seguro. No problems at night, nice n quiet.
In the morning, volunteer street parking attendants show up to keep an eye on the car. They place water jugs at the parking spots so they can reserve spots for their regular customers. I left in the morning to embassy after taking shower in my shower cube.

if you need to use Banos, the adjacent Parque has a toilet that is available from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. They charge 2Q per use. Nice and clean toilet.

name: Serviautos KLD
description: The Meme shop listed on ioverlander was too busy so they recommended  this shop. I came here but they were too busy too. very professional front desk. could not stay otherwise I would have them look at my brakes too.

name: Mirador Laguna Chikabal
description: If you have a 4WD and a small camper you can park and camp at the mirador. The path is steep and muddy. It is a wonderful place to see sunset on the laguna, eruption of Santiaguito volcano and sunrise on Santa Maria volcano. During the night it is possible to see the lava exploded and flowing along the Santiaguito volcano. At the mirador there are some tables. No signal with Tigo. To come here you need to pay the entry cost: 50Q for adults, 5Q for children, 15Q to camp for adults.

name: Livingston  Collectivo boat
description:
The public boat for Livingston leaves from here. it leaves at 9:30 am and returns at 2:30 pm. Ticket one way is 125Q. Round trip is 200Q but you have to return the same day. 
I left my car by the sloping road next to the boat launch. Everyone told me it was all save. if you intend to leave for couple days, I would Park in a parking lot.

name: Tap Ceria
description: If you need car seat repairs, boat sail repairs and or any upholstery work. This shop is for you. The owner speaks fluid English and very helpful.

name: taller de servicio
description:
Christian was great, no tourist tax here. Charged me Q30 for fixing both brakes.
Quoted Q50 for valve adjustment, and Q200 for complete service.

He has a 450 enduro bike, so assume he can fix bigger bikes with liquid cooling.

name: Hotel Tikal Inn
description: Nice and cheap hotel. it has secure parking but only for motorcycles and cars (heigh restrictions), if you come in camper you can park in street just in thr hotel door and thr staff will check the vehicle with their cameras. very nice people too working here . it cost us 250 quetzales a room with 2 double beds, ac, bathroom and TV (for 2 adults and 2 kids)

name: panosolar
description: Great community  who let us have dinner and enjoy their company. Memories that I will cherish about beautiful  Guatemala.

name: Laundry @ Hostal Antigüeño
description: 6Q per pound. Parking outside. You have to enter the hostel. The front desk will help you. The good thing about doing laundry here is you can tell them what heat setting you want your clothes dried at. It's pretty casual all 'round. They gave us our clothes nicely folded in 4/5 hours.

name: Axel’s Place
description:
Vehicle Storage starts at 250Q

Axel and his business partner Rodrigo are some great guys. I stored my Landcruiser here for 8 months without any issues. The space has onsite security, gated entrance, and covered storage area. They have a mechanic shop on site and the ability to source OEM Toyota parts. There is space to camp and 2 fully stocked hardware stores with in walking distance. It would be a great place to upgrade/repair your vehicle if needed. 

Axel’s Phone: +502 4067-9581

name: Texaco gas station
description: Best price in town and Free carwash with 200 quetzal of gas we tip 10 quetzal to the guy he even vacuum our seat great service

name: parking across immigration office
description:
You can park here and campout for the night. It's  right across immigration  office where you get your C4 Visa extended. It's  open 24/7. Right across is Le Club Evolution, the dance club. 
They charge 50Q for overnight stay.

name: Texaco Gas station
description: Stopped here for the night on the way to El Salvador border. The border is 1:45 hrs away. The workers were very accommodating in letting me stay for night. No charge for the stay. Banos open 24/7. I would stay away from big Palapa side as truck would be stopping over for couple minutes during evening. after 9 pm, it was pretty quiet. You may still hear traffic noise. May need ear plugs.

name: San Miguel Hotel
description: No problem with street parking for our transit van . We could've slept in the van but opted for a room. It was 24 km out of the way off the main highway but worth it to see the town and take a boat taxi ( 10 Qtz pp)  to dinner on the isla de Flores . This island is full of pretty colors, cool boats and full of good cheap restaurants.   Good road to the hotel. The hotel itself was advertised as one star but it was a normal basic $40 / night hotel with view of the lake , nice balcony, ac , and coffee in the a.m. The Hotel restaurant wasn't opened but there are corner stores and street food.

name: In the middle of lava fields
description: Very nice and quiet place to camp in the middle of the lava fields. The view on Pacaya volcano is wonderful! Here is a level place in the grass. Becareful to come here 4WD with high clearance and low gear is mandatory! Crossing lava fields is rough and there are some steps, with a Defender it is ok. One has the impression of being in Iceland.

name: Diego's house
description:
Welcome overlanders to my place!
An overlander from Guatemala that would be very happy to give you a place to spend the night if you are near Guatemala City.
A pleasure to share routes, interesting places and help You in your trip.
Please send me a text through whatsapp if you plan to come +50245121134 or if you have any doubt about the place.
In rainy season the road is a little rough so good clearance is needed.

name: Villas Del Bosque Cabanas
description: This is a cabanas rental place and there is a small stream running right past the front of the building. cabanas rent for 350Q a night for two queen beds and there is a kitchen you can use. nice rooms, very clean, very nice owners with good recommendations for places to explore nearby. Beautiful area of Guatemala and there are many Cenotes and lakes to explore in this area with the Guatemalan highlands rising up to the east.

name: AutoScan GT - best mechanic in Guatemala City
description:
Carlos and his team are very good mechanics and they know what they do. They could help us and our van and it was working perfectly after they’ve worked on it. They use quality products (oil, filters, etc.) Carlos is a very smart, honest and openminded person. He will treat you good, listen to your desire and will not overcharge you like lot of other mechanics. We absolutely recommend this place.
You find him next door to „Casa del Turbo“ it‘s a big green door. ring there. Or enter in „Casa del Turbo“ and ask for „AutoScan GT“ they work together.

name: Laguna da Gloria
description:
On the edge of the lake, an ideal place for those who need to cross over to Mexico. The people are friendly and there is a bar. Women during the day washed clothes in the lake. It's a small village, with a bakery nearby. We slept 2 nights here.
---
Point Nômades. Na beira do lago, lugar ideal para quem precisa cruzar para o México. As pessoas são simpáticas e tem um barzinho. Mulheres de dia lavaram roupa no lago. É um pequena vila, tem padaria perto. Dormimos 2 noites aqui.

name: Volcanoville
description:
If you’re looking for a rustic getaway from the bustle of the city, look no further. These two cabins sit perfectly on the hillside allowing for views of Antigua and the surrounding volcanos. Wake up to the sounds of birds and enjoy a hot shower. We stayed in the smaller cabin fixed with stone floors for ultimate castle vibes. The host was super friendly, and is proud of his beautiful property. Please take the word rustic into account.. no outlets to be found. This was a nice reset before enjoying Antigua. 

You can find this property on Airbnb, prices vary. 

PLEASE NOTE: 4x4 recommended for second half of road up to property. (Rainy season)

name: Antojitos Gaby
description: Small and nice restaurant.The daily specials are cheap (25Q), today it was pollo/beef/pig with rice and salad and tortillas and with a glass of tamarind.There is also a card for those who want but it is more expensive.

name: Hotel Cabelas
description: Ideal for spending the night, right in the center of the village, with 1 large parking lot, it is better to call before because they only have 3 places, and can accept up to 25 feet. The team is very friendly, and the place is very safe, with a night watchman. The village is typical, and perfect for taking a break before going to Atitlan.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart Guatemala version. Lots of dry food but just a little bit of  fruits and veggies

name: Off-road Specialist Oscar
description:
everything can be fixed on your full adventure rig> very reasonable price 
Oscar speaks English 
(we got filter, brake, electric power and serious pimp on this very spot)

4x4 specialist with huge experience

name: Antonio Simaj Tepáz
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Owner contribution. Needs check-in to verify

I'm offering a flat space for parking and camping. If you traveling with a camper van or motorbiker, this a perfect place for your stay in Tzununá, close to Granja Tzikin, probiotics, Gaia Dance Temple, and Fungi Academy. here are some activities that you can do in Tzununá, hikes to the waterfalls, walk-in town, and visiting some farms. the place has water,  toilets,  showers, electricity, and five rooms with beautiful views of Lake Atitlan.

name: small waterfall w/ serious overlanding
description:
hidden waterfall with a small pool to cool down- silent night- only jungle and some coffee folks 
The way here needs skills, axe, saw, 4x4 plus a lil‘ 4low - nothing special but be careful with the several river crossings
Fun for the whole family 

(The road continues but really not in the best shape)

name: Mamre
description:
Mamre is a big place on the side of the road which has a lot of terraces on different levels (might be a problem to bring your bike so high...) with tables, a toilet, a natural source with cold water, space to put tents, to make a fire, etc. I didn't sleep there but had picnic there with Carl from warmshowers that is in San Cristobal Totonicapan, so I don't know if you have to pay. You can ask him. I saw the owner that told me lots of europeans come and camp here. The door is always open! Just in front of the entrance there is space to park cars, maybe big rigs.

You can find them on IG: Mamre

name: Hotel Linda Vista
description: They have shower service for 10 quetzal, clean and have a hot water

name: El Paraíso
description:
The private rooms turned out to be cheaper than the camping because it includes the tent, pillows and sleeping bags (50q for the room vs 60q for camping) The room is exactly what you could expect for a 6usd fare, wooden walls, no plugs, old mattress, but it feels like a 5 star suite after a long day at Tikal
The WiFi is average with a better upload than download speed. The whole campground is on a steep hill with leveled camping areas. If you're coming on a van/RV/big rig you can probably negotiate a great price for sleeping in the parking lot which is inside the place and really nice

name: Amedi Centro Eddy Puac
description:
We were looking for the doctor Eddy Puac on Google and MapsMe. When we got there, they told us it's not the right place. These coordinates are the exact place where he works (sorry, not exactly, I don't know what's going on with iOverlander, but check Amedi Centro on Google). He told me they changed clinic since 6 years but hasn't told Google yet.

Anyway, paid 300 Q for a doctors visit for my gf who felt very sick. Immediate take in charge and very friendly and professional team. Appeared she had deshydratation with serious kidney problems. Paid additional 700 Q for all the tests. Had results in minutes. Doctor is veeeery pro and friendly. He brought me with his motorcycle to the pharmacy and we came back together. My gf had a private room (no additional charge) and the team came for checkings every once in a while.

I really recommend this clinic.

name: Shower and bathrooms
description: Showers Q15 baño Q5 cole shower and clean bathrooms open at 7 am and close 8 pm if door is close knock on the door also one room available for 2 people for Q150 a night.

name: Ciudad vieja bed and breakfast
description: Bed and breakfast near Antigua for 195 quetzal with a private bathroom this is a house that’s a replica of the Antigua Guatemala. Also is a women foundation to help Chapinas of the regions.

name: Amedi Asistencia Medica
description: SMALL HOSPITAL, X RAY, LABORATORY, EKG, AMBULANCE, ULTRASOUND, DOCTORS, NURSES, TECHNICIANS

name: AMEDI HOSPITAL
description: HOSPITAL, EKG, AMBULANCE, ULTRASOUND, EMERGENCY, LABORATORY

name: Casa LLEMO
description:
My name is Julio,
I'm the owner of this casa.
Here's what I can offer you:
-  private room with double bed and shared bathroom, breakfast included: 95 Q pp
- bed in dormitory, breakfast included: 80 Q pp
- private room double bed with private restroom and breakfast included 135 Q pp

You can freely use the whole kitchen (fridge, stove, etc.).

Soon, I'll be offering the possibility of camping on the roof sheltered from the rain if and only if your tent is self-supporting because it's concrete floor. Motorbikes and cyclers welcome. I have also a parking in front where you can savely park.

You can also find me on booking, airbnb.

Phone: +502 3674 1266 (WhatsApp).
Insta : jgme_d77

I speak English and Spanish.

name: Aqua Purificadora
description:
Garrafon water for 5Q, 
our bottle was disinfected and rinsed, 
clean, fast, friendly, 
open also on Saturday, closed on Sunday

name: Bomberos
description:
Came with the bicycle. Very easy and warm welcoming. Slept in our tent in one of their spaces. Cold shower, toilets, water, table and chairs.
Not quiet at night 

Nice stop going to Atitlan or Antigua.

name: Taco Bell
description: Please buy local tacos and burritos somewhere else... having said that, This Taco Bell has free, open wifi and that is awesome!

name: Shell Poptún
description: Gas station showers! Can you picture two gas station showers in your head? Well, exactly that. I didn't use them, no charge apparently only a tip, but I didn't ask either. The clerks were helpful charging my cellphone and checking my tires

name: Solola Mercado
description: A must if you visit Solola the Mercado is amazing go to the this floor to check out the food Q20-25 per plate not bad for the generous portions they give you

name: Café la casa de don Memo
description: Very good Guatemalan coffee with high speed internet, clean bathrooms and a wide collections of articles the owner collected over the years. we spend a good amount of time here uploading files and working while we stay over in Sololá

name: Street parking
description: After driving around we found this street parking ask the local lady Roxana  in front of us if it was ok she told us she can watch our van and stay over night for Q25. We think is fair Every parking was over 75 for the day. Parking in from of the church was Q10 for 2hr. And no over night parking.

name: She’ll gas station
description: She’ll gas station with free carwash when you buy fuel. We Just tip the guy Q10 before he started and he did an amazing job. Quiet busy in the morning with all the busses

name: El pantanal
description: Nice place with a nice owner called Tito, bring provisions cause there's no supplies for sale

name: Gas station
description: Last gas station to take a break before the last and the steepest part of the road going tho chichicastenango they let you sleep over night if you pump gas or park here to go to chichicastenango to see the market.

name: Gas station
description: Last gas station to take a break before the last and the steepest part going to chichicastenango they let you sleep or park if you pump gas and go check out the market.

name: Rey SOL Vegetarian restaurant
description: Very delicious vegetarian food! Not expensive. Nice ambiance

name: Hospital samaritano
description: Emergency doctor visit at this hospital price is Q100 for emergency and no wait very complete check up after feeling sick with headaches and vomiting

name: Mayan Galery Popol Vuh
description: Very good and interesting Mayan art Gallery with beautiful art pieces and art interacting classes with a unique approach.

name: next to entry street to village
description: after the other wild Camping site a few meters away was not possible to enter, we found this little (only for smaller 4x4's acessible) hidden gem with a view. You have to go down from the street about 10meters, then you'll find the spot to the left. maybe space for a 6m long rig but a beautiful view and you're hidden from the street above.

name: Carchá
description: Colorful town near Coban with street life every evening. We enjoy stoping by mistake in the town

name: PUMA with ULSD
description:
This Puma gas station has ULSD ultra low sulfur diesel. This type of diesel is called Ion Diesel at Puma.

There aren't many gas stations along this stretch of road that carry ULSD. There are a few in Guatemala City and there is one in Morales, near Rio Dulce.

name: by the street
description:
just on the side of a quiet Road, before we slept 50m away on the more frequent roadside. 
no one bothers you, everyone is greeting, we only stayed in the van for a short relax hour or to sleep.

just don't sleep at the end of the rosd next to the tope and the crossing - can be very loud! (our first night)

name: Caserio El Florido
description:
After crossing Honduras to Guatemala. Between check point exercito and policia Guatemala. I needed a place to sleep because getting night. 
The trafic down after 21:00.

name: Street parking
description: We park here while doing our Visa extension they have meters on the street we were able to fit our promaster in one of the spots parking is 1Q per 20 min. The process to renew your visa takes 2 hour tops.

name: Street parking
description: Wide street in residential area very quiet at night we stayed one night after asking the security guard of the condominiums building he said no problem.

name: Parking lot next to gas station
description: Big gravel parking lot next to a gas station, for all kind of rigs. We filled our tank and the let us park. Water, toilet and showers available but we did not use it

name: Abarroteria SanFrancisco
description: They sell garafones (20L) here (only place we found) 50Q deposit + 20Q the water only. Not cheap but we only found water here

name: 'Comedor El Mirador' Sign
description: Very nice place to spend the night. It's a bit noisy in the evening and in the morning because it's close (20-30m) to the main road, but we found a bit of privacy in the corner of this place. Very nice temperature at night, light breeze, few locals passing by also in the night, but the police officers stopped by in the morning just to ask us if we're ok but they also told us that this place is seguro y tranquillo. We don't like overnights at gas stations, but we went down to take a shower at one that is mentioned further south of here and came back to this place.

name: Wifi 5G Pacientes
description:
Wifi open in Coban at the northern entrance to the city. You can park on the street
Wifi abierto en Coban en la entrada norte de la ciudad. Se puede estacionar en la calle

name: Broken Glass - Street Parking
description: We parked in the street next to the Convento de Capuchinas, and the police came to the car behind us, because somebody broke the glass and robbed the vehicle..

name: gas station
description: Quiet place to spend the night. It's a parking lot behind the Texaco gas station, there's also an inexpensive dining room, café and restroom. We had a quiet night and it's free

name: Los Fratelli
description:
If you feel like eating something different, the pizza is quite good. Grande for 2 people 129Q, beautiful view. You can also have different toppings on the pizza (half veggie, for example).
---
Wer mal Lust auf anderes Essen hat, die Pizza ist recht gut. Grande für 2 Personen 129Q, schöne Aussicht. Man kann die Pizza auch unterschiedlich belegen lassen (Hälfte veggie z.B).

name: Hotel Villa Del Lago
description:
A/C, wifi, hot water.  The room we had was a little small, but the owner did allow us to park our motorcycles in the lobby (there is only unsecure street parking on the island).
We paid 350QTZ for two people/two double beds.  Breakfast was available for an extra charge (restaurant only serves breakfast).
The front desk was also able to book a seat on the shuttle to Tikal; we ended up booking through Los Amigos Hostel (has a nice restaurant for supper with vegan options) as it was a bit cheaper (130 QTZ for bus a guide); likely everyone books with the same bus.

name: Spanish Es Cool
description: Lovely place right by the lake with private rooms. 400q for 2 nights. Room is basic with shared bathroom. kitchen available to use. There is a bar around the back with amazing cocktails and smoothies made with fresh fruits. Coffee and tea also available. Ricardo speaks very good English. WiFi is very fast and strong as Ricardo works from home. A place to store motorcycles securely. Space for small campers to park outside the property.

name: Rancho María Linda
description:
Really nice camping spot. 50 quetzal per vehicle .The owner allowed me to pick whatever place I want. We had a nice chat and she told me that there have been other people but mostly with campervans. She's nice and has plenty of space. 
You park by the river and there are many benches and tables in front of it which you can use.

I charged my phone in the restaurant but they didn't ask for any more money for electricity. No showers, wifi available when asking for password.

name: Agua de unidad
description:
Garaffon filling at 6Q or direct tap connection. Be careful, either their meter is wrong or they're trying to rip us off.  Our tank is 60 liters and they tried to charge us for 160 liters... We didn't give up.
---
remplissage de garaffons à 6Q ou Branchement du robinet directement.
Attention, soit leur compteur est faux, soit ils essaient de nous arnaquer.
Notre réservoir fait 60 litres et ils ont tenté de nous faire payer pour 160 litres... On n'a rien lâché.

name: Camp site
description:
On the way to Cobán, on the edge of the road, this large and very even piece of land has a small house where the caretaker lives. We waited until they arrived around 4:30 in the afternoon and we asked for permission to spend the night and there was no problem. Very friendly lady and her daughter, they have a pet.
They offered us a bathroom if we needed it.
We left them a tip of Q30 out of gratitude.

De paso a Cobán, a orilla de carretera este terreno grande y muy parejo, tiene una casita donde vive el cuidandero, esperamos hasta que llegara tipo 4:30 de la tarde y les pedimos permiso para pasar la noche y no hubo ningún problema, la señora y su hija muy amables, tienen una mascota.
nos ofrecieron baño si llegáramos a necesitar.
Les dejamos propina Q30 por agradecimiento.

name: Propane gas station
description: We arrived in Guatemala and our USA/Canada/Mexico gas bottle was empty. We had to realize that in Guatemala there is a different gas bottle system and our gas bottles cannot be exchanged or filled. Our campsite owner Alexandro from Poza el Cubo informed himself and found a filling station. He drove there with us and we got our gas bottle filled, 108QT. I think they can fill all cylinders here.

name: La Qurbrada
description: Not in Mexico as ioverlander seems to think but in Guatemala. Excellent cafe, great food, lovely hosts and good WiFi. secure compound with lots of space for camping or rig. We didn't ask but they may allow it. Our route is Santa Cruz Vera Paz to Antigua via backroads and we stumbled upon this spot. Worth the ride. Amazing route. Enjoy ;) (some offroad and water crossings easy by adv motorcycle or 4*4 may need some patience with less) maybe not suitable for a big rig but we did pass some local trucks.

name: Don Valeriano - Guia Acatenango & Parking Lot
description:
Valeriano is a local guide of La Soledad, he has a large parking lot for people to park for a fee which is not expensive and better than Miratenango (100Q) (he charges us 50 so if it is more, try negotiating with him). We found him since he has a big sign on the side of the road, very accessible parking lot. He also offers guided trips to Acatenango/Fuego Volcanoes. You can also rent equipment from him like sleeping bags, and tents if needed for a good price. 

We did the Acatenango hike on our own and got our equipment from him (rented it for a good price)!! His terrace on Acatenango is right in front of Fuego with incredibly amazing views! Make sure you go towards soytours go to or ask Valeriano, he'll give you instructions!

If you wish to contact him before arriving, do so here +502 4521 8217 
---------------
Valeriano es un guía local de La Soledad, tiene un estacionamiento grande para que la gente se estacione por una tarifa que no es cara y mas barato que Miratenango donde cobran 100Q.  Lo encontramos porque tiene un gran cartel al costado de la carretera, y un estacionamiento muy accesible.  También ofrece viajes guiados a los volcanes de Acatenango/Fuego.  También puede alquilar equipos, como sacos de dormir y tiendas de campaña, si es necesario, a buen precio.


 ¡Hicimos la caminata a para Acatenango por nuestra cuenta y conseguimos nuestro equipo de Don Valeriano (lo alquilamos por un buen precio)!  ¡Su terraza en Acatenango está justo frente al volcán Fuego con vistas increíblemente increíbles!  Asegúrate de ir al lado de soytours o pregúntale a Valeriano, ¡él te dará instrucciones!


 Si deseas contactarlo antes de llegar, hágalo aquí +502 4521 8217

name: street parking near Hospital
description: Nice and quiet street to park next to a grassy area, we parked here and slept here very comfortably and without noise or being bothered!

name: Hotel Saltamonte
description: Beautiful clean modern hotel with pool and secure parking. paid 150 GTQ for night with private bathroom  large pool.  Great good from their restaurant. friendly staff.  no wifi. parked motorcycle inside gate.  well known hotel next door charged 250 for shared bath and shower,  the sinks were not hooked up and the shower floor was in the sewer drainage   they did have good wifi and parking though  I moved because they closed the rooms for fumigation. actually Hotel Saltamonte is cheaper and nicer  but no wifi.   150 was for no air conditioning which was fine as the room came with a large quiet fan.

name: street parking - quiet & well lit
description: We parked here to sleep for the night, we weren't bothered nor anything. park on the left side of the road just next to a big white wall

name: Cajero 5B ATM
description: ATM for your cash needs.  Next to Banrual.

name: Parqueo G - San Marcos de Sacatequepez
description:
We found this amazing parking lot with shower (for 10Q) and insanely clean bathrooms for (3Q). You can also park overnight for 30-50Q or so at the time of writing. The owner, Byron, is very friendly and speaks English & French too!

He said you can contact him in case the parking lot is closed & he'll come open for ya, +502 4143-9995 - Byron owner of Parqueo G - Parking Lot San Marcos - he's always open.

name: Hotel Villa Real (Parking Lot)
description:
We asked if we could park and camp out in our car as usual, and the guy allowed us! We paid 75Q total, so for me it was worth it.
The guy said the hotel has always been open, but sometimes he leaves earlier if there isn't much going on. 

You can contact him here, Don Abigail +502 57608022

name: Maranatha Fuelstation
description: Roadside gas station with ample parking space.  Open all night, road noise.

name: on the street II
description: We parked on the left of this street and had a very quiet and good night here. Got here late and we usually find some spot to park and sleep in

name: Hotel Las Estrellas
description:
Small hotel off the main road, we were looking for a place with public toilets or showers and found this. 

Not the best but there if you need it

Toilet for 5Q & shower for 10Q

name: Aqua Equipos
description:
Perfect place to fill your rig’s tank with potable water, but you need at least a 12m hose and a water bandit is also useful.
They are very helpful and did everything in their power to get our tank filled.
Parking in front of the facility is possible.
There seems to be another place in the city center, don’t go there because the streets are very narrow and parking is impossible.
We paid Q60 for 200 liters.

name: servicentro el eden
description: free shower in the baños next to the restaurant. not sure if they're open 24h, but we stopped at the restaurant for lunch and they were.

name: Hotel Del Tío Sam
description: Basic hotel on the way, with private garage, private bathroom. 75 quetzales. Nice people welcoming you .

name: Cooperación Española
description: Library, exhibitions, café, nice building, great wifi, free entry.

name: Starbucks
description: free wifi, nice 10/15mbps, beautiful building with comfy couches & more outlets than Mc's

name: Bella Estancia Hotel
description:
A nice hotel where we spend the night on the parking lot. It was a first time for them and they asked 50q. 

We where able to use their flush toilet and cold shower (don't expect too much of the shower) It was a quiet night, except for some animal noises.

 Lots of bunnies and chickens running around. At night they close the gate.  super friendly and safe spot.

name: crazy route
description:
between the town of Chiantla and Rio San Ramon bridge along the 9N road about 160 kilometers involves crazy mountain drives of mostly gravel roads that are in exceptionally awful condition. 

in our Tacoma and camper we needed to use 4wd a few times just on the main road and took us almost three days to complete. averaging about 15-20km/h.

small towns along the way offer limited services, but you can still find everything you need. 

we had severe brake fade on one of the mountain passes as it went on forever, and were able to buy new brake pads.

that being said, absolutely stunning views over the Guatemalan highlands. only attempt if you don't mind being thrown around by hours of very rough road.

name: Bomberos
description: Bomberos station . Close to a market. So Quiet area Just outside the main road. Friendly people.

name: Belén vivero café BVC
description: Coffee farm with bamboo forests, large parking spaces among the bamboos, there is a restaurant and cabins, $7 for parking day and night, per vehicle, you can use water, bathrooms, and the entire complex, electricity to charge your devices, trails between forest, nice place to spend a few days, dirt road but in good condition, 5kms (20 minutes) from the center of Esquipulas.  Doors close at 8pm.

name: Locked gate on road
description: Headed to Lava fields from Esquintla and they now have the gate locked 3.5 from the destination. It’s where the arched road is. It is double chained and pad locked. We had to turn around.

name: Pollo a la leña
description:
The best bbq chicken in all of Central America! Sooo tasty comes with roasted potatoes, onions and Chile!
Great value!

name: Los Tarrales private reserva
description: This place has been sanctuary for all nature since 1952. The birds are numerous. Deer walk past the rooms. All sorts of animals abound. Many we've never seen before. Not cheap and kind of on the rustic side but good to support places like this. A working coffee production place next door. Tree houses are offered as places to stay. First thing we saw was a Lassons MotMot. wow whatta bird. 375 species of birds have been recorded here. 2 trails here. each a mile long. Natural spring pool to dip in.

name: PARQUEO 'La Estacion De Antigua“
description:
The large Parqueo is a flat green meadow. It was very quiet here during our stay. There is no height limit and therefore also suitable for big rigs. The Parqueo is relatively new. Restaurants will soon be opening in the building.

The 150 GTQ per night (2 people with a motorhome) is negotiable depending on the size of the vehicle.

WhatsApp: +502 3971 1094

name: Contralto
description:
Tiny restaurant with delicious local food. We had the vegetarian option and it was great . Everything is cooked fresh. Allow some time for preparation of the food. Only 3 tables. Restaurant is run by a friendly old couple

40Q for most dishes

name: forest place
description:
Nice forest place near the main road 
its a place where you will meet pedro peter pan and Juan. 
they will charge you a small participation.
quiet and safe

name: Fire Ant Camp
description: Park next to the secondary school.. The river below is beautiful. There is a few homes here and a tienda. Suspension bridge across the river. Lots of dogs and roosters. Surprising the amount of traffic all through the night. But here in the basket ball court you are off the road a little. Good for a night. Tigo signal medium strength. Dirt road pretty dusty. People here said we're safe. True. Nobody bothered us except for buying us too many beers at the tienda. There was a little Christmas parade with singing on foot. Nice people.

name: Hotel Brisas del Cabuz
description: Very nice Hotel with super clean, huge rooms, private bathroom and hot shower, very well maintained and run by a very nice and helpful family. Very good mattresses. Rooms to the street and to the backyard patio available. Secure parking in the patio. Bicycles have enough space in the room as well. I spend one night in one of the backyard patio rooms after leaving Tapachula and border crossing at El Carmen. I paid 100 GTQ for one night as a single in a double room. Highly recommend.

name: Tienda de Bendicion
description: Small shop selling water, fruits, vegetables, some groceries

name: Hotel Ideal
description: small, family-run hotel. very clean rooms, rooftop kitchen, laundry service, arranges tours. I had a single room with shared bathroom (very clean, hot shower) for four nights for 80 quetzals per night, quite in historic center. Secure parking for cars and bicycles, motorbikes

name: Corner at the Church
description:
Corner at the church with place for also bigger rigs. Stayed there for 2 nights and felt safe. 
People walked by but don’t care about us. 
No toilets around!

name: Araco 4x4
description:
Perfect Place to get your 4x4 fixed.
Diego and his team are pros!
They even fabricate their own Bullbars. 
Be sure your car is well taken care off.

name: Lanchas to Livingston
description: Here is also a place where you can get lanchas. All the same price, all the same time. Good to know for people coming from north to avoid the horrible city crossing. If we had know it, we would be happy to save 2 h.

name: Puma ION Diesel
description: This PUMA Gasstation is new and has ION Diesel!

name: Hotel Villa Lucia
description:
plenty and big secure parking on the perimeter. quite clean. the single room with fan did cost me 150Q. they also have a restaurant which I found underwhelming.

internet itself is good but you need to check it in your room.

name: Puma Fuel Station
description: Ask her the worker if we can sleep here, with our Motorhome, and it was okay! Very friendly workers, and a guard the whole night! They have toilet and shop!

name: Mercedes-Benz
description: This Mercedes-Benz garage repairs Sprinters and also sells spare parts.  We had the brake pads and brake discs replaced here.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  Appointments were possible at short notice!

name: Warbler Camp
description:
This is a wee spot to park for the night. There is a nice trail here for birding. The mountains here, like so much of the world, are being stripped for firewood. Horses were hauling the wood out.
