Old people had huge stacks of wood strapped to their backs. Gravel trucks started up the dirt road at 5 am. But we had a peaceful night until then. Wanted to stay at the ruins but they said 'no." On this dirt road to camp is a cheese store. Ice cream cones, too. We got some chorizo that is really good. We saw people getting large bags of milk. 
Here there is a little brook the Gray Silky flycatchers were bathing in. Lots of warblers call this home for the winter but we didn't see the Pink headed, yet. 
If you have a van or small rig you can continue down this road just little bit to a nice clearing. You probably could set up a tent.

name: Finca Caleras Chichavac Nature Park
description:
We came here to see a Pink headed warbler. There are trails everywhere. This is a working farm. Maybe the hotel is from the past, the distant past. Pretty rustic. Visions of Dawson City & the Gold Rush past. Expensive. 275/pp. But that gives you the run of the place. Room and breakfast. Breakfast was good.  Loved the fried bananas and crema.  We didn't check the shower for hot water. By the time we found out it was cold there was no one here to help us. UPDATE they have to start a fire to heat up the water. Give them a half hours' notice.
We could drive the camper to a flat area and plug it in. We tried to ask if we could just stay in the camper and use a bathroom, not the room. But that was a foreign concept. Maybe if you speak Spanish you could do better. The place had just us. Perhaps they would have more business with a camping option. Beautiful place for tents. Banos open up some steps all the time.
UPDATE: there is a camping option. 150q/pp. toilets. They provide breakfast. Also in bad weather you can get inside the hotel. I explained that is too expensive. 100q for 2 people ON THE LAKE. With showers and electricity. Carmen said she would talk to her boss about lowering the price.

name: Bicitaller San Sebastián
description: Selling parts for motorcycle and bicycle, doing service and repair

name: Hostel central
description: Very good hostel, good mattresses, very clean rooms and restrooms, hot showers, laundry service, good kitchen, very friendly and helpful staff, national and international shuttles and tours available, private rooms available as well, breakfast included, very reasonable price. Just a few steps to historic center

name: Misterio Verde
description: A highly secure place to camp with an incredible natural environment. Additionally, there are hotel rooms and cabins available for rent. There's a delightful restaurant where the owners are always attentive to any needs. Highly recommended location.

name: Grassy lookout
description:
Big area with view over Quetzaltenango. It‘s close to the cerro quemado where a lot of people go for praying. 
We had a quite night. It got a little cold up there. 
It’s a little trashy at the one side of the area.

name: Shell Gas Station
description: Big concrete parking lot at a Shell station, paid security 40 GTQ for the night. Trucking route, so expect noise unless you go to the far end of the parking lot. Friendly staff. Restaurants and corner stores are close.

name: North West gas station
description:
Free overnight parking at the gas station. 
There is a lot of space with a shower and a toilet. You can refill water here. 
Trucks and cars came by at night but in general a safe and quite night. 

They just asked if we are going to consume anything. We got 2 coffee at the store and they were fine.

name: Puma ION Diesel
description: Here at this Station you get ION Diesel with 15 ppm.

name: Propane place
description: mellow place. looks family run. no problem filling American tank. sold by weight. filled our 5 gallon tank 108 q.

name: Hotel Victoria
description: We were lucky to find an open hotel in this town, especially at dark. It was a tiny room but had secure parking for motorcycles and small trucks or cars.

name: Low Archway across 7a Calle.
description: Low Archway across 7a Calle just before the parking. watch out. we used a spotter to get under it and barely made it at 3.2. Archway across the street: 7a Calle. Signed at 2.75 meters height.  We are 3.2 meters and just cleared by 2 cm.  Use a spotter.  Best to approach from 15 Avenida and avoid this if you are a high rig.Archway across the street: 7a Calle. Signed at 2.75 meters height.  We are 3.2 meters and just cleared by 2 cm.  Use a spotter.  Best to approach from 15 Avenida and avoid this if you are a high rig.

name: Playa El Pumpo
description:
parking within 20m of the ocean.
It appears to be some sort of public area.
Dirt road access.
required to drive on the sand for a short time to get a decent spot. used 4wd but also have aggressive tires.
sand is fairly compact. use your own judgment. 

neighbors came by to chat. we asked if it was okay to stay here, and they said it was no problem.

mosquitoes as the sun goes down. 
only stayed one night

name: Job Samayoa
description:
We were with a Nissan Xterra on the Pacaya 4x4 trail when, in the middle of the trail, there was a clutch problem and the car couldn't go any further. This was on a Sunday at 5 p.m... In the next village, we came across Job, who was a great mechanic, very honest about prices and competent, even riding his motorcycle with his tools to the car! On top of that, he let us sleep in his avocado field. See the campsite for more information.
+502 5938 8847 reachable by whatsapp

Estábamos con un Nissan Xterra en la pista Pacaya 4x4 cuando, en medio de la pista, hubo un problema con el embrague y el carro no pudo avanzar más. Esto fue un domingo a las 5 de la tarde... En el siguiente pueblo, nos encontramos con Job que era un gran mecánico, muy honesto con los precios y muy competente, ¡incluso llegando al carro en su moto con sus herramientas! Además, nos dejó dormir en su huerto de aguacates. Más información en el camping.
+502 5938 8847 localizable por whatsapp

name: Hotel San Gregorio
description: Great hotel with large pool and parking lot. The apartments are spacious and the receptionist was lovely. Costs Q100 per person for the apartment, plus Q25/p for breakfast. On-site restaurant (we did not try). The overall atmosphere was very pleasant. Fans available but no AC.

name: Cuarentena de frutas
description:
Puesto de control fitosanitario
 Nos dejaron pasar la noche en el área de descanso del predio. Muy tranquilo. Sólo empiezan a circular los vehículos un poco temprano por la mañana, pero el lugar es seguro. Luego de ver lugares en Sayaxché, creo que esta es una mejor opción 

Phytosanitary control post They let us spend the night in the rest area of ​​the property. Very calm. Vehicles only start to circulate a little early in the morning, but the place is safe. After seeing places in Sayaxché, I think this is a better option

name: Pinochio hotel & restaurant
description:
Such good food for a very good price.
4 of us had dinner here, it cost $210Q with tip and the plates were amazing!
We had pollo encremado and pollo on stick, it came with cooked veggies, fries, rice and garlic bread! A great bang for your buck!

name: Police Roadside Checkpoint
description:
Police check point - looks pretty official and permanent. 
We got pulled and the officer just asked where we were from then joked and asked us for a soda because he was so hot. Really nice guy and just waved us through with a smile. 
Have heard police in this area can be hit and miss, but this was totally jokes after crossing the border in the morning.

name: Fuel Station Canlech
description:
Fuel station with clean baños and a little tienda. You can park, but no 'camping' and it's 25Q. 
We ended up just staying at the back of the servo where there's loads of space and just getting a few beers. In a tight spot it's totally fine, but definitely not one you'll regret missing!

name: SAT/Aduana
description: Just had my temporary import permit extended for 90 days at this location. Was easy and quick. They needed to take pictures of the vehicle, though, so make sure to bring it.

name: Brisas del Lago
description: Agua pura refills. 8Q per 20L. Easy process

name: parking by the water
description:
great place to park.
not for big rigs.
we stayed here 3 nights.  busy during the day but empty at night.
have to drive down a market narrow street to get to the parking.  sprinter would be the maximum size.  any bigger, do not attempt.

name: Spec garage gt
description:
Mechanic shop, parts, installation off road accessories, tune up service, willing to help people who are traveling thru Guatemala. Shop is 10min before way to Antigua Guatemala, also there is a market and hardware store 8min walking 

contact phone: 502 59232370

name: Check point customs and SAT
description: Just a check point coming from Honduras. They just ask us for our passport, re check the Guatemala sticker on the windshield and let us thru

name: Touricentro Pavos Reales
description:
Nice place on the beach. Resto, showers, toilets and shade. Friendly family.
Pool on location. Price is open for discussion. We paid Q50 per night.

name: Hotel Petén Espléndido
description:
Safe, closed parking lot of the hotel in front of the lake. Is an OK spot for one evening to stay in flores. You always have to call the guard to come and open if u wanna go in or out, which is a bit annoying but on the other hand felt super safe. 
Cost: 100 quetzales pro van.

name: Street parking
description: We park on the street in front of the sugar factory for one night before visiting Semuc Champey we felt very safe there is a security guard 24/7 at the gate of the factory. Traffic starts early in the morning and woke us up at 6 am which was ok to start the drive to Semuc Champey. Also there is a big súper market in the corner SUMA to stock up before you leave.

name: Motorpsycho Adventurebike Mechanic
description: Specializes in ADV bikes. Is KTM certified. Worked on my BMW F800GS and did an outstanding job. Pretty major 100,000 km maintenance. Valves, injectors, clutch, all fluids, etc. Clean and organized shop. Cleaned bike after service, cleaner that I've ever gotten her.

name: Francisco’s Rest House -  with MOTO PARKING!
description: Really great value hotel. Nice double rooms with fans for Q150 about $20 (no AC needed at this elevation) and super clean shared bathrooms. There is also parking for 2-4 motorcycles in the entry way. I recommend Whatsapping to book a room +502 3674 6252

name: Reencauchadora David
description:
Tire spot for cars and motorcycles. They can sort Shinko tires for motorbikes. 

Contact is called Kevin- +502 30023636 on WhatsApp. Has a website called Keko Moto

name: Hotel California Pacific Palm
description:
Grand Hotel. 
On Google as "Pacific Palm" but identifies as "Hotel California." Caution following Google Maps... it will take you into an empty gravel industrial carpark next door. 

Don't be put off. Super safe/secure. 
Three stories with multiple rooms. 
Huge concrete walled unit into carpark with guard with a shotgun. 
Friendly reception. No WhatsApp. But I managed to book a room with my Duolingo Spanish!
500q for a room. Restaurant on site (expensive 50-90q for main). 
Huge swimming pool. Jacuzzi area. AC. Fast WiFi.
-------
we needed a room for a night in Escuintla whilst visiting a mechanic. I wouldn't suggest visiting the town otherwise... but if you do. Hotel California has your back.

name: Alma Maya Hotel
description:
Hotel that lets you take a shower for 25Q p.P
They provided us with a fresh towel and soap/shampoo. There is also a toilet inside the bathroom.
Good pressure and warm water.

name: Print shop
description: Print shop for all your needs on Flores island! I searched and searched and this is the only one. 1 quetzal per page.

name: Lava Fields Volcano Pacaya
description:
Easy and free camp on the lava field. Highly recommend. Just about 40 feet from the road. 

Road can be done in 2WD but 4LO is better. Clearance is good but there are plenty of older Toyota and motos making the drive. 

No shade. Hot during the afternoon and cool at night. Beautiful sunrise and sunset. 

Minimal traffic. Maybe 2 motos and 1-2 trucks per day. 

Sergio lives about 500m up the road. He will usually come by with his dog to check on you. Or at least he did with me, he would check in on my in the morning and just before sunset. 

He has water and showers and will offer his place to camp.

name: End of road — no barking dogs, free
description:
Completely at the end of the road is a small parking lot where you can camp. FREE

From December 2023 — February 2024 there are a couple more lots and a new restaurant that just opened. 

It’s a great place to sleep at night — zero barking or stray dogs around 

It’s the best swimming beach, all the locals come from sunrise to sunset. Hangout and leave 

Very friendly area. I camped here many times over three months. 

Not big rig friendly I have a truck and camper and there was one other van. Would say 6 meters / 18 feet long max as it can be quite busy at times with motos parked all over making it impossible to turn around.

name: Taller Mecanico TECNOAUTO
description:
Really nice Mechanic (Ottoniel) who helped us when we had Problems with our brakes. It was already past 6:30 pm and he still kept his little taller open to help us. 
His number: +50230362561
His Garage is quite small and in the Center of town. So if you have a Bigger rig he can come see you out of town.

name: La Baronna
description:
Very Nice beach spot, only locals. we dronk a couple beers by the bar/ restaurant arround the corner. 
the water is warm and the sand is Black. 
good road acces couple kilometers dirt road

name: Circles Café and German Bakery
description: German bakery with delicious bread and pastry. Bit pricy but very good quality.

name: Máximo Nivel Language School
description:
Language school in Antigua. 
They offer a variety of Spanish programs, small group classes and private lessons.
Very well organized school, can highly recommend.

(Price list in Photos)

At the end of your course, you will receive a certificate.

name: Parma Cocina
description:
Nice dairy store that sells ice cream, cheese, coffee and paninis in the middle of nowhere where. Also has an attached gas station. Clean bathrooms.


Was great as in an area of small villages so it was a nice treat to have good coffee (and ice cream). For us it was also valuable as it was our last day in Guatemala and we had little cash. We were able to get some food (and treats) and pay by credit card

name: Bomberos Departamentales
description: Friendly National Firestation. i areive at afternoon & the captain Olegario let me spend the night.  all ok

name: Boca Barra Rancho Restaurante
description: Amazing good seafood! This place was recommended by our host and she was right. Its not the cheapest place but totally worth it and the portions are huge! Had diavolo shrimp with fries and vegetables- huge and one or the best ones I’ve had so far! Ceviche also nice! Check it out!

name: Crater Azul parking lot lancha cruise
description:
parking lot of crater Azul lancha cruise.
enter fées 10 qz pp( adults only) for national Park.
On the Rio border so you Can enjoy crystal water to swim.
Nice nature spot to park and sleep. We could see monkeys.
You Can get a cruise for crater Azul with a lancha for env 600qz ( WE were 5 + 1dog).
Fruits sellers..

name: Temos Steak House Parking Lot
description: Overnight parking for 25 Q with showers and toilets next to Temos Steak House.

name: Quiet roadside spot
description: Arrived at the border after the aduana had closed, so rather than spend a night among the border chaos, I backtracked up to here instead. Just on a side street, but was quiet and shaded and flat; room for any size vehicle. Fuel station just down the road where you can presumably find a toilet if needed (think it's closed overnight though).

name: Acatenango entrance checkpoint
description: Entrance to the Acatenango nature park. 2 guys at a booth in the middle of the forest stop you and administer a 50 Q fee for foreigners for a park entrance bracelet.

name: abandoned flat pad above asoava
description: camped at  a pad a bit above Asoava camp spot. fantastic unobstructed view of Fuego volcano. big enough for 3 or 4 tents was not charged any money

name: Hotel Rivera
description: 150qtz for one night for 2 people with 2 double beds. Clean and basic. The guy who works here/owns it is very friendly :)

name: Hotel Posada Rosa Balvina
description: Lovely quiet, small hotel with locked parking. For a double room with private bathroom and hot shower we paid Q195. Everything is very clean and there is a microwave and fridge/ freezer that can be used. Even drinking is provided for. We enjoyed our stay here. Perfect spot before or after the border crossing.

name: granturista hotel
description:
Starting at 120 for 1 person.
add 40 if you are 2.
they have underground parking, behind closed doors.
it's really a transit hotel. no charm whatsoever. just decently priced for decent cleanliness and comfort. On the road hotel.

name: a little bit of the road
description: There is a small area beside the road after a little bit steep, narrow gravel access, but if you could manage the road it should be now problem. The "main" road is really rocky and bumpy for lots of kilometers (had to use the first gear most of the time, takes hours. Locals are charging two times 100Q along the way further direction Lanquin for a new street). At the place you are not visible from the street and you hear only a little bit from the streetnoise, quiet and lonely, felt save. In the morning a farmer came with a small truck to work on the field nearby, had no problem with me. Might be too rocky for tents and too narrow for bigger vehicles - if you need more space you can try the next road to the mirador. There is after a few meters a bigger roadside area. No reception with claro but the farmer had a call, so trigo might be working

name: Turicentro Sola
description:
Just a few KM south of Quezaltepeque on the CA12. Tourist resort with swimming pools. I think they have rooms but we asked to camp. They let us pitch our tent in a large palapas for Q60 each. We could use the pool for that as well. Showers and toilets right beside the pool /palapa. Power outlets also.
Downsides: toilets not that clean. Smell from nearby cattle farm

name: Súper 24
description: Small grocery store with an ATM inside.  Q2,000 maximum withdrawal.

name: Hotel Las Peñas
description:
Hotel around a courtyard just at the end of town. We tried all in town looking for the cheapest. Turns out this is actually the most expensive but the others were pretty gross. 

Here the prices were Q180 for a double room with fan or Q200 with aircon. Too tired to look any further or ride out of town so we went for it.

name: Taller Ede - fast mechanic
description:
We had a problem with our whell and we visited this mechanic. They checked both whells and found out that our wheel bearing was broken. 
They were friendly, helpful and very fast in founding the replacement parts.

name: Lavanderia Freska
description:
This is a laundry in the shopping court
They got 4 large bags done in 2 hours, very nice staff

name: Hotel nuevo amanecer
description: Nice Hotel with AC, WiFi and cold showers. Drinking water and coffee for free available at the reception. We paid 125 GTQ for one bed, a room with two beds cost 200 GTQ.

name: Hotel Oriental
description: Simple Hotel with good Wifi and cold showers. Ground floor room with fan for 125 GTQ and first floor room with air conditioning for 150 GTQ. No towels or soap provided.

name: Ancien Terrain foot
description: Land next to the road. Ask the owner who is on the other side. Small tienda and Mexican taco restaurant open until 10 p.m. Not too much dog. Not very clean.

name: BAC Bank with ATMs
description: Several ATMs to withdraw money, either on US Dollars or Quetzal

name: Lavanderia in Hotel Aurora
description: Hotel offers laundry service. I gave my clothes at 11 am and get them back at 3 pm.

name: Posada de Don Jose
description: Nice and quiet hotel. We paid 300 Q for a room with one french and one small bed. Very good Wifi and warm showers. A Kitchen for cooking is available and also drinking water and coffee for free.

name: Agua Purificadora LA NUEVA
description:
Agua purificada just off the main road on the right when headed towards Huehue. You can’t see it from the main road, the turning is just after a mini market (which has lots of garrafons in front) and a car garage. 
It’s shown on google maps in the wrong location, correct is about 100m further south.

Refilled our water for free!

name: Crystal Agua Purificadora (industrial)
description:
Big industrial sized agua purificadora. They are refilling garrafons for delivery only (I think).

I knocked on the big brown door and asked them to fill our water bottles on the bikes and it was no problem.

name: Currency exchange
description: Around the block there are many people offering to change money. They accept Euro and USD and give surprisingly high rates. I followed one inside to a little office inside. There they give me even better rates, even higher than official. Somehow they really like untraceable notes it seems. Best not to question too much. People on street carry thousands on them and it seems perfectly save.

name: Mirador Mario Montenegro
description:
In the absence of reasonably priced places to stay around the lake I asked at this parqueo.  The rate is Q5 per person plus Q10 per vehicle per day so for Q30 I (solo) was allowed to spend a quiet night.  Only occasional vehicles during the night.

There would be incredible views of the lake and the three volcanoes on a clear day.

No facilities other than toilets which I didn't use.

name: Supermercado Rosendo C
description: Fairly well stocked supermarket with fruit and veg, dried produce and tins etc. Good for cycling foods on a stretch with not a lot else.

name: Technically
description:
You can buy chip with Claro and Tigo. 
Bought one for 30Q with 2G 7 days
Works right after you put the card in. He handles it. Ask Bryan

name: Chocolat lala
description:
Chocolate shop artisanal and art gallery.
The owner is super nice and make his chocolate on place.
chocolates taste super good.
Franck is super friendly and gave us info about Antigua and Guatemala.
Close to the Arch. Do not miss it !

name: Hotel El Paso
description:
Roadside hotel with tienda and restaurant on site. 

We paid Q60 p/p and got a big room with two double beds plus another single (there’s only two of us). It has a big bathroom with a warm shower. TP and soap and towels provided. Very clean. Great views over the back. It’s right on the road like pretty much everything here so I’m guessing it’s going to be noisy. 

We tried unsuccessfully to find somewhere to camp around here. This is the only hotel we saw after leaving Huehue.

name: San Luis Truck Stop
description:
Spent a night before crossing into Mexico from Guatemala.
  It's a big gas station/truck stop with lots of room and paved. 
Q50 to spend the night. They have rustic restrooms and showers but didn't use it.
  There's also water spigots on the parking area near the restrooms.
A bit noisy as every truck stop.

name: DÖNER (!)
description:
Here really is a Döner-Laden 🤩! They just opened one month ago and people are really really nice! The Döner-Meat is really good and selfmade! 

They put meat, salad, tomatoes, onions and really nice selfmade sauces in it. 

Totally recommended, also if it is not 100% like a german Döner but it comes quite near! And if you did not have one in a long time… soooo delicious! 

Enjoy :)

name: Agua purificada
description: Agua purificada just to the south of the funeral place. Refilling garrafons.

name: Body work Autotec
description:
Very nice place where we repaired our front and rear bumpers as well as a a light lens. They were all broken in multiple pieces and the guy that took care of us rebuilt the parts using epoxy resin and metal pins.

Ended up paying 600Q for the three parts, stayed there from 11am to 5pm.

name: Casa del Bosque
description: Hotel and camping area, all amenities. And perfect site to overland or normal camping. 50Q per person.

name: taller El canche
description: Specializes in brakes. Big place, nice people, work well.

name: Carmona Trails
description: Camping place at the top of the mountain next to the mountain biking trails, with 2 firepits and a amazing view to the 3 volcanoes (FUEGO, AGUA, ACATENANGO) it costs about 250 quetzales per people. They can give you a tent for 6 people if you don’t have one. You can do some mountain biking too!

name: Hotel Del Sol
description: Excellent high quality hotel.  350Q for two persons. King bed, large very clean room and bathroom with very good hot shower.  Very secure covered parking with security guard.  Big excellent buffet breakfast cost 150Q for two persons.

name: The Cabin
description:
Its a little cabin in a family house that helps overlanders for a little place to park, sleep and shower.
dinning table, small fridge, tv, queen bed, toilet, hot water shower and a little nice garden. whatsapp 502 52014822

name: Hotel Vista Al Lago
description: Simple Hotel with AC. friendly owner. paid 275 GTQ for a room with two beds. everything you'll need in walking distance

name: Hotel San Felipe
description: basic Hotel, AC, cold shower. paid 150 GTQ for two beds.

name: Hotel y Baños Termales El Brasilar
description: Thermal pools located next to the Mamas place also on iOverlander. Mamas place is a dusty car park near the road with no shade. I rode in here first by accident and asked about camping not knowing the Mamas place was actually next door, looks like the same drive but splits in two. At this place there are a couple of palapas and a concrete car park set back from the road, don’t really notice the road noise, about 7 small thermal pools of different temps and access to the river. My advice would don’t swim in the river 90% of waterways are polluted in Guatemala… I paid Q60 for one person. Basic toilets.

name: POSADA SAN JOSE
description:
Hotel and restaurant, in a pleasant place on the outskirts of the city, extensive areas open to the sea for camping or walking
Hotel y restaurante, en un lugar agradable en las afueras de la ciudad, extensas áreas al aire libre ya sea para acampar o solamente para caminar

name: hotel ave del barranco
description:
very nice Hotel. everything is super clean.  no AC but you won't need it at this altitude. the showers are super hot. Drinking water available. 250 GTQ for one bed. 275 for two beds.

This is not the auto hotel direct at the street, this is located further back on the property. don't know the prices of the auto hotel.

name: Mario o el Tigre offers coputer diagnosis
description:
Mario or El Tigre is our neighbour on the campsite. I think we've found the most competent and well-equipped mechanic on our trip. He has real scanners (not gadgets) and above all he knows how to use them! Super fair hourly rate for our parts. He always has a solution for us! And he and his team are ready to do anything
Thanks again to Mario and his team! I've learnt a lot!

Mario ou El Tigre  est le voisin du camping. Je pense que nous avons trouvé le mécano le plus compétent, le plus équipé de notre voyage. Il a de vrais scanner complet (pas des gadgets) et surtout il sait les utiliser!! Tarif horaire super honnête pour notre parts. Il a toujours une solution pour nous! Et lui et son équipe sont prêts à tout pour nous arranger au mieux ! Ils m'ont reposé un nouveau turbo à partir de 20h30 (la pièce n'arrivait  pas)  et le travail à  été excellent ! Je recommande vivement ! 
Encore merci à Mario  et sa team ! J ai b to make things as easy as possible for us! They fitted me with a new turbo at 8.30pm (the part wasn't arriving) and the work was excellent! I can't recommend them highly enough! eaucoup appris ! 

Mario o El Tigre es nuestro vecino en el camping. Creo que hemos encontrado al mecánico más competente y bien equipado de nuestro viaje. Tiene verdaderos escáneres (no aparatos) y, sobre todo, ¡sabe utilizarlos! Tarifa por hora super justa para nuestras piezas. ¡Siempre tiene una solución para nosotros! Y él y su equipo están dispuestos a hacer cualquier cosa para facilitarnos las cosas lo máximo posible. ¡Me montaron un turbo nuevo a las 20.30 (la pieza no llegaba) y el trabajo fue excelente! No puedo dejar de recomendarlos. 
Gracias de nuevo a Mario y a su equipo. ¡He aprendido mucho!

name: Refrigerator Repair
description:
Repair of normal, propane and kerosene refrigerators.  Mr. Edgar is very attentive and communicative.  He fixed our regular refrigerator in one day.

WhatsApp +502 5426 6625

Reparación de refrigeradores normales, propano y queroseno.  El señor Edgar es muy atento y comunicativo.  Arreglamos nuestro refrigerador en un día.

name: Ministry of Agriculture (Street parking)
description:
Street in front of the Ministry of Agriculture

Wide, flat street, we stayed here for 3 nights. 24-hour armed guards on both sides of the street. We felt safe. Lots of car traffic during the day, at night it's quieter but from 5am the traffic starts again.
There are no facilities.
---
Rua larga e plana, ficamos 3 noites aqui. Guarda armado 24hs dos dois lados da rua. Nos sentimos seguros. Muito movimento de carro durante o dia, a noite é mais tranquilo mas a partir das 5hs da manhã começa o movimento de carro novamente.
Não tem nenhuma facilidade.

name: Hotel del Centro
description: Brand-new Hotel del Centro moved to this place. rooms with or without air conditioning. we paid 150 Q for a room with one bed and fan. room with AC was 280 Q.

name: Hotel Magdalena
description: Nice and clean hotel. Very friendly and helpful owner. We paid 125 Q for two persons. 90 Q for one person. Good Wifi.

name: Hotel Camila
description: Basic cheap Hotel. Paid 150 Q for two beds.

name: Pégaso - gas station
description: sleeped here, felt safe, but noise. but the people that works here are really very nice. took and I had a company with tend

name: Posada el Arco
description: super lovely Hotel with super friendly owners. we had a big room with a big balcony for 344 Q. Not cheap but absolutely worth it. They also have a big garden to hang out.

name: Hosteria del Centro
description: Nice and clean Hotel with super friendly staff. There is a kitchen for use and free potable water. We paid 175 Q for a room for 2 people and shared bathroom. They have rooms with private bathroom too, but don't know the price. They offer secured parking for bicycles and motorbikes and also for maybe 2 cars. No big rigs. A lot of noise from the street.

name: Hostelaje Lopez
description: Two rooms available with bed and blanket. Very basic, no electricity or drinking water,no wifi, but phone signal not so bad. The lady gave us a jump of water to wash ourselves. Very quiet and rustic place to spend a night. Suitable for cyclists passing through. The road to get here is not paved, and some sections have a gradient of over 12%. Trucks are difficult to climb.50 quedzal for 2.

name: Arnolhs - Restaurant
description:
very friendly staff 
Really good food.

And some options to who don't eat meat.

name: Hotel Patzun Plaza
description: Basic Hotel with super big rooms. Good Wifi. we paid 200 Q for two beds.

name: Puma diesel low sulpher
description: Low sulfer diesel on main road between atitlan and antigua

name: Finca El Zapote
description:
Great place to camp, to overland, to rest and to take a swim there is a nice pool with a river water. Big botanical gardens, bathrooms and showers. 

Q. 225.00 per person.

name: Rio Colorado
description:
Campsite next to a big pond, where you can catch tilapias and some shrimps, really nice people around, there’s a church next to the campsite. 

Is Q. 150 per person and includes wood for the firepit and coffee in the morning

name: Casa de Los Volcanos
description:
small organic farm, ample parking, facilities, and weimaraners 

WhatsApp +502 3032 2593

name: La Cumbee (small rigs only)
description:
Found this place on maps and figured I'd roll the dice. Road leads through some poor neighborhoods and turns to dirt. Last couple of corners are really tight with low hanging cables. My van is about 10' 3" and I snagged one and took it down. Also 24' long and had to back out around a tight corner to avoid taking down another cable. Feel bad enough as is without doing it twice. 
Never made it to the place. Mostly adding this as a cautionary tale in case someone else tries the same thing later. If you investigate, do it in a VW van or a similarly small vehicle, and do it early in the day so you can find somewhere else if needs be.

For whatever it's worth, I'm very used to taking my van into some people's "small rig only" kinds of places. Minus the cables, I'd still have gone forward, but it was a bit of a bear backing myself out as it was. I wouldn't recommend pushing your luck on this one.

Edit: after closer inspection of the satellite view on Google, I think that maps just took me down the wrong road. I think there's a straighter road to get there. If anyone else figures it out, feel free to nuke this entire description and make a new one.

name: San Agustin Bike Park
description:
https://sanagustinbikepark.com (prices are incorrect online as of 22/04/2024; see photos) 

An extremely nice, well maintained bike/eco park that offers both tent and vehicle camping, the best bathrooms and showers I've seen in literally years, a four volcano/city/lake view, a fire pit with amphitheater seating overlooking said view (the night guard built me a fire without having been asked, and pointed me towards a big pile of wood to keep it going), a restaurant during the day, a couple of playgrounds and picnic areas, is big rig friendly, has bike rentals, and has a very worthwhile shuttle from the bottom of the trails so you can avoid the 500m climb back out if you want to. Even that was fun and really beautiful (but bumpy; it's a 4x4 track, not luxury ride). 
The bike trails are *super* fun, one way, and well marked, separated, and graded by ability level. They also have pump tracks, jump lines, and hiking only trails if that's your thing.

Pets allowed on leash and on the hiking trails, but my dog is incredibly and obviously well behaved so they told me to let him off. The park and trails are open from 7-4, and I'm guessing they generally care much less about the leash rules after hours, so long as you have a dog who just hangs out with you and doesn't wander.

No wifi, but OK Claro 4G depending on where you are in the park. Plenty of open sky for starlink. 

The only thing that's a bit goofy is that they wouldn't let me move my van into the camping area until after 3:30pm and I'll need to clear off by 9am. I'm not sure if they will let me post up here for multiple days, and as tired as I am after riding, I'm not sure I'll try to find out.
They also have a huge parking lot that I could have stayed in for free, which has enough flat space for 1-2 vehicles at the far corner. My guess is that this doesn't come with bathroom access. 
There are a couple of switchbacks on the access road, and some slightly low hanging branches that big rigs will scrape, but only 1-2 limbs that you'd need to take care to avoid. For reference, my van is 7.8m long and 3.2m tall, and some roof/brush scraping aside I had zero troubles. It's a one lane road in many places, so expect some backing up and scooting over for other vehicles. 

Of important note is that Google maps SUCKS in this area. SUCKS. SUUUUCKSSAH. It will give you two options off of the main road, neither of which are correct.
If you come from the north, you take the main road off of the highway, and then enter through a large, blue gate on the right hand side that you will have to wait for a security guard to open. (This place feels *very* secure, btw). 
If you come from the south it's a bit trickier in that you'll need to do some u-turn jiggery on the highway, loop around the backside of the gigantic mega church, pass by both roads that google is going to tell you to take, and look for that same gate. Once through the gate you just stay to the left for ~2km.

The downside is that it's a bit expensive, but you get what you pay for on this one. It's easily the best campsite I've had in a long time.

name: San Agustin Bike Park Entrance
description: Since maps has only wrong ideas about what to tell you, here is the entrance. Enter this gate, stay to the left, go 2km, any car will make it. It's a dirt road, though, so make your own decisions in the rainy season.

name: Immigration Office
description:
Immigration Office for entry into Guatemala (and I assume exit from). It’s up the hill a fair way from the port down a small side street.

If entering by boat from Belize you will need to fill in the online only immigration form, the office doesn’t have WiFi but apparently they have it further down the hill in the Municipal Office. 

If you have time while waiting for the boat in Punta Gorda you can fill in the form there using their WiFi. 

The QR code you need is not the big one on the main wall but the small one in the corner nearer the floor. I will include a photo of the QR code with this post which will take you to the right page. For vessel name and number I used the boat company’s name, then number 1. They didn’t check the information but you do have to show them your own QR code on your screen before they will progress you entry.

name: Puma Gas Station - ION Diesel
description: ION (ultra low sulphur) Diesel near Flores. Good Service.......

name: Hotel Burkhard
description: An extremely affordable, safe, and clean little hotel in Antigua. My partner and I paid about 220Q per night (I think it is a little more expensive on the weekend but this was just divided from the total cost). The room is basic but clean. The shower is hot (consistently!) and has good pressure. The wifi is pretty good. We called beforehand and the owner said we could park our motorcycle in the common room, which was really kind of him. The location is very central - walking distance to everything you would need but there is some noise from the street. The family that run the hotel are really hospitable and kind.

name: Xocomil - Aquatic Park
description:
Great aquatic park in Guatemala. Lots of slides, rides, and pools. We, as a couple without kids, enjoyed all of it and spent the whole day going down the slides. Kids would love it for sure.
Open Thursdays to Sundays. (100Q/adult)

We were on a Thursday there, and there were lots of students with their school buses, but we almost never had to stay in line. Some rides max. 5 to 10min waiting and most of the time no waiting at all.

You can bring your own food, but inside is still kind of cheap (around 25-40Q for a meal). There are lockers that you can rent for your bags and changing rooms/showers. 

Everybody had kind of long swimsuits, rash guards or similar.  Me, as a woman, I wish I had put some shorts on top of the bikini, but it was totally fine. Lots of people had water shoes to walk around. everything was very clean. 

We were impressed and would recommend. 

You can also buy a ticket for two parks and visit the Xetulul amusement park the next day. (140Q for 2 parks / adult) 
We did that, and eventho we did enjoy that one too, this one was better. Xetulul was a nice, I guess, great for children too, lots of rides like in a Fair. 

Have fun!

name: quarry
description: this is an quarry there is no equipment here but it looks reasonably recent there's room for anything you name it, there room for it ! a little bit off the road you can go further up a little bit higher up but it's all fine very big you can still see the road in most of the places. we stopped only for one night ..all good.

name: Vihara
description: Quirky friendly hotel/wellness centre, very reasonably priced - they offer double beds in a dorm at Q80 and single dorm beds at Q60, or private rooms from Q250. They offer massages, yoga and meditation, with discounts for guests. Secure parking one minute down the road; the owners said they would work something out if you wanted to stay in the vehicle and use the facilities. There's a height restriction of around 3m.

name: Turicentro Las Posas
description:
Big swimming pool complex with lots of different pools, a restaurant and events salon. The pools are nice and cool and fairly clean considering they’re open air under trees etc. There is a pond with two buffalos and ducks and also some horses around. 

Two of us arrived on bikes and paid Q50 each to camp (it’s Q30 for pool entry + Q20 extra to stay in our tent). The friendly staff showed us around and let us choose a place to put our tent. There are lots of covered areas to shelter in if you have a free standing tent and the weather is bad. 

They also have cabañas which would be Q200 for two people which I assume includes use of the pool. It’s open 8-1700 every day but wasn’t too busy when we arrived on a Saturday afternoon.

There was a guard with a shotgun at the gate when we arrived and we’re assuming he’s here for the night.

name: Market car park
description:
The border authorities were dubious about boondocking anywhere near here due to the number of migrants and traffickers who pass through, especially at night, but the border closes promptly at 6pm, and I needed a spot. The people in this guarded community assured me it would be fine. There's a covered car park surrounded by businesses and patrolled by guards all night. I was asked for Q50 to stay, though eventually the guards allowed me to stay for free (hoping they didn't get into trouble with their boss for their kindness). Baking hot, and noisy from 7am or so, but felt safe.

Plenty of space for big rigs, toilets and showers open during the day.

name: Emergency bivouac spot
description:
The summit is very windy, cold and uncomfortable.
In the middle of the crater are some left over parts of a destroyed hut or shelter, including the roof.

Together with some stones, the roof can serve as a good shelter, probably big enough for two persons.

Still, do not expect comfort!

I was well equipped for very cold bad wet weather and I had a good night up there, with this welcoming piece of a roof. But I do NOT recommend to camp/sleep/spend-the-night up there! 

The wind is very strong. I didn't try setting up a tent. And I guess most normal tents won't survive a night up there. If you have a tent made for this harsh conditions, there are many rocks to secure the tent properly.

name: Steep section
description: We managed well to come to this place but as of here it‘s a steep rocky road to the visitor center. We didn‘t manage to get up and had to go down again. It wasn‘t rainy or muddy but just very steep. We don‘t have a 4x4. Road until here was ok though. We slept at a grass lot in the backyard of a family for 60Q.

name: Really beautiful Volcanoe road
description: Road to Antigua with Volcano views! Worth taking this one!

name: Mercado de San Francisco el Alto
description: Every Friday there’s a large market in San Francisco el Alto comparable if not bigger that the one in ChiChI. The market has a wide variety of products especially fabrics. We didn’t see any tourists so it’s pretty authentic and definitely worth a visit.

name: Attempted fuel scam
description: Be very careful fuelling up here! They make you pay before but will charge more than you said to charge. ( i asked for 400Q but she charged 650Q to my card) when i questioned it she gave the difference in cash but 100% wouldn’t have if i had said nothing. Keep an eye out!

name: Hotel La Cabaña
description: Nice enough place on the border with Belize. Gated parking, restaurant on site, as well as a pool. Private room with ac and bath for 250q (one person only). Good spot to stop before/after crossing.

name: Hotel bombil pek
description: Nice hotel for a stop between Tikal area and semuc champay or highlands. They have an area for parking rigs (125q) or rooms available (180q or 320q with AC). We opted for the AC rooms - first AC accommodation in 7 months of travel since it was over 100 when we got in at 5pm. Clean rooms and AC worked great. If you stay in your rig there is a bathroom available but no shower. They have a restaurant on site but it’s only open on weekdays so we did not try it. Right near the bombil pek caves if you want a side trip.

name: Hotel y Restaurante Villa Aurora 2
description:
Hotel y Restaurante Villa Aurora 2
A great hotel with friendly staff, there's not a lot in this area and that makes this a little gem. 
Fast WiFi, spacious room, air-con, private bathroom, restaurant with delicious big meals and very reasonably priced food and safe parking for our motorcycles. There's a swimming pool being worked on here, and caves close by. 

We paid 330Q for two people double bed. I think they charge much less if you're a solo traveller. 

great place

name: Coffee tour chicoj
description:
Nice little coffee collective with over 400 parcels of coffee and cardamom stretched out over hundreds of hectares. They have a large grassy lot for camping with bathrooms and a cold shower though we didn’t use it in the two nights we stayed. Nice cafe with fresh brewed coffee, sweets and a restaurant that serves all meals. Breakfasts were great and dinners were decent. Coffee was excellent. Their coffee tour is about 45m-1hr long and includes a tasting of the three coffee bean processes they do: wash, honey and natural. Very interesting to hear about the collective and how they grow organically. Tour was 75q pp kids were free. They also have a canopy tour with a zip line but we didn’t do that. Camping was 25q pp and half price for kids. Everyone working there was very nice and welcoming. Some of the warmest people we have encountered in Guatemala so far. It’s a bit higher elevation than Tikal and semuc champay so we really enjoyed the drop in temperature. Crazy hail lighting and thunderstorms both afternoons we were there but luckily the grassy field was hard packed enough to drive out. 
WiFi available and is fast if you are at the cafe. Accessible if you camp close to the cafe.

name: Casa Mash
description:
Yummy food and big potions. The caldo de mariscos (125q) was delicious with a whole fish and lots of other seafood - huge! Burger was really good too (50q) as were the skewers (100q) And great cocktails (35q). Easy walk (10m) from casa tzocoma if your staying there. 

vamos_por_tierra

name: Jaibal from San Jorge
description:
calm and maintained beach area where the locals go to camp and chill avoid the heist of the near villages - during the day some happenings but with the sunset everyone leaves 
lots of fire pits and wood maiden structures to use, semi good toilets (but the nature options are endless), nice view, front row parking and solar lights for the night 
the road was ok, lil dirt but no humpy dumpy
Cell signal rocks and the view is clear to the north

name: Don Arturo Gas Station
description: Gas station. My wife and I stayed here for one night after a long day from Flores on our way to Samuc Champey. Free shower and toilet. It was a bit noisy to 9:00 pm and the noise started at 5:30 am. I recommend. We are going to stay one more night driving back from Samuc Champey. It is free and the gas station workers are very nice.

name: chultunja
description:
restaurant just at the entrance of Tikal national Park. we spend the night here with our 10m/35ft RV before going to Tikal. They can keep your dog (in shade) while you're visiting Tikal. They didn't charge anything for the night and ask 100 quetzal to watch the dog. They treated him very well. really convenient if you have a dog and want to visit Tikal ! 
access to toilet all night.
restaurant is not the but is ok.

name: Hotel Casa Blanca
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: GPS was slightly off. Updated to be the same as Google.

Average hotel, decent location (located on a busy single lane one-way street, easy to miss) near the plaza. Secure parking, hot water (but inconsistent), weak wifi signal in rooms. We paid 330 QTZ for a double room. 

They're currently getting a new roof. Workers started at 7am directly above our room, hammering away and sending lots of debris and dirt raining from the ceiling onto the beds. If you love construction noises, then this place is for you...

name: Reserva Natural El Vergel
description:
Amazing waterfalls. You can camp on their parking lot. There is a toilet, but no shower (we
could shower in a cabaña for free). The place is a bit fancy, owner is not really flexible and doesn’t give any authority to the people running the show. So prices are non negotiable. We paid 75Q pp for camping (including 25Q pp to visit the waterfalls). Every additional night would be 75pp again. Nice coffee and chocolate bar and restaurant with small meals. Didn’t try it (yet). Tent camping also possible. Same prices. 

So might be bit expensive, but for us it is definitely worth it for the amazing waterfall and beautiful green nature.

name: Hotel paraiso Ecologico
description:
Camping site next to MACANCHE lagoon 
Nice place
Run by a family next to MACANCHE village, very quite

name: Keep Garage
description: A spacious place with a large door to park a large or small motorhome in a green area on the side of the road. It has a view of the 3 volcanoes: Agua, Fuego and Acatenango. It is a closed and safe place, it has water, Wi-Fi and a 120 volt connection. The neighbors have a mechanical and electromechanical workshop. Very close is the San Pedro Las Huertas square where you can find a variety of fruits, vegetables, bread, chicken and meats. About 800 meters away there is a square with banks, an ATM, a pharmacy and a supermarket. You can stay for a day, week or month. It has an approximate cost of Q.50.0 Q.75.00 per day.

name: Restaurant Delicias Chapinas
description: Small hole in the wall. Good food, good prices, and a nice owner. Closes at 10pm.

name: LA BODEGONA cheap & big supermarket
description:
Supermercado grande con variedad de productos y marcas, buenas ofertas. Mejor que la despensa familiar. Hay estacionamiento pequeño afuera. 
~ 
Big supermarket with variety of groceries and brands, good sales. Better than "despensa familiar". Small parking lot outside.

name: Hotel Posada Doña Luisa
description: Good location, but no parking. Clean rooms with fan. Good wifi. Water is sometimes hot, other times just luke warm. This hotel experienced numerous power outages during our stay and was ill-prepared for them (no generator, no plan), leaving us without lights or fan for several days. Prices fluctuated per night from $23-45 dollars for a double room. Laundry service available for 75 QTZ per bag.

name: Street near to police station
description:
We slept one night here to go to Semuc Champey the next day. 
The place is on the street, next to the police station. It is not the best spot but it is very good for one night and to leave the van while you are in Semuc. 
It is noisy during the day because of the traffic but at night it is ok! 
We feel safe. Close to the plaza and other businesses. We recommend!

name: Hotel Gran Turista
description: Good hotel near the plaza. Parking available next to the hotel (not gated), water is room temperature (not hot) but has good water pressure. Air conditioning in room, wifi is complicated to use (password plus additional sign-in password that must be individually generated at front desk). We paid 190 QTZ for a double room.

name: Posada Del Rio
description: Decent hotel. Location is central, but just off the main highway, so be prepared for significant road noises, especially by semi trucks engine breaking. Air conditioning, hot-ish water, and good wifi. Safe, gated parking. We paid 300 QTZ for a double room.

name: Cerro Mirandilla
description:
Cerro Mirandilla
A mano izquierda yendo desde Escuintla hacia Antigua Guatemala, se ven 3 cerros, en los cuales se puede apreciar la silueta de una esfinge. Según internet está tallada por sociedades prehispánicas. Hay que parquear al costado de la ruta.
-
On the left side, coming from Escuintla to Antigua Guatemala, you can devise 3 peaks, where there is a sfinge. Acording to internet info this was carved by prehispanic society. Parking on the side of the road.

name: Road in bad conditions!
description:
2-3 kilometers of route in bad conditions. It is not necessary 4x4. 
The rest of the road is in good condition.
Drive carefully.

name: Texaco gas station
description:
We spent a night here on the way to Flores. Very friendly staff gave us the ok.There is security at night. There are bathrooms available, wifi in the cafe and water to refill tanks (not drinkable). 
We feel safe and calm. Recommend! 
A little noisy but not too much, we slept well!

name: Shell Escuintla
description:
Era casi de noche y le preguntamos al guardia si podíamos pasar la noche. No tuvo problema, nos acomodo al costado del mercado. Hubo ruido de la ruta pero estuvo bien para una noche. Policía paso a ver pasaportes y titulo del auto a las 9 pm. Buena noche.
It was almost evening and asked the guardo to spend the night. Didn't have any problem and made us park beside the market. There was noise of the road but good for one night. Police came by to check passports and vehicle registration at 9pm. Good night.
